loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana Y. has worked as a fish vendor for 20 years. She is from Ntranoa, near Elmina. She is a widow and serves as the sole breadwinner for her seven children. 

To increase her income, she needs to grow her sales. The loan will help her purchase larger quantities of fish. The additional profits will be used to provide for her family and to pay for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of fish to offer for resale

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 24 years old married man, living with his wife and child in Bint Jbeil. Abass opened his own shop in 2003, with 12 years of experience. He was still a child when he started working, and it all was for the sake of helping his family in their living expenses. Abass works in painting furniture, in addition to houses. He is an expert in his field in his clients opinion. 

Abass is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to start a new business; he wants to open a shop where he can sell all types of painting materials and tools. Abass seeks improvement, he is willing to educate his child with the best education available, and seeks to provide him with the best childhood possible since he didn't live his appropriately. Abass is a person with good manners, he works hard to prove his abilities and he translates his dreams into practical reality.

loans.use: to buy house painting materials and products to open a retail shop

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em P., 31, is married and resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Chao and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about USD 5 each per day. When available from the farming business, her husband is also a blacksmith. Each month, the family has to spend USD 58 on food and USD 74 on the other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase pig food and pigs to raise for sale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy pig food and pigs to raise for sale.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto M. tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y aun no tiene hijos a su cuidado. Él vive en la zona de Puntiti de la Provincia Chapare del departamento de Cochabamba en la casa de sus queridos abuelos. Por la dedicación que él tiene con su familia le otorgaron un cuarto donde él puede vivir dignamente.
Humberto trabaja brindando seguridad en la zona de Pacata Alta de la ciudad de Cochabamba, todos los días él pone mucho empeño en su trabajo para que así otorgue una mayor tranquilidad a los vecinos de su zona; aunque el trabajo conlleva muchos riesgos a su integridad física y emocional él lo hace porque tiene las aptitudes para ese trabajo.   
Humberto necesita el préstamo para que pueda refaccionar y mejorar el cuarto que habita y así pueda mejorar su nivel de vida. Él está muy agradecido con la gente que por medio de Kiva le pudo dar la oportunidad de contar con dinero para mejorar su vivienda.
Humberto entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para que compre una motocicleta y así pueda hacer un mejor patrullaje en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Humberto M. is 25 years old, single and does not yet have any children in his care. He lives in the zone of Puntiti in the province of Chapare, department of Cochabamba. He lives in the house of his cherished grandparents. Because of the dedication that he has to his family, they gave him a room where he can live with dignity.

Humberto works in security in the zone of Pacata Alta in the city of Cochabamba. Every day he puts a lot of effort into his job in order to give the residents in the area a greater sense of calm. Even though his job has a lot of risks to his physical and emotional integrity, he does it because he has the skills and abilities necessary for this work.

Humberto needs a loan to refurbish and improve the room where he lives and thereby improve his quality of life. He is very grateful to the people who, through Kiva, could give him the opportunity to have the money to improve his home.

Humberto's future plans include taking out another loan to buy a motorcycle and therefore be able to get a better patrol at his job.

loans.use: to refurbish his home.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has six children.

Ahmad opened a shop selling chickens in 2005. He gained good experience. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting $3000 to pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy a chicken cleaning machine. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop and buy a chicken cleaning machine.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. Elsa has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts & blouses from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell. Elsa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additIonal stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.es:
La sra Porfiria es casada, su marido vive hacia el interior del pais, tiene 2 hijos ya mayores, los cuales estudian y trabajan, ella se dedica a la compra y ventas D. bebidas en su domicilio.
El crédito será D. ayuda para la compra D. mas mercaderias para el equipamiento D. su negocio, ya que tiene ofertas para el mismo. 
Ña Porfiria sueña con abrir una bodega,con una gran variedad D. productos, sobre la calle principal D. su ciudad y asi dar fuentes D. trabajo a otras personas.
Es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia y desea con mucha fe poder darles un futuro mejor al presente que viven, es un poco difícil según ella por la pobreza que existe pero espera poder alcanzar su meta.
texts.en:
Porfiria is married, and her husband lives in the interior of the country.  She has two adult children who go to school and work.  She buys and sells drinks in her home.

The loan will be to help buy more merchandise to equip her business; she already has bids for the merchandise.

Porfiria dreams of opening a general store with a great variety of products on the main street in her city.  That way she will give other people a source of work.

She is a woman who is very dedicated to her family.  She wishes, with great faith, to give them a better future than what they are living.  It is a little difficult, she says, because of the poverty that exists, but she hopes to be able to reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy drinks (beer, whiskey, and wine, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de carros, el trabaja en el área de taller de mecánica, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de carros. El  socio solicita el préstamo para uso personal para comprar artefacto para su casa como un televisor.
                                                 
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Patron San Sebastian” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco within the Cusco department.

The member is 30 years old and has a live-in partner and two children. The member alternates his daily activities with a business in car sales. He works in the mechanic area. He works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. Through this business the member helps his children get ahead. He wants to expand the car sales business. The member is requesting a loan to buy household appliances for personal use such as a television. 
                                                 
The member is happy about receiving the loan and he is committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy household appliances for personal use such as a television.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with four children, two boys and two girls. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills. 

For the past 15 years, she has operated a vegetable-stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other vegetable operators in her area. Her dream is to own a plot of land in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase fruits and vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To  purchase fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and lives with seven family members. Three of the family members work.

Haydar has been an owner of a store selling mobiles and accessories since 2008.  He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, a good reputation and is well known in his area.
 
He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a split air conditioner and to make sliding doors and aluminum showcases. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy a split air conditioner and to make sliding doors and aluminum showcases.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Celestina works on her rice farm, harvesting & selling rice. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice field.
Celestina  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Celestina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Cristo Rey - El Tambo Group

texts.es: LA SRA ROCIO D.  33 AÑOS D. EDAD, CONVIVIENTE CON DOS HIJOS MENORES D. EDAD ,ES SOCIA D. LA ALCANCIA COMUNAL  CRISTO REY, SE LE CONSIDERO ESTE TERCER CICLO YA QUE LA SRA ANTERIORMENTE EN LOS ANTERIORES CICLOS  DEMOSTRO SER  RESPONSABLE Y PUNTUAL  AL IGUAL QUE SUS DEMAS COMPAÑEROS QUE CONFORMAN ESTA ALCANCIA COMUNAL .LA SRA EN LA ACTUALIDAD TIENE SU PROPIA PANADERIA,SOLICITO ESTE CREDITO PARA PODER  COMPRAR MAS  EQUIPOS  PARA SU PANADERIA  Y ASI PODER OBTENER MAS INGRESOS . LA SRA ROCIO QUISIERA PARA EL FUTURO TENER UN  HORNO MAS Y TAMBIEN QUISIERA  SACAR PROFESIONALES A SUS HIJOS. LA SRA ROCIO SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA  A LADO IZQUIERDO D. LA  SRA  QUE VISTE UNA CHOMPA COLOR FUCSIA Y PANTALON COLOR NEGRO, LA SRA  ROCIO VISTE UNA CHOMPA COLOR PLOMO Y PANTALON JEANS
texts.en: Rocio is 33 years old, and lives with her partner and two young children.  She is a member of the Cristo Rey (Christ the King) Community Bank and is being considered for her third loan cycle as she has previously proven herself to be responsible and punctual.  Along with the other members of this group, she has her own bakery.  She asked for this loan to be able to buy more equipment for her bakery in order to increase earnings.  In the future, Rocio would like to have another oven and for her children to be professionals.  Rocio can be found to the right of the woman wearing a pink sweater and black pants.  Rocio is wearing a gray sweater and jeans.

loans.use: buy more equipment

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 1 Group

texts.en:
Sonia is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Progreso 1 (New Progress). This is a group composed of five businesswomen. All of them are working to improve their own lives and the lives of their families, as they are living in one of the poorest areas around Santo Domingo city. 

Sonia makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their four children. She is excited to be seeking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying household products. She has been selling these products for almost a year, starting after one of her neighbors give her some products to sell. Then, after she was able to save some money, she started selling by herself. She will buy three boxes of household products of different types.

She will save her profits to finish building her house. Her most difficult challenge is to get married in the church. She likes to sing and wants to become a professional. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy household products for resale

loans.name: Norilyn

texts.en:
Norilyn is married with 1 child. She is 28 years old and lives in La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.  She earns a living as a public school teacher and has been in this profession for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 6237. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to install electric wiring in her home.  She has been a member of GDMPC for 4 years.  In the future, she hopes to purchase a farm.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is comprised mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to install electric wiring

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with two school-aged children. She is 47 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Ruth is peddling fish varieties around the local community to earn a living. She has been doing the job for ten years and has relied on the earnings from this activity to provide the everyday needs of her house. While not the only means of income, Ruth is able to earn about PHP 9,000 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 18,000 from GDMPC to obtain several fish varieties to sell.

In the future, Ruth hopes to acquire more stock of fish to sustain the daily needs of the family. She aspires to owning a fish vending stall in the market to gain more income and send her children to a better school.

loans.use: To obtain several fish varieties to sell.

loans.name: El Progreso De La Aviacion Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  El progreso de la aviación está conformado por diez integrantes de la misma comunidad con deseos de salir adelante y  tener un negocio propio, la mayoria son mujeres independientes que le gusta superarse y luchar para ser felices.
La representante de este grupo es la señora  Otilia quien se dedica a la venta de  de zapatos desde hace siete meses le  gusta mucho su  negocio por que tiene  muchos clientes  y da sus zapatos en pagos para que así  sus clientes ahorren para pagarle.
Es una señora  trabajadora  no está  casada y no tiene hijos pero tiene sobrinos y hermanas quienes viven con ella y está muy contenta  trabaja de  secretaria y tiene su propio negocio de zapatos.
Pidió el préstamo para  comprar más calzado como son: zapatillas, tenis y huaraches ya que es lo que más se vende.
Los otros integrantes se llaman:
Cristina Magdalena- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Wendolid  Viridiana- se dedica a la venta de tamales.
Rosalba – se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Rossana- se  dedica   a la venta de comida.
Felipe – se dedica  a  la  venta  de perfumes.
Aurea – se   dedica  a  la venta de ropa.
 Isidra  -  se dedica  a  la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Vilma Flor -  se  dedica  a  la  venta  de tamales.
Cenobia  - se dedica  a   la   venta de tamales.

Le dan las  gracias a fundación por la confianza y el apoyo que le ha dado dios y la fundación para salir adelante y triunfar en un futuro.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Progreso de la Aviación” and has ten members from the same community who want to get ahead and have businesses of their own.  Most are independent women who like to improve themselves and strive to be happy.

The group representative is Otilia who has been selling shoes for the last seven months.  She likes her business very much because she has many customers and she sell her shoes in installments to that her customers can save up to pay her.  She’s a hardworking woman who is unmarried and has no children but she does have nieces, nephews and sisters living with her.  She’s very happy.   She’s employed as a secretary and also has her own shoe business.  She requested the loan to buy more footwear like sandals, tennis shoes and huaraches which are the best sellers.

The other members are:

Cristina Magdalena- sells food.
Wendolid  Viridiana- sells tamales.
Rosalba – sells perfume.
Rossana- sells food.
Felipe – sells perfume.
Aurea – sells clothes.
Isidra  -  sells Mexican fast food snacks.
Vilma Flor -  sells tamales.
Cenobia  - sells tamales.

They thank the Fundación for the trust placed in them and for the support they’ve gotten form God and from the Fundación to get ahead and triumph in the future.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri is 56 years old and married with four children. Her husband is retired and all of her children are married. She has been selling items used for daily needs in her store for 10 years. This is her third loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She will use this loan to buy more rice, eggs, flour, sugar and snacks in bigger quantity to resell in her store.

Her favorite part of doing this business is serving and meeting the customers. Her store has a good potential opportunity to grow because it is located where there are only a few stores. Her future plan is to extend her store space and sell a greater variety of things. She hopes she can continue to live happily with her husband with this income.

loans.use: to buy rice, eggs, flour, sugar and snacks to resell in her store

loans.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
Rosa, por la necesidad de aumentar el negocio, está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo, para invertirlo en ropa, comprara camisas, blusas, ropa de niños e interior, la inversión anterior le dio un equilibrio en la mercadería, para ofrecer a los clientes, se mantuvo con las ventas, y con los clientes.
Ella considera que ha mejorado su capacidad y espera tener mejores resultados de la presente inversión.
texts.en: Rosa needs to grow her business which is why she asking for another loan. She will invest this in buying clothes; she will buy shirts, blouses, children's clothing and underwear. The previous loan gave her a balanced merchandise to offer her customers and she maintained both sales and customers. She believes this has improved her capacity and she expects to have better results with this current investment.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, children's clothing and underwear.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 58 years old and lives in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor. She is separated from her husband and has 4 adult children.

Angelita sells caught fish for a living.  She has been doing this for 18 years. She earns 6,000 PHP each month.  She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Angelita has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for more than one year.  In the future, Angelita hopes to sustain her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena is 57 years of age. She is thankful because she has been blessed with three children. Lucena is widowed for 13 years. She says that being single is very difficult but, Lucena makes her best to meet their needs. She is engaged in hog-raising business for 20 years and earns approximately PHP 8,000 every four months. She says that the most tiresome part is to clean the piggery every day. Aside from it, Lucena also engaged in her sari-sari store for two years for their additional income. She dreams to lift her family from poor living, that’s why she works hard through her businesses. She wants also to provide the necessities needed of her pigs, therefore she avail a loan amount P10,000 to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes this will make them fit and nourish to provide higher sales at disposing time, and she hopes to grow her business to secure her family living.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Eugenio, de 53 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive junto a Margarita en su casa propia y desean mejorar su calidad de vida. Eugenio, es un hombre muy trabajador, desde muy temprano se levanta para poder trabajar en su propio auto; se moviliza desde la ciudad de Quimbiri hasta la ciudad de Pichari. Tiene 11 años realizando esta actividad, y hasta el momento le ha ido bien, ya que gracias a ello puede sustentar a su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes. En adelante piensa abrir un negocio de abarrotes para su pareja: ya que así pueden apoyarse mutuamente para llevar más adelante una vida tranquila. Este es su préstamo numero 02 con MFP, esta alegre porque contará con el apoyo financiero para que así pueda cumplir con su objetivo. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá abrir una tienda para su pareja comprando productos como: variedades de gaseosas, fideos, arroz, menestras, azúcar, conservas, etc.
texts.en: Eugenio is 53 and he is a hardworking man. He lives with Margarita in their own house, and they wish to improve their standard of living. Eugenio is a very hardworking man who gets up early to work with his taxi, driving customers from the town of Quimbiri to the town of Pichari. He has been engaged in this activity for 11 years, and up to now things have been going well, as thanks to this job he can provide for his family. What he likes the most about his job is to chat with his customers. In the future he is planning on opening a general store for his life partner, so that they can support each other economically to lead a peaceful life in the future. This is his second loan with MFP, and he is happy about it because he will be able to count on financial support to carry out his project. The 1,500 PEN requested he will be able to open a shop for his life partner by buying products such as different kinds of fizzy drinks, noodles, rice, vegetable stews, sugar and canned food.

loans.use: To buy various kinds of fizzy drinks, noodles, rice, vegetable stews, sugar and canned food.

loans.name: Heldy Martina

texts.es:
Heldy tiene 40 años de edad y vive con su familia en la hermosa provincia de Guanacaste. La economía de esta provincia de Guanacaste se fundamenta principalmente en la ganadería, aunque también en esta región se practican la apicultura y acuacultura. Ella desde hace diez años se ha dedica a este negocio.

Ella tiene el apoyo y la ayuda de su familia, lo cual le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además el negocio le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte y que los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.
 
Heldy está solicitando un préstamo de ₡598 000 (quinientos noventa y ocho mil colones) para la compra de mas mercadería como camisas, camisetas, shorts, zapatos y bisutería. Esto para obtener mayores ingresos económicos y tener mejores condiciones de vida para ella y su familia.

Heldy es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Florida S.A, una de las más de 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA. Este será su segundo préstamo con la empresa y  con el espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Heldy is 40 years old and lives with her family in the lovely province of Guanacaste. The economy in Guanacaste is principally based in livestock, and there are also people who work with bees and fish. She has worked in her business for 10 years. She has the support and help of her family, which makes her job easier. Furthermore, her business is very interesting to her, as she has seen it grown little by little and seen the increase in demand and the neighbors and community members who have felt satisfied with the service provided.

Heldy is asking for a loan of 598,000 colones to buy more merchandise like shirts, t-shirts, shorts, shoes, and jewelry. This will allow her to earn more money and have better living conditions for herself and for her family. Heldy is a member of the Florida Communal Credit Union, one of more than 150 such groups in EDESA. This will be her second loan with the business and she hopes to use it to continue growing personally and economically, as well as actively participate in the loan organization in her community.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 3 Group

texts.es:
El comité fue formado gracias a la gestión de una de las miembros. Ella, al enterarse sobre el programa de la Fundación, contactó con sus vecinas y amigas emprendedoras para formar el comité en la zona. Mujeres Unidas 3 se llama , en a las señoras muy solidarias y cooperadoras, están en el Cuarto Ciclo con 11  integrantes. Es un grupo muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes tienen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que siempre están pendiente de cualquier tema, pues les interesa mucho.
Una de las miembros es la señora Zunilda, quien tiene una Despensa. Ella comenta que tiene un negocio bien surtido, el cual la ayuda a poder tener los ingresos que necesita para poder ayudar a su familia y su casa. Una de sus metas es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder tener mayores ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder surtir su negocio con comestibles, bebidas, panificados, lácteos y demás insumos de primera necesidad. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to the efforts of one of its members. Upon hearing about the program offered by Fundación Paraguaya, she contacted her neighbors and friends who are entrepreneurs in order to establish a local committee. This group is called “Mujeres Unidas 3” (United Women 3), a group of united and cooperative ladies who are in their eleventh loan cycle with 11 members. They are a unified, supportive, and responsible group and possess a great entrepreneurial spirit. All of them are always aware of any issue and take great interest in each one.

One of the members is Sra. Zunilda, who manages a food pantry. She says that she has a well-stocked business, which helps her to have the income necessary to help her family and her household. One of her goals is to continue growing and generating more income. Zunilda is requesting a loan to restock her business with food products, beverages, baked goods, dairy goods, and other basic necessities. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy food products, beverages, baked goods, dairy goods, and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa además de ser amable y solidaria. Está casada con Ronald quien es docente, y fruto de esa unión tiene 03 hijos. Juntos habitan en su porpia casa en compañía de su suegra. La actividad que realiza Elsa es la confección y venta de ropa intima de damas y niños, para lo cual cuenta con una maquina de coser que compró con sus ahorros, y aprendiendo por cuenta. Tiene más de 03 años realizando está actividad, y hoy ha crecido su negocio y tiene mucha demanda de sus confecciones, asimismo su hermana la aestá ayudando y poco a poco aprendiendo del negocio. Le gusta lo que hace, ya que puede contar con un ingreso económico para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Por lo contrario no le gusta, el cansancio físico que le ocasiona por estar en una misma postura, pero aún así desea continuar trabajando y ampliar su negocio confeccionando faldas y blusas para surtir su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado comenta estar cómoda con su grupo de su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para costura como telas, blondas elásticos y otros.
texts.en:
Elsa is 44 years old.  She’s a hardworking, enterprising woman who is also kind and supportive.  She’s married to Ronald who is a teacher and they have three children.  They live together in their own house with her mother-in-law.  

Elsa’s activity is making and selling women’s and children’s intimate wear.  To do so, she has a sewing machine that she bought with her savings and learned on her own.  She’s been in this activity for more than three years and today the business has grown quite a bit and her items are in high demand.  Her sister is helping her and gradually learning the business.  

She enjoys what she does because she can count on steady income to help her husband with household expenses.  On the other hand, she dislikes the physical fatigue being in the same position causes but even so wants to continue working and expanding the business making skirts and blouses to stock her business.

This will be MFP loan #2 so she’s hoping for your collaboration to continue with her objectives.  On the other hand, she comments that she’s comfortable in her communal bank’s group because she considers the members to be responsible and supportive.   She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy sewing supplies like fabric, lace, elastic and others.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas y cada una está luchando por salir adelante y dar a sus familias lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Ellas también están dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza, luchando por poder mejorar sus vidas y la de sus seres queridos.
Maria se dedica a la venta de comidas, ella misma las prepara y las sale a vender. Con mucho sacrificio está saliendo adelante y ayudando a su familia. Es una persona muy entusiasta que siempre está contenta en cada capacitación que recibe.
Ella pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, condimentos, y demás, que le permitirá seguir haciendo sus comidas para la venta, y mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Kuña Guapa is in its seventh loan cycle in the women's committee program.  Each and every one of them is striving to get ahead and give their families what they weren't able to have.  They are also in the poverty elimination program, striving to be able to improve life for themselves and their loved ones.

María earns a living selling food that she herself prepares and goes out to sell.  With a lot of hard work she's getting ahead and helping her family.  She's a very enthusiastic person who's always happy in the training sessions.

María's requesting this loan to be able to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and other ingredients so she can keep on making her meals to sell and improving her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and other ingredients

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria G. is part of Mifex’s first class of borrowers. Not only has she repaid her first loan successfully, she already knows exactly how she plans to use the money from her next loan. She and her husband started this business over 30 years ago when all they had was $10, and they sold treats to children. As they grew, Ms. G. and her husband began selling basic household items to customers from the neighborhood. As her only source of income, Maria knows that she has to keep business going well all throughout the year. Luckily, Mifex offers insurance to our borrowers in times of sickness and disaster so they can cope with many of life’s struggles.

Maria is asking for a new loan so that she can be able to purchase more goods in cash and receive discounts from her distributors. This will create more healthy competition and ultimately bring more clients into her store. Because many of the formal banks consider inhabitants of Ms. G.’s "zona" high risk, they do not loan to them. Maria realizes what an incredible opportunity it is to have Mifex and Kiva administering her loan when no one else will. She intends to buy rice, sugar, and cleaning supplies for her store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She intends to buy rice, sugar, and cleaning supplies for her store.

loans.name: Ab.rahman

texts.en:
Ab. Rahman was born in 1979 and lives in a  household of 6 in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Ab.Rahman has 3 years' experince in selling gas. At the start he had one gas balloon, then he took a loan from AFSG and bought several balloons and carts to increase his business and cover his family expenses.

Ab.Rahman studied up to the 10th grade, but then he had to leave to make money. He is a good sales person. He sells 70 kilos of gas per day. He believes that by being a good client of AFSG he can take more another loan to get a shop and increase his business.

loans.use: Buying fuel, gas

loans.name: Sakena

texts.en:
Sakena is 62 years old and lives in a household of four in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an old woman who took a loan for her son who had a shop of fuel and gas. She therefore took the loan to buy gas, fuel and balloons of gas to support his family financially because he is the worker of the house. He is glad to increase his business.


Note: the picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur in Afghanistan it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: Buying Fuel & Gas.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Mrs. Yun S. Y. is 37 years old and operates a small grocery stand with her husband in Kampong Chnang, Cambodia.  Together, they have 1 child who goes to school every day.  This loan will be used for Mrs. Yun to purchase more grocery products for their store.  In the future, she hopes to continue growing her business and eventually dreams of becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đặng Thị Đạt, 44 years of age, lives with her husband and their five children in Nghi Lộc, in the province of Nghệ An. In 2003 she contracted a loan of 200 USD. She used this money to buy a calf. After 4 months, she sold the calf for 250 USD. The profit from selling the calf was a big motivation factor for her to continue. She contracted another loan after that to start businesses of pig raising and liquor making. The liquor making business brings in 2.5 USD daily. With this revenue, Mrs Đạt repaid the loan and the daily expenses. The waste from her liquor making is used to feed her pigs, this helps cut the cost of pig food. Running both businesses in parallel is quite convenient, it helps reduce considerably the time it takes raising the pigs. Mrs Đạt is requesting a loan of 325 USD. With this loan she would buy 8 breeding pigs and a peep of egg laying chickens. Selling the eggs would bring in enough revenue to pay her weekly expenses. For the pigs she hopes to sell them in the new year, this would bring in 500 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Năm nay 44 tuổi, chị Đặng Thị Đạt sống cùng chồng và 5 người con tại Nghi Lộc, Nghệ An. Với số vốn vay 200 USD vào năm 2003, chị mua một con nghé và sau 4 tháng chị bán lại được 250 USD. Số tiền lãi 50 USD từ việc bán nghé là sự khích lệ lớn cho chị Đặng Thị Đạt về việc vay vốn sản xuất. Những vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, nấu rượu. Mỗi ngày chị lãi khoảng 2.5 USD từ việc nấu rượu. Khoản thu nhập này giúp chị trang trải những chi phí hàng ngày và trả tiền tuần cho Quỹ Tình thương. Bên cạnh đó bã rượu có thể dùng làm thức ăn cho lợn. Việc kết hợp giữa nuôi lợn và nấu rượu vừa giúp chị giảm một khoản đáng kể chi phí chăn nuôi. Chị đang làm đơn xin vay 325 USD để mua 8 con lợn giống cùng một số gà đẻ. Số trứng gà bán được sẽ giúp chị hoàn trả tiền tuần. Chị hy vọng lứa lợn sắp mua vào dịp Tết sẽ mang về cho chị khoảng 500 USD.

loans.use: buy 8 pigs and egg-laying hens

loans.name: Aqadur

texts.ru:
Agadur A., was born in 1979 in Agsu. He is a family man and has 2 children. In 2002 Agadur opened his meat selling business. He purchased a small business location and equipped it. He did not have enough resources to repair the place of business. Agadur turned to the Agsu division of Normicro, borrowed $500 and made small repairs. Now he plans on expanding his business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдуллаев Агадур. Родилься 1979 году в городе Аксу. Семейный, имеет двоих детей. 2000 году открыл свой бизнес по торговли мясо. Купил маленкую точку и оборудовал. Не было средство чтобы отремонтировать свою точку. Агадур обратилсья в Нормикро Аксуниский филиал. Взял кредит на сумму 500$ и сделал небольщой ремонт. Теперь он хочеть расширять свой бизнес.

loans.use: To repair his shop

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Mrs. Chhuon T., age 47, is divorced, runs a flower stand, and lives with her three children. One of her children is a policeman, one is employed at a private company, and the last is a student. She requests a loan of $1100 to purchase more flowers for her inventory and purchase ten piglets to raise for additional income to support her children.

loans.use: To purchase more flowers for her inventory and purchase ten piglets to raise for additional income to support her children.

loans.name: Maura Alejandra's Group

texts.es:
Maura and Santosa have been members of the Alondras community bank for 13 and 2 years, respectively. Maura is 48 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children, while Santosa is 30, married and has 2 children.

Maura tells us that when she joined the communal bank she had 2 dollars in savings, and they both say that the communal bank has taught them things that help them out in their daily life, and that they have learned to be punctual, responsible and to save.

Maura and her family make beautiful artisan weavings such as blankets, rugs, carpets, and runners that are sold in the Santa Clara market in the city of Ayacucho. Besides the weavings, they have a small convenience store in their house.

Santosa, on the other hand, sells soft drinks, bread, fruit and candy from a kiosk located at a gas station, and she also sells clothing at market in the region, such as San Francisco and Santa Rosa, among others.

Maura and Santosa need loans which will be invested in the purchase of soft drinks, apples, oranges, bananas, peaches, candy, cookies, gum, toilet paper, shampoo, soap, wool and dyes. Their savings will be used for medical checkups, to build houses and for emergencies.

Maura and Santosa's dreams are to have a nice house, to buy land and build a house, to have a bigger business, to sell their products outsiD. of their region and for their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Maura y Santosa son socias del Banco Comunal Alondras hace 13 y 2 años respectivamente. Maura tiene 48 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, mientras que Santosa tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos.

Maura cuenta que cuando inició en su Banco Comunal lo hizo con 2 dólares D. ahorro y ambas dicen que en su Banco Comunal les dan capacitaciones que les ayuda mucho en su vida diaria, y que han aprendido a ser puntuales, responsables, y a ahorrar.

Maura junto a su familia realiza bellos trabajos D. artesanía en telar como frazadas, tapices, alfombras, pasadizos, que son vendidos en el Mercado Santa Clara D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, además D. los tejidos, tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Santosa venD. gaseosas, panes, frutas, golosinas en un kiosco ubicado en un grifo, y también venD. ropa en las diferentes ferias D. la región como San Francisco, Santa Rosa entre otros.

Maura y Santosa necesitan préstamos que serán invertidos en la compra D. gaseosas, manzanas, naranjas, plátanos, duraznos, caramelos, galletas, chicles, papel higiénico, champú, jabón, lana y tintes. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para su chequeo médico, la construcción D. su casa y para alguna emergencia.

Los sueños D. Maura y Santosa son tener una casa bonita, comprar un terreno y construir su casa, un negocio más granD., vender sus productos fuera D. la región y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To purchase wool and dye, soft drinks, apples, oranges, bananas, peaches, candy, cookies, gum, toilet paper, shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
"I am Nazira B. from a small town: Chichawatni, Pakistan. This is my birth town. I am married and the mother of six: four boys and two girls. My husband operates a cotton goods store and wants to expand it. Thanks be to God, our business generates decent profits.

I am requesting loans for my group members as well. Zohra B. requires a loan for her son who is a tailor. Talat B.’s husband sells fruit. Sarweri B. sells milk. Razia S. wants a loan for her son who is a plumber."

loans.use: Expand cotton goods store

loans.name: Kireka B1 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret N.. She is currently in the business of selling arts and crafts and is requesting a loan to boost business. Margret is 48 years old and is a widow. She has 1 child who is 30. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save it for future use. Margret has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Margret is joined in her small group by Hadijah M., Slyvia N., Maureen K., and Annet N.. Hadijah M. has a business running a restaurant and wants to purchase more raw food. Slyvia N. is currently operating a business in stone quarrying and wants a loan to add capital. Maureen K. operates a restaurant business and wants to purchase a fridge. Annet N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan to expand business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for making arts and crafts

loans.name: Bahromjon

texts.ru:
Bahromjon H. lives in Rudaki. He is 30 years old, married with 3 children. He also has a community college degree. He is a farmer, owns some land and plants wheat and other grains. The harvest goes for his own family needs and for sale. The sales help his family buy food like flour, vegetable oil and other essentials. Right now it is planting season and Bahromjon needs money to buy seeds. He hopes to get a loan that he can use to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer. He will repay the loan in the course of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Холикулов Бахромджон проживает в городе Рудаки . Клиенту 30 лет , он женат и имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее , занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеиват пшеницей и другими злаковыми культурами. Полученный урожай использует для семьи и для продажи. Это помогает обеспечить семью мукой , льняным маслом , то есть продуктами первой необходимости. Сейчас посевной сезон и клиенту нужны деньги для засева земли. Найти деньги он решил путем получения кредита. Это поможет клиенту купить качественные семена и удобрения.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kheourn Say Group

texts.en: There are four women in the loan group from Banh Chhkol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Kheourn S., 53, has been selected to be the group leader.  She has seven children. Two of them work in a garment factory while another looks after the family cows. The four youngest children are enrolled in public schools. Her husband, Thuy Hang, is a subsistence farmer who cultivates his crop near the village. Mrs. Kheourn S. is a pot seller.  Previously, she serviced a loan from AMK and purchased a piece of land to re-sell for a profit. She now wants to buy more cows to breed.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram P. is an unmarried, 22-year-old farmer. In his farming operation, he grows rice, wheat, peas, and pods, and he has been cultivating the land as such for the past four years. Each year, Akram grows a sufficient amount of crops for his family's consumption needs and to sell crops for a profit as well. In fact, by generating a stable income from this business, Akram is able to support his parents. Akram’s mother, who is pictured in the photo, helps him to sell his crop yield.

This year is especially important for Akram as he is going to marry his chosen one. With this purpose in mind, he is seeking to increase his business in order to make enough money to pay for his marriage. Thus, today he requests a loan in the amount of 3,000 Somoni ($875), to be repaid within 7 months, in order to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. Akram thanks everyone for supporting him, and he promises to be punctual with his loan payments.

loans.use: To generate additional income in order to pay for his marriage by increasing his crop yield through the purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has two grown daughters. She runs a small business in the market of Novaya Kahovka. Tatyana sells childrens' clothing items. There are very few other people who are engaged in the trade in this marketplace. Tatyana has been in this business for eight years. She is a true entrepreneur and reality has been her teacher. Tatyana is very enterprising, decisive and determined. 
“Nadiya Ukraine” has provided consistent help to her business, making it a successful venture.

Tatyana has approximately $3000 invested in merchandise. She is a typical entrepreneur striving to make a better life for her family. “Nadiya Ukraine” has provided consistent help to her business, making it a successful venture. She is currently requesting a loan of 5000 grivnas to increase her seasonal inventory. One of Tatyana’s long-term plans is to purchase another vending facility. Tatyana’s natural ability to assess the business environment and take advantage of it will help her achieve independence and security in her business and life.

loans.use: to increase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
The Group was formed in the month of June, 2008, thanks to the hard work of the director of the school Perpetuo Socorro which invited the mothers of the families of that institution to participate in an informative chat at the school. That meeting was attended by 16 women who now are part of the group Todas Juntas (All Together).

The members are involved in various business activities such as: the sale of food, the sale of silver jewelry, chipas (a traditional bread snack), fruits, vegetables, clothing, etc. Everyone participates in weekly meetings and they work actively together on all of the activities the group develops.

This is the first cycle of the program Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras that the Fundacion Paraguaya is developing. Each group member will take on average Gs. 300.000 and the group would like a loan of a total sum of Gs. 4.700.000. This is a very well-organized group in which unity and solidarity are of utmost importance to all of the group members.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

El Grupo fue constituido en el mes de junio del 2.008, gracias a la acción emprendedora de la directora de la Escuela Perpetuo Socorro quien invitó a las madres de familia de dicha institución a participar de una charla informativa en el local de la escuela. En dicha reunión asistieron 16 mujeres, quienes integran hoy el Comité denominado Oñondivepá (Todas Juntas).

Las integrantes se dedican a diversas actividades tales como: venta de comidas, joyas de plata, chipas, frutas y verduras, ropas, etc. Todas participan de las reuniones semanales y trabajan de manera activa en todas las actividades que el grupo desarrolla.

Se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras que desarrolla la Fundación Paraguaya. Cada una retira en promedio Gs. 300.000 y el grupo retira en total la suma de Gs. 4.700.000. Es un grupo muy bien organizado en donde prima la unidad y solidaridad entre todas las integrantes.

loans.use:
Purchase of merchandise for sale such as meat, sugar, flour, noodles, fruits, and vegetables. Also coal, silver jewelry and clothing.

compra de mercaderías para despensa como carne, azúcar, harina, fideos, carbón, frutas y verduras. También carbón, joyas de plata y ropas.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alishier is married, and has four children. His wife is pictured here, helping him with their family business. Alishier began his own business 6 years ago selling clothes and shoes to provide a greater income for his family. He wanted to provide his children with a good education and a better quality of life. Since then, he has been hard at work and busy maintaining his business.

Alishier would like to request a loan of $925 in order to restock his inventory and purchase more merchandise for the new season. Be an important part of Alishier’s family life by contributing to the growth of his business. They sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise and goods

loans.name: Sarwar M. Sharif Group

texts.en:
Sarwar baji is the wife of M. Sharif and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 25 years. 

Sarwar baji has a business of making stuffed toys. Sarwar baji's whole family is involved in this business. Sarwar baji didn't learn this skill from anyone; it is her God-given skill. She trained all the members of her family. They have been in this profession for the last 20 years. She is applying for a loan to buy material (cotton, zippers and thread) to make more stuffed toys to sell in a market to earn a good profit.

She is joined in her loan group by three other members. Munaza baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine. Musarat baji wants a loan to buy iron to make chains which are used to tie cattle. Asia baji wants a loan to buy leather to make shoes to sell.

 This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material to make more stuffed toys

loans.name: Margarita Macaela

texts.es:
La señora Margarita Micaela tiene 61 años, es la presidenta de su Banco Comunal Mujeres Valerosas II y vive en la calle Pittion 916, distrito La Esperanza Alta, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad, Perú. Estudió hasta tercero de secundaria, pero ya no continuó estudiando por falta de recursos económicos. Se casó con el señor Miro Briceño Benites y tienen 9 hijos, de los cuales dos (de 19 y 16 años ) aún estudian y dependen de ellos.
Gracias a su esposo aprendió a elaborar calzado y actualmente trabaja  conjuntamente con él y ya no pagan operarios. Es Margarita quien coloca el calzado en los diferentes puestos de venta y ofrece ante la clientela modelos por catálogo.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles, el cual devolvió en 4 cuotas, lo utilizó para completar y comprar material.
Con este crédito de 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa comprar pegamento, micro poroso y neo lid (materiales para calzado).
Sueña con viajar al extranjero para exponer su calzado.
texts.en:
Margarita Micaela is 61 years old and is the president of the Valient Women II Communal Bank. She lives at 916 Pittion Street in the District of La Esperanza Alta, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She went to school through the third year of secondary school, but could not continue for lack of economic resources. She married Miro Briceño Benites with whom she has 9 children, two of whom (ages 16 and 19) still live with them and are dependants. Thanks to her husband she learned to make footwear and at the moment she works jointly with him and no longer contracts workers. Margarita is the one who positions the footwear for sale and offers the customer models from the catalogue. The first loan of 300 soles, which was repaid in 4 installments, was used to buy materials. With the requested loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 installments, she intends to buy glue, micro porous material and neon combat material (material for footwear). She dreams about traveling to foreign places to exhibit her footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of glue and other materials for shoe making.

loans.name: Fatuma Y.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Fatuma W. from Mbeya, divorced with four children between the ages of 8 and 16. She has been making and selling clothes since 1998. Working at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Fatuma currently earns about $150 monthly.

She is requesting a loan of $425 in order to buy in bulk the tailoring materials needed to make more clothes. In the future, she plans to have a shop from which to sell the clothes. Fatuma thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy in bulk tailoring materials to make more clothes.

loans.name: Marymary

texts.en:
Mary J. sells drugs at her pharmacy and is requesting a loan to stock more drugs to sell. Mary is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a police officer. She has two children, who both go to school. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to stock more drugs for sale at her pharmacy.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more drugs for sale.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus hermanas y su mamá. Se dedica a preparar tamales, juanes y humintas, los mismos que los lleva a vender por distintos lugares de manera ambulante, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 7 años, y lo que le gusta es conocer muchas personas y lugares, sobre todo entablar conversación con sus consumidores. Además, cuenta con clientes  fieles que solo esperan su llegada para comprar su comida que es tan deliciosa. Es la primera vez que recurre a MFP por un préstamo, por lo que está muy comprometido en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará utensilios de cocina, además de un triciclo para trasladar con mayor comodidad su comida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 45 years old, single and lives with his sisters and mother. He prepares tamales, juanes (rice, chicken, eggs, olives, herbs and spices wrapped in a large jungle leaf called bijau) and humintas (squares of sweet cornbread with cheese), which he takes around to different places to sell. He has been doing this work for the past 7 years, and he likes getting to know many people and places and most of all chatting with his customers. He has a loyal clientele who wait for him to arrive so they can buy his delicious food. This is the first time he has come to Microfinanzas Prisma for a loan and he is very committed to making his repayments on time. With the money he requests he will buy kitchen utensils as well as a tricycle so that he can transport his food more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a tricycle for transporting his products.

loans.name: Alexandru

texts.en:
Alexandru D. lives in Cimislia district, Suric village; he is a very responsible and optimistic person, and he has 3 children and a wife whom he has to support.

Alexandru wishes to develop his business. This business consists of cattle-raising in his village because there is a very high demand for milk from villagers and especially from customers who come from enclosed towns. Alexandru is helped by his sister Dorina who lives in the same village. She also borrowed a loan from MicroInvest with the purpose of increasing the number of cattle, together with her brother.

Dorina and Alexandru are currently faced with many problems because their parents are ill and they want to help them. They find their way to do that is to succeed in business, so we hope that their capabilities and services provided by MicroInvest will help them improve the business.

loans.use: to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. is married and has 6 dependants. She has received schooling through junior high. Mary sells bread which she bakes herself. She also sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Atobiase near Elmina. She has done this since 2000. Her husband is a carpenter. Mary uses her income for assist her husband with the house keeping expenses. 

Mary will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale and also to purchase flour and other baking materials to increase production. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to invest in their children's education.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities and also to purchase flour and other baking materials to ncrease production.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.es:
La señora Dolly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la Av. Fernando B. Terry S/Nº, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 37 años y es madre de 3 hijos, todos que todavía depende de ella. 

Se inició, con S/. 300.00 que fue motivada por su esposo, para emprender su negocio, de venta de  anticuchos y juanes. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas como gaseosas en paquetes de todos los sabores, marcas y tamaños, aguas minerales; y los vende a sus clientes, amigos y vecinos, en su casa propia.

Con el préstamo de S/1,500.00 que pagará en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más gaseosas en paquetes y aguas minerales, para ser vendidas por paquetes y/o unidades.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 

Dolly, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Dolly belongs to the community bank "Picota" and lives at Av. Fernando B. Terry S/N, Picota district, San Martin state. She is married, 37 years old, and a mother of 3 children, all of whom she still supports. With an initial loan of S/ 300 that she obtained through the motivation of her husband, she started selling sandwiches and rice dishes. Currently, she sells sodas, mostly through multi-flavored packs of different brands and sizes, and mineral water. She sells to her friends and neighbors out of her home. With this loan of S/ 1,500, to be paid in 6 monthly payments, she will invest in the wholesale purchase of sodas, which she will then sell individually. She makes her decisions based on what is profitable for the business. She feels more sociable, secure, and responsible with her monthly financial obligations. Dolly expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sodas by the bulk intended for resale

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en: Modupe J. is 56 years old and married with six children.  She sells foodstuffs and provisions.  Modupe is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Julian

texts.en: Julian R. L., 27, is married with 3 children.  She has many years of experience in the Elei printing business. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  SPBD loans are Julian’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie C. lives peacefully with her children in the village of Magsaysay Saguday Quirino in the Philippines. Tessie has been blessed with two children: Daisy Belshane, 20 years old and a nursing student; and Yorelle Queen, 16 years old and a high school graduate. Tessie is 45 years old and works as a manicurist and beautician in their village. She has many customers in their village because of her friendly personality.

Tessie also manages a hog-raising business, aside from her job as a manicurist and beautician. She runs two businesses because she wants to provide for her family’s daily needs, most specifically for the financial needs of her children. Despite having two businesses, her daily income is not enough to make her business grow.

Hence, Tessia is requesting a loan amounting to PHP7, 000.00 for additional capital. She would like to purchase products for her manicurist and beautician business, such as hot oils for her customer’s hair and hair relaxing chemicals. With the loan she will be able to increase the services offered to her customers and increase business, helping her provide for her children’s needs.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Elena Antonio’s main business is raising hogs. The business has become a big help with sending her children to school. She is 28 years old and is married to Eduardo Antonio Jr. In order to purchase more feed for her pigs, Elena is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. She will use the extra income she earns from her larger pigs to meet the needs of her family. The couple is working very hard together to increase their income so that they can send their children to college. At the moment, Elena lives in the village of Liwayway Diffun, Quirino, with her happy family. She is hoping that her business will expand in the future and their standard of living will increase.

loans.use: To purchase more feed

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia A. is forty-two years old, widowed, and has given birth to four children: a daughter and three sons. Some are currently in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region.

Olivia is a trader.  She buys kerosene from the distributers in tank cars and sells to her customers in gallons. Olivia has been in business for eleven years and wants a loan to buy kerosene in bulk to be able to retail to more customers. Olivia aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school to higher heights.

loans.use: To buy kerosene in bulk

loans.name: Carminia

texts.en:
Carminia is 27 years old and has two children (2 and 5 years old) with her common-law husband. She has a small general store in Cusco, located in the Sacred Valley of Perú. Carminia needs a loan to have the capital available to place daily orders of vegetables and meats for her store.

Carminia is a member of an Arariwa communal group called "Cusco Sur" which meets every month with a loan officer to review payments and discuss how everyone's business is doing.

In the future Carmen hopes to save enough money to build her own home for her family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and meat in bulk for general store

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como Radio taxi, y es una fuente para la subsistencia de un hijo que tiene y solventar los gastos de alimentación y educación.
Vive en la Zona de ovejuyo de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado capital de inversión (mantenimiento y reparación completa de su vehiculo).
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Oscar has a vehicle and works as a radio dispatched taxi driver. It serves as a means for him to sustain his son and to provide for the food and educational expenses.

He lives in his parents’ house in the Ovejuyo area of the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used for investment capital (the maintenance and complete repair of his vehicle).

This is his third loan with Impro. His good payment history makes him a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Moth

texts.en:
Moth L., 36, is a low-income person living in Siem Reap Province. She is a good and determined single mother who tries to feed her five children, even though she is recently divorced from her husband. She has one married child who lives separately, while the remainder are staying in family home and working in a variety of jobs. 

Moth L. sells fresh fish in the market to earn a living. Every day in the late morning, Moth L. goes to a place that is full of fisherman to buy fish in bulk. Then she hurries to bring the fish to the market, which she sells them retail. Because her income is just enough for family’s daily expenses, her house is frequently cracking during the heavy rainy season. To solve this problem, she is requesting a loan of $400 to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
TERESA C.   M., tiene 61 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una hija mayor de edad. Vive en la zona de la Calichera en Comas.
Cuenta con un negocio de Taller de Confecciones y composturas.
Por dos años tuvo su taller en un puesto de mercado, luego lo trasladó a su casa en donde tiene 10 años.
A raíz de su jubilación, por su característica de ser una persona emprendedora y trabajadora ella inició su taller confeccionando prendas para venderlos en provincia, le fue bien desde el comienzo pero la actividad de confeccionar y viajar era demasiado pesada y terminó dañándose la columna.
A raíz de su lesión se quedó en casa dando servicio de compostura.  
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en mantenimiento de máquinas y materiales, como agujas, hilos, y otros.
texts.en:
TERESA C. M. is a 61-year-old single mother of an adult daughter. She lives in the Calichera zone in Comas, Peru. She owns a fashion tailoring and alterations shop. For two years she's worked at a market, but about 10 years ago she has moved her workshop to her house where's she's been working from. Following her retirement, this hard working entrepreneur started her own business making clothes to sell in the city. But the physical demands of sewing and traveling became too much for her to handle, and she ended up hurting her back. Due to this injury, Teresa has made herself a workshop at home offering her seamstress services. She requests a loan to invest in the maintenance of machines and to buy materials, like needles, threads, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO INVEST IN MATERIALS AND MACHINE MAINTENANCE

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal un Nuevo Día, es casada, tiene 32 años, dos hijos de 12 y 3 años, el mayor está estudiando en la escuela estatal y el menor está al cuidado de su mama.
Rosa es la menor de 5 hermanas, terminó la escuela y estudió cosmetología, no terminó por que tenía que cuidar a su papá que estaba enfermo, tuvo que ponerse a trabajar para ayudar con los gastos de la casa. Rosa empezó trabajando en varios mercados como ambulante, hasta que consiguió un trabajo en un supermercado, allí trabajo buen tiempo, pero lo dejo porque salió embarazada y tuvo que cuidar a su hijo, ahora vende fruta de manera ambulatoria, se levanta a las cinco de la mañana para hacer las compras de fruta en el mercado mayorista, así aprovecha mejores precios.
Desde que ingreso a FINCA le ha ido bien, tiene dinero para poder invertir porque ahora cuenta con un capital de trabajo.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de un toldo y un mostrador de madera para la fruta.
El sueño de Rosa es tener una juguería.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the communal bank "A New Day". She is 32 years old and married with two sons, ages 12 and 3. The older son is studying at school, and the younger stays at home with Rosa. Rosa is the youngest of 5 sisters. She left school and studied cosmetology, but was not able to complete her program, as she had to care for her father who was sick. Rosa had to go to work to help meet household expenses. She began working in city markets selling various goods, until she got a job at a supermarket. It was a good job, but Rosa had to leave because she got pregnant and had to care for her son. Rosa now sells fruit at city markets. She wakes up at at five in the morning to make purchases at the wholesale fruit market and get the best prices. Since joining FINCA Rosa has done well, and she now has some working capital. Rosa is asking for a loan of 1000 soles to buy a tent and a wooden counter for her fruit stand. Rosa's dream is to have a juice bar.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a tent and a wooden counter for her fruit stand.

loans.name: Tamemgbo Group

texts.en:
These people are Abdulai K., Mahawa G., Kadiatu K., Fatmata S. and Alie K.. They named their group Tamemgbo, a Temne phrase meaning “let us just have a try”. These entrepreneurs have received several loans from SMT. The previous loans have had meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. The last loan they received from SMT was for Le 800,000 each. Now, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,000,000 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Abdulai K. (right) is the leader of this group. Abdulai is approximately sixty-two years of age. He was born in a village called Pat Bama, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have seven children. Six of Abdulai’s children are attending schools, five in secondary schools and one in primary school. Abdulai sells used clothes and has been in this business for over forty years now.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina O. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur. She is 21, married and has 2 infants. To make a living, Cristina owns & operates a pedicab transport service. Cristina has had her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cristina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, which she used to repair her vehicle and provide better service. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase an additional vehicle for the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle for the business

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Abelardo J. le está haciendo falta la barda alrededor de su casa. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora ya que en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario, ya que le preocupa que su casa no tenga la seguridad, para su familia, y tiene dos hijos que todavía están pequeños de edad y no quiere que les valla a pasar algo.
Don Alberto es empleado de una compañía de gasolina en el departamento de despachador, con una parte de este ingreso planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Abelardo J.'s house lacks a wall around it. He is requesting a loan to buy building materials and pay the person who will build this improvement since he does not have the needed funds at this time. He worries that his house is not secure for his family and he has two children who are still very young and he fears something could happen to them. Alberto is a dispatcher for a gasoline company and will use part of his salary to repay his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng S. M., 25, is a young woman and the mother of a school-aged child. To earn a living, Leng S. M. owns a small store where there is the good location to raise income. In her shop, she sells different kinds of flowers to people who need to decorate for parties or ceremonies. In her business activities, her husband also assists her in buying and selling flowers. This family normally earns an average of $7 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses.

Leng S. M. currently is selling well because she has a skill in public communication with people. To meet the needs of her family, she is applying for a loan which she will use as capital to accumulate a quantity of various flowers to sell.

loans.use: To buy flowers to sell

loans.name: Rizalito

texts.en:
Rizalito D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao Camiguin Province. He is 40 years old. Rizalito is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rizalito owns and operates a business venture in the service sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing a coconut grinding service in the local community. Rizalito has been engaged in his business for over 13 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rizalito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizalito successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Rizalito is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rizalito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Carmen Rosa L. integrante del grupo  Las Emprendedoras que pertenece al Centro Focal Alto Lima, se dedica a la venta D. zapatillas,  en sus inicios ella era vendedora D. zapatillas y con el pasar del tiempo logro abrir su propio negocio, por este fin D. año la venta D. este producto estima que se incrementará por lo que necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería, ella compra sus productos en la Buenos Aires D. la Ciudad D. La Paz y los venD. en la feria 16 D. Julio ambulando (ofreciendo a diferentes personas). Al igual que Carmen sus compañeras tienen diferentes negocios como la venta D. zapatos,  polleras, puertas, transporte  y muebles. Y necesitan el préstamo para comprar productos e insumos.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa L. heads up the “Las Emprendedoras” [Enterprising Women] group of the Alto Lima branch of ProMujer. She sells casual shoes. With time, she has managed to open her own business and at the end of this year she estimates that business will increase so that she will need a loan to purchase more merchandise. She buys her products in La Paz and sells them on foot at the “16th of July” market.

The other members of the group have different businesses, such as sales of shoes, polleras [traditional skirts], doors, transport, and furniture. They also need this loan to buy merchandise and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and supplies

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita M. L. R., tiene la edad de 41 años, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos. Ellos tienen 16 y 14 y los dos viven en la casa. Doña Rita tiene 2 años de tener un pequeño bazar en el centro de Sabolito donde vende toda clase de articulos para la necesidades de la region. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de busutería para un bazar que tiene en el centro de sabalito. Este prestamo le ayudará porque con meter ese tipo de mercaderia puede cubrir los pastos del negocio y tambien obtiene una ganancia. Es la primera vez doña Rita se financea con FUDECOSUR. Ella desea que pueda ser independiente economicamente y salir adelante y poder ayudarles a los hijos a los hijos en los estudio y tener una cuota de pension en el futuro. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Rita M. L. R. is 41 years old, married, and has 2 children. They are 16 and 14 and both live at home. For 2 years Rita has owned a small store in downtown Sabolito where she sells all kinds of items for the region’s needs. The loan that she wants will be used to buy costume jewelry for her store in downtown Sabolito.
