This loan will help her because with selling this type of merchandise she can cover her business costs and make a profit. This is the first time Rita is receiving a loan from FUDECOSUR. She wishes that she can be economically independent and become successful and be able to help her children receive an education and have a pension in the future. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy costume jewelry for her store

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer muy laboriosa de 50 años, vive con su esposo y padre de sus 2 hijos; Carlos de 24 y Melady de 17 años, en su casa de material noble, de dos pisos.
Desde hace 2 años empezó a dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes, a inicios su bodega era muy precaria; no tenía mostradores ni vitrinas, por ello decidieron unir los ingresos de su esposo y más las ganancias de la bodega con la finalidad de mejorar su calidad de vida. Es así como fueron invirtiendo poco a poco, hasta conseguir las ganancias que les permitieron terminar de construir su casa, además de comprar vitrinas para su tienda. 
Ahora, paralelo a su negocio, también alquila dos mini departamentos en su casa y un local para  negocio en el primer piso. A Julia le gusta dedicarse al comercio, y asimismo velar por la limpieza de su casa, ya que el alquiler de ésta es muy rentable. 
Lo que Julia anhela en la vida es que sus hijos sean profesionales, por ello trabajará arduamente hasta lograrlo.

Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP y será muy responsable como siempre, además está conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque son personas comprometidas. Con el dinero que solicita se abastecerá de mayor cantidad de productos para que de ese modo su negocio siempre esté muy atractivo.
texts.en:
Julia is a very hardworking woman of 50 years of age. She lives with her husband, the father of her children Carlos, 24, and Melady, 17. They live in a two-story house made of good materials. Two years ago, Julia began her grocery business. In the beginning, the store was very humble; it did not have counters or display cases. Because of this, she decided to put her earnings together with those of her husband with the goal of improving their quality of life. They invested little by little until they managed to finish construction of their house and buy display cases for the store. At the same time, Julia rents out two small apartments in her house and a commercial space on the first floor. She looks after the housecleaning herself, as the rentals are very profitable. What Julia desires most in life is that her children become professionals. That is the reason for all her hard work. This is Julia’s tenth loan with MFP, and she will be responsible, as always. She also will work with her communal bank, as they are very committed people. With the money from this loan, Julia will buy a quantity of products for her store, so that it will always be very attractive.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for store

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda se dedica a la venta de materiales escolares ya que ella tiene un librería - bazar en la zona de Alto San Antonio. Es una persona muy alegre y amable, y es muy conocida en su vecindario. Sus amigos y familiares cuentan que es una persona muy dedicada a su familia y su trabajo. Ella tiene dos hijas, una de unos 16 años y la otra de 4 años. Viven en la Av. Mujía. 

La señora Yolanda tiene, además, un trabajo de medio tiempo como profesora en el Colegio Mariaca. Mientras ella enseña en el colegio su padre es quien le ayuda en atender la librería. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora ya que su mayor anhelo es poder hacer crecer su negocio y de esa manera ayudar a que sus hijas tengan una buena educación. 

El destino del credito sera para la compra de material escolar ya que pronto comenzaran las clases en los distintos colegios y ella quiere surtir su libreria.

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Yolanda makes a living selling school supplies out of her bookstore-bazaar in the area of Alto San Antonio. She is a very happy and friendly person and is very well-known in her neighborhood. Her friends and relatives say she is a person who is very dedicated to her family and her work. Yolanda has two daughters, ages 16 and 4. Furthermore, Yolanda works part time as a teacher at a local school. While she is teaching at the school, her father helps her tend to the bookstore. Yolanda is a very hard-working person, and her main goal is to be able to grow her business and in this way help her children get a good education. She plans to use the loan to purchase more school supplies since classes at the distinct local schools will be starting soon and she wants to stock her store. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in authorizing the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies

loans.name: Nicole

texts.fr: K. Nicole est née le 4 décembre 1971 et réside depuis 18 ans à Sikècodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Nicole est mariée à HOUNTONDJI Philippe et est mère de quatre enfants et a un autre enfant à sa charge.  Tous les enfants sont scolarisés.  Nicole vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Nicole a arrêté les classes au cours primaire. Pour contribuer aux charges familiales, Nicole vend de nourriture (pâte rouge de maïs et piron fait à base de farine de manioc) dans son quartier. Nicole s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Nicole exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans.  Nicole a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Nicole sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour augmenter sa production et satisfaire plus sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Nicole K. was born on 4 December 1971 and has lived for 18 years in Sikècodji in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Nicole is married to Philippe Hountondji and is the mother of four children, with one additional child in her care. All of the children are in school. Nicole lives together with her children and husband. The couple provide for the family together. Nicole ended her studies in primary school. To contribute to meeting the family's expenses, Nicole sells food (red maize paste and 'piron' - a paste made from manioc flour) in her district. Nicole gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Nicole has run this business for 8 years, and has already obtained one loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which she repaid properly. Nicole is seeking a second loan with ALIDÉ to increase her production and better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, manioc flour, and palm oil

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina es una madre de familia de 53 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo, dos de sus hijos y un nieto en el distrito de Castilla, de la provincia de Piura, en la región Piura, ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de apoyar al mantenimiento de su familia hizo que desde hace seis años se dedicara a la venta de verduras en el mercado del distrito de Castilla. Todos los días ella ofrece una variedad de verduras y legumbres a sus clientes, con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad, ella apoya al sostenimiento de los suyos.

Guillermina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más verduras, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más mercadería para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer humilde y trabajadora. Ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. En la imagen aparece acomodando su mercadería luego de ardua jornada de labor.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a 53 year old mother. She lives with her husband, two of her children, and a grandson in the Castilla district, Piura province, Piura region. It is three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Because she needed to help support her family, six years ago she started selling vegetables in the market in the Castilla district. Everyday she offers a variety of vegetables to her customers. She uses the income from this activity to help support her family. Guillermina wishes to expand her business by purchasing more vegetables. To do this she is requesting a loan from the Edpyme Alternativa for 500 PEN. She plans to use the money to buy more merchandise to achieve her objective. She is a humble and hard-working woman. She has worked with our institution before, and she has demonstrated responsibility when it is time to make payments. In the photo she appears arranging her merchandise after a hard day’s work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables to expand her sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy general grocery products

loans.name: Mansura

texts.en:
Mansura A. was born in 1948. She is married, has a child and lives with her family in the Absheron region. She sews stylish feminine clothes on a machine and has been in this business for 15 years.

Mansura A. creates new fashionable feminine clothes. She likes to be innovative in her business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy two electric sewing machines and cloth.

loans.use: To buy two electric sewing machines and cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of peanut grains to sow

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Mrs. Evangeline N., a 55-year-old farmer who earns about 3000 per month, is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, where she is the married mother of four children, three of whom attend school. Her husband is also a farmer who supports their daily basic needs. Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to better engage in business activities.  Having fully repaid her previous loan of 5000 from PMP, she is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 6000  from PMPC to buy fertilizer.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida T. is from the village of Canitoan, Kalilangan Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Adelaida is married and has 8 school-aged children. Adelaida owns & operates a a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Adelaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase additional inventory & working capital. Adelaida is requesting her third loan, for 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhom E., 45 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Sophal Sdoeng, 42 years old, have been married for twenty years and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of them are in school. The family lives in a suburb about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sokhom was not available for the photo, so his wife is in the photo instead. 

Sokhom has been an electrician for ten years. His wife stays at home. He is requesting his first loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to school.

loans.name: Etiennette

texts.fr: A. Etiennette est née le 17 Avril 1972 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Etiennette est mariée à HOUINSOU Julien et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Etiennette vit avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sème-Podji, depuis une dizaine d'année. Le couple se partage ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Etiennette a fréquenté juste l'école primaire. Depuis huit ans environs, Etiennette mène comme activité, la vente de fagots de bois à son domicile. Etiennette s'approvisionne à ONAB (société de commercialisation de bois au Bénin). Etiennette est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Etiennette désire augmenter le stock de ses produits et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Etiennette sollicite un cinquième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Etiennette was born on April 17, 1972 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to HOUINSOU Julien and is the mother of three children who are all in school.  She has been living in the Lokokoukoumè district, in the community of Sème-Podji, for about ten years.  The couple share in covering their different family expenses.  Etiennette attended primary school only. For about eight years, she has had a business selling bundles of firewood out of her home.  She gets her supplies at ONAB (a company marketing firewood in Benin).  She is a previous client of ALIDé having already had four loans, which have all been repaid.  Facing the more and more numerous demands of her customers, Etiennette would like to increase her stock of goods and to satisfy her customer further.  For these reasons, she is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bundles of firewood wholesale

loans.name: Dzidza

texts.en:
Dzidza T. T. is a divorced woman with six children. She has five girls who are all married and one boy who attends school. She owns a house with no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, Dzidza has operated a vegetable stall business, selling vegetables both retail and from home to her neighbors. Dzidza faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She decided to join Yehu in order to get a loan to improve her business. 

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), she wants to purchase one sack of green vegetables and onions. In the future, she hopes to open another vegetable stall and sell vegetables wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of onions and green vegetables.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en: Suren is 51 years old. He lives in Vanadzor city with his wife and two sons. For about 23 years he has been engaged in the flower trading business: he sells bunches and wreaths in a rented place at a large market. Thanks to his business income, he can support his family and also pay for his sons’ education. Suren seeks a 700,000 AMD loan to buy a car, which he will use to transport flowers from Arjut village’s greenhouses to his business place. The car will allow Suren to decrease his business expenses.

loans.use: To buy a car for his flower trading business

loans.name: Carmen Sara

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen Sara L. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive por el sector de San Pedro del Cebollar, este sector es conocido por que se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y también a la agricultura.
 
La Señora. Carmen Sara tiene  38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos  de 10 y 7 años de edad que  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión electricista no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres pero de una manera independiente.
 
Doña Carmen tiene un gabinete de belleza ya que  es estilista,  trabaja hace 10 años en su propio negocio y labora desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. de lunes a sábado,  aprovecha para vender los productos de Herbalife a sus clientes y también vende en su tiempo libre,  vende estos productos  hace un año.

Es nuestra socia hace 2 años y los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, fue invitada por su hermana a formar parte de este grupo  de mujeres luchadoras, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos como perfumes, cremas, etc. para vender en su gabinete.

Su meta es tener su casa propia y comprarse un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Carmen Sara L. is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Luchadoras." She lives in the San Pedro de Cebollar neighborhood. This neighborhood is known to have a great view of the city of Cuenca. The residents in this area work raising animals and also work in agriculture. Carmen Sara is 38 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 10 and 7 who study in a school in the city. Her husband is a professional electrician. They don't have their own home so they live in the house of her parents, but they support themselves. Carmen has a beauty salon, as she is a hair stylist. She has worked for 10 years in her own business. She works from 8am until 9pm from Monday through Saturday. She also takes advantage of the opportunity to sell Herbalife products to her customers, and sells in her free time as well. She has been selling these products for a year. Over the last 2 years she has taken loans that have benefited her business. She was invited to join the communal bank by her sister, who is also part of this group of "fighting women." She will use this loan to buy cosmetics such as perfumes, creams, etc. to sell in her salon. Her goal is to have her own house and to buy a vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, lipsticks, eye shadow, etc.

loans.name: Rejina

texts.en: Rejina M. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans, "simsim" (sesame seeds) and millet at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans, rice and millet to sell.  Rejina is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 8 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans, rice and millet to sell

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en: Nergui M. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Darhan-Uul province of central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her older daughter attends university and lives in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia while her younger daughter studies in a local secondary school. Nergui operates a used shoes retail business at an indoor stall in the Almansag market in her town. She began her business in 2000 with working capital of 1,000,000 MNT ($750). After 10 years of successful operations, she has managed to increase her working capital to a level exceeding 2,000,000 MNT ($1,525). In the future, she plans to establish her own company and her own store. Nergui is very hard working and a diligent businesswoman. “First, I help my two daughters in their marriages to let them live separately, and then I will work very hard in order to have my own shop. I am still young and full of life energy so nothing is impossible.”she says. Nergui is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT ($1,525) loan to purchase shoes as well as to repair her husband's car.

loans.use: To purchase additionall shoes

loans.name: Yadira Patricia

texts.es:
Yadira Y. envía nuevamente saludos a sus financiadores y dice que está muy contenta porque terminó de pagar su crédito y le quedó muy lindo su salón con los nuevos equipos y enseres que compró, le está yendo muy bien, porque está más ventilada y vistosa su sala de belleza. Ahora con su nuevo credikiva  comprará vitrinas para surtirlas con productos de belleza con dos fines: para utilizarlo en su trabajo diario  y para venderlos mientras asesora a sus clientes respecto al cuidado de su cabellos y como mantenerlo hermosos. 
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Yadira Y. siga a continuación este enlace: 
http://partners.kiva.org/lend/163587
texts.en:
Yadira Y. sends new greetings to her funders, and says that she is very pleased because she finished paying her loan and as a result she has a beautiful new salon with the new equipment and furnishings she bought.  The business is going very well because the salon is better ventilated and more colorful.  Now, with her new Kiva loan, she will buy glass display cases so that she can fill them with the best beauty products for two purposes: to use in her daily work and to sell to her customers, whom she advises regarding hair care and how to keep their hair beautiful.  

If you want to know more about Yadira's history, click on the link below:
http://partners.kiva.org/lend/163587

loans.use: to buy glass display cases and beauty products

loans.name: Giang Thi Nguyen's Group

texts.en:
Giang T. N. is 41 years old with three children who are in college. In 2004 she opened a small shop that has served soft drink, beer and sugar cane water since she received her first loan. Her business is quite successful. Every day, she earns 100,000 VND profit from this shop.

Giang has been a member of our credit program for many years. She has always made her loan payments on time. Currently, she wants a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy a new sugar cane processing machine.

About the Other Borrowers:

1) Tho T. N. is 31 years old. She is a chicken farmer with 200 hens. She is in need of a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy feed for them. 2) Huyen T. N. is 26 years old with two children. She runs a hair salon. She wishes to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy a machine for steaming hair. 3) Mai T. C. is 45 years old. She runs a shop that sells aquatic products in the local market. She would like a loan of 5,450,000 VND to invest in her shop. 4) Nhac T. N. is 57 years old with three children who are of working age. Being a farmer, she focuses on raising ducks and hens for eggs. She would like a loan of 4,142,000 VND to buy feed for them.

loans.use: To buy a new sugar cane processing machine

loans.name: Hérémakono Group

texts.fr:
Hérémakono est un regroupement de quatre femmes toutes mariées dans des familles polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 20 ans, 1enfant et résident toutes dans le centre de Fakola l’une des Sous préfecture de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et font toutes le commerce de céréales, de farines de blé sauf Adiarha Koné, un des membres du groupe excelle  dans la vente des ignames.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les articles à vendre, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur premier   prêt solidaire. 
Adiarha  Koné compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des ignames à Guèya en Côte d’Ivoire l’un des  pays  frontaliers de la République du Mali où le prix est très bas. Adiarha  effectue sa vente au domicile et au marché les jours de la  foire, à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes qui achètent au comptant et parfois à crédit. 
Elle  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et prendre en charge les petits besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Heremakono is a group of four women all married into polygamous families. They are on average 20 years old with one child, and all reside in the centre of Fakola, one of the sub-prefectures of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali).

They became acquainted as neighbours and all are retailers of grain cereals  and wheat flour excepting Adiarha Kone, who excels in the retail sales of yams.

Wanting to bolster their stock supply and diversify the items for sale, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso where they are beginning a first group loan cycle.

Adiarha Kone intends to use her loan to buy yams from Gueya in Ivory Coast (one of the countries bordering the Republic of Mali) where prices are very low. Adiarha sells door-to-door and at the market on fair days, to mostly women customers who pay cash and sometimes on credit.

She hopes to attain average monthly earnings of 21,000 FCFA which will serve to reimburse the loan and take care of small family needs.

loans.use: Buy yams

loans.name: Gladys Roxana

texts.es:
Gladys  es socia del Banco Comunal “22 de Setiembre” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y con un hijo, tiene grado de instrucción de cuarto de primaria.
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para incrementar el capital de su negocio de  engorde de ganado vacuno (toro).
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital  de su negocio.
Su sueño es tener toros de raza bronsuis. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, orden y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the “22 de Setiembre” (22nd of September) community bank which is located  in Ilave district, El Collao province, in the department of Puno.  She is 26 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She studied up to the fourth year of elementary school.

Gladys has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 5 years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her business fattening cattle (bulls).

She is now requesting a new loan for 3,000 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to have bulls of the Bronsuis breed.  What she most likes about her community bank is the punctuality, the order and the training sessions.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Toem

texts.en:
Mr. Toem C. and his wife Mrs. Yan Meak live on an island in the Mekong river about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1977 and have eight children (four sons and four daughters). 

Toem is a farmer. His wife sells grocery items at home and assists her husband in the farming business as well. Toem is asking for a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm. 

Photo: Mr. Toem C. is shown at home because he was not at the farm when photographed.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for farming

loans.name: 04 - Mật Sơn1- Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Liên N. Thị (16) is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Liên is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 04 - Mật Sơn1 - Đông Vệ (08.02.04 - Đông Vệ).


Liên is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To making a living, Liên owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector running a manufacturing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members.  Liên has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Liên is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    She is requesting a loan of 4,248,000 VND,  which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Liên from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. Thị Nhớ (17) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


2.  B. Thị Thắm (18) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


3.  N. Thị Thu (19) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Liên N. Thị (16) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Liên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 04 - Mật Sơn1 - Đông Vệ (08.02.04 - Đông Vệ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng tre cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Liên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Liên kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Liên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Liên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. Thị Nhớ (17) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


2.  B. Thị Thắm (18) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


3.  N. Thị Thu (19) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make bamboo products

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena K. is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a plumber. She has been through junior high school.  She sells biscuits, slippers, soft drinks and other items at Abura. Abena uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  She will use the loan to purchase more of groceries for resale. Abena hopes to  reinvest her new profits.

loans.use: To purchase more of groceries for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary J. is currently in the business of selling at hotel and is requesting a loan to to increase her capital and buy more flour.  Mary is 31 years old and is married with a husband that is a driver. She has five children and four of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot.

loans.use: to incerase her capital and buy more flour for use in her hotel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a mixing machine for her husband's work

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is a farmer who grows early spring vegetables in Kamenka, where he lives. Alexei and his wife have two daughters. He owns two land lots and five big arch greenhouses. He started this business five years ago and has invested 100,000 Grivnyas in this business. His expenses on seeds and polyethylene film amount to 30,000 Grivnyas every year. 

Alexei is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds, soil, and polyethylene film. He is hoping to have good harvest and receive additional income to be re-invested in the construction of new arch greenhouses on his property in the future.

loans.use: To purchase polyethylene film, seeds, and fertilizers for his farming business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 32 years old and married.  For five years, he has been running a Mawa (hair braiding) salon and a barber shop.  In his business, he has employed one person.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, George has become more focused in his business.  He hopes to open a very classic salon in the future.  George needs 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chairs, braids and hair chemicals for his business.

loans.use: To buy chairs, braids and hair chemicals

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en: Mrs. Sarann was born in 1988 and is married to Mr. Makara. They are farmers who own a small plot of land on which they cultivate rice. They sell part of the rice yield and use the other part to sustain their family. Mr. Makara is also a palm juice collector and a firewood salesman. In order to improve their family's income, they want to start a new business but do not have the money to do so. Thus, Mrs. Sarann is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. The couple supports a child who is 1 year old.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is married and has two children. She lives in San Pedro de Macoris in a simple home.  Nancy runs a Colmado (a small food store) where she sells goods for daily meals.  She is excited to be receiving her sixth loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and increased her business. With this loan she will buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, canned meals, etc. to increase her business inventory. Nancy uses the profits to reinvest in her business. Her most difficult challenge has been to develop her business.

loans.use: To purchasae rice, beans, sugar, oil, canned meals, etc.

loans.name: Las Daliass Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Daliass" y se ubica en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes, Agustina G. es la presidenta del grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta de trastes que inicio hace 5 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar ollas y casuelas que ya tiene comprometidas, tiene 29 años, estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria, ella vive en union libre y tiene en total 5 hijos. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada por la oportunidad que le brindan para comprar mercancia  que ya tiene comprometida con varios clientes y con esto tener más ventas y poder satisfacer la necesidad de todos sus clientes y así brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, ofreciendoles educación ya que ella quiere que tengan una carrera universitaria para que salgan adelante.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Daliass” and is located in the state of Puebla, Mexico; it has 10 members and Agustina G. is the group President.

She started selling kitchenware five years ago and is asking for a loan to buy pots and pans that she already has orders for.  She is 29 years old and finished sixth grade.  She’s in a common law relationship and has five children.

At the moment of requesting the loan she feels enthusiastic about the opportunity she’s getting to buy merchandise that several customers have already ordered from her.  This will mean more sales and being able to satisfy more customers thus providing her children with a better quality of life, providing better education for them because she wants them to have a university career so that they can do well in future.

loans.use: to buy pots and pans for her business.

loans.name: La Esperanza El Coco 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Menenciana lives in the coconut village of Samana. She and her group of 10 members are taking loans for their businesses. This group is named La Esperanza el coco (the hope of coconut) 1 & 2.

Menenciana's family is maD. up of her long-term partner and their two children. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is to reach her goal of having a good business that generates good income.

This group is dedicated to many different businesses like selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and a little restaurant. Menenciana is selling clothes. She is very excited to belong to this group and start having a loan for her business and a chance to improve her business.

Menenciana is planning on investing her new loan in the purchase of clothing. She will use her profits to continue investing in her business to improve sales, incorporating more products and saving. She hopes in the not too distant future to have her dream of building her house come true. She also wants to have good health and a more economically stable life.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Luís Alberto

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Luís Alberto le esta haciendo falta terminar la construcción de dos cuarto en la parte alta de la vivienda. 
El está solicitando un préstamo ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material que necesita como es block, varilla, cemento, y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de terminar las recamaras que serán para sus dos hijos que tiene ya que quieren tener su propio espacio en la casa. 
Pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en un taller de elaboraciones de herrería.
texts.en:
The home of Sr. Luís Alberto has two unfinished rooms on the upper floor. He is requesting a loan because he does not have the money to buy materials needed to finish the work such as blocks, rods, cement, as well as pay for labor. These two bedrooms need to be finished so that his children will have their own space in the house.

Luís Alberto will repay the loan using part of his salary that he earns working at a blacksmith shop.

loans.use: to purchase materials and pay for labor needed to finish two rooms on the upper floor of his house.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and has one child. He lives with 12 family members. Four of the family members work.

Mohamad has had a barber shop since 2005. He has more than seven years of experience in this field and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting $1,200 to buy a split air conditioner and to make a sliding door for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a split air conditioner and to make a sliding door for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her inventory.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, de 29 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Juliana de 29 años y su querida hija Nelly de 7 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En busca de clientes que deseen abordar su motocarro Alejandro pasa sus días, él despierta muy temprano para realizar su trabajo y se queda hasta altas horas de la noche trabajando, con el único fin de llevar un buen dinero a su hogar, ya que es consiente que su familia lo necesita y tiene que velar por su tranquilidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus pasajeros y hacerles pasar un momento agradable, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que dejar a su familia todo el día, pero sabe que lo tiene que hacer para darles más comodidades. Con  el tiempo espera comprar un nuevo motocarro para ponerlo a trabajar y tener mejores ingresos. Este será su séptimo crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido puntual en sus pagos, ya que no quiere crearle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual participa activamente y es un socio muy querido. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas llantas para su motocarro, ya que las actuales ya están muy gastadas.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 29, is a simple, hard-working man who lives in his own house with his wife Juliana, age 29, and his lovely daughter Nelly, 7, for whom he wants to provide a better lifestlye.  Alejandro gets up early to go out and find customers requiring his transportation services, and he works late into the night.  This is to provide an income for his family because he is conscious of how much they need it so as not to worry.  What he likes most about his job is talking to the passengers and making them feel comfortable.  He has been in business for 10 years and believes the hardest part of his work is having to be away from the family all day, although he knows this is necessary to provide them with a more comfortable lifestyle.

In the future he hopes to buy a new motor-car so he can work and earn more income.  This is his seventh loan through MFP.  He has always made his payments on time and does not want to cause problems for the communal bank, since he is an active and well-liked member.  With the 1,000 PEN he is requesting he plans to buy new tires for his motor-car since the current ones are very worn.

loans.use: To buy tires for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell natural products and to pay off an industrial machine she's paying for.

loans.name: Jose Vladimir

texts.es:
Jose Vladimir es un hombre trabajador y pertenece a una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.

El está solicitando un préstamo de ₡500.000 (quinientos mil colones), para la compra de abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos de semillas de maíz y frijol, ya que es una alternativa fiable y sostenible. Con estos abonos, Jose aumentara la capacidad que posee el suelo de absorber los distintos elementos nutritivos y con los fungicidas que utilizara gracias a este préstamo también evitara que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, para que al ingerirlos sus clientes no corran peligro de adquirir alguna enfermedad. Y así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes, alcanzara la meta de venta que se ha propuesto para cada mes. Y además dará a abasto con todas sus obligaciones y pagos para así sacar adelante a su numerosa familia.

El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, una de las 110 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Jose Vladimir is an unassuming man who lives in Concepción de Pilas in Puntarenas province, a community in the southern part of Costa Rica. The local economy there is based on agriculture, especially livestock and the cultivation of tubers, coffee, corn, and beans.

He is requesting a loan of 500,000 colones to buy manure and fungicides to protect his corn and bean crops, since these crops are reliable and sustainable. With the fertilizer Jose will increase the capacity of the soil to absorb the various nutrients, and with the fungicides that he will use thanks to this loan he will avoid a fungal infection in his crops so that they will be safe for his customers to eat.  In this way, he will provide good quality products to his customers, and he will reach the sales goal that he has set for each month.  It will also give him the means to meet all of his obligations and payments so that he can provide for his large family.

He is a member of the "Dante" communal bank, one of the 110 communal banks that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to cultivate corn and beans.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina, 57, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Maximo, a farmer, and is the mother of two children who already have their own families. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Josefina operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower and dahlias, as well as a variety of hanging plants and others. She also grows local banana and pineapple in her small farm for extra income. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales daily.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy fertilizer and garden supplies for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Josefina dreams of being able to expand her farm and garden through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farm and garden supplies and materials she needs for her business.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 32 years old. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. The family is currently residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has engaged in a motorcycle transport business activity to earn a living. She had this business for 3 years. Getting 5,000 PHP requires Jenelyn to have proper budgeting skills to cover her daily needs.

In 2009, she joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase motor tires and a head light to improve the service quality. Jenelyn hopes to improve the general living conditions of the family by sustaining and expanding the business venture she now handles.

loans.use: to purchase motor tires and headlight to improve the service quality

loans.name: Renee

texts.en:
Renee does not mind being one of the few young women in a very aggressive line of business – construction. In 2005 she started a construction company named Dorsey Bryant Gen Contractors, LLC with jobs ranging from installations to total home renovations, and also including major commercial projects. 

Although it has been a challenge for Renee to overcome the fact that she is young, and female, which is sometimes frowned upon in her line of work, she has not been discouraged. Renee has recently secured her first major commercial contract for the City of New Orleans, an impressive feat for most small businesses. The Kiva funds will allow Renee to have the working capital she needs to truly claim her place as one of the best contractors in New Orleans.

loans.use: to invest in commercial contract expenses.

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto de oficio zapatero, desde hace varios años, oficio que aprendió junto a su padre. Es soltero, y trabaja en un mercado de la capital.
Hoy en día cuenta con sus propias herramientas de trabajo, su máquina de coser zapatos, su esmeril, pues lo ha logrado a través de financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en  seis ciclos, siendo el medio más favorable pagando en cuotas flexibles. Sus préstamos han sido para el aumento de inventario de su negocio.
Con este nuevo crédito comprara: suelas de zapatos, hilo nylon, pega, agujas, cuero, tacones, logrando dar un mejor servicios a sus clientes.
Sus planes es formar su propia familia, y tener su propia casa, es por tal razón quiere crecer en su negocio y que le sea rentable.
texts.en:
Humberto is a shoemaker by profession and has been for several years. He learned this trade from his father. He is single and works in a capital in the capital.  

At present he has his own tools, his shoe sewing machine, and his file. With loans from Afodenic during six cycles. This is his favorite because of its flexible payments. The loans have been to increase his business inventory. 

With this new loan, he will buy: shoe soles, nylon thread, glue, needles, leather, and heels, obtaining a better service for his customers.

His plans are to start a family and have his own house. That is the reason he wants to grow his business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials for his shoe shop. He will buy soles, glue, nylon thread and heels, among other things for his workload.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself as industrious, intelligent, and honest. She operates a rolling store where she sells onions, tomatoes, fruits, and cabbage. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are local households and travelers. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate space for her business operations. She will use the 9,000 PHP loan to purchase vegetables and maize to sell. Her business goal is to become involved in the sale of ready-made clothing within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, tomato, eggplant and mango to sell

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en:
From Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province, Mrs. Chhoeum has spent her life making plastic kindling that can be used to make a fire. She also buys finished goods from other villagers who make these kind of products at a low cost.  She then sells the kindling for a higher price in the neighboring country, Thailand.

Mrs. Chhoeum is married and blessed with three children who are single and are supported by her income. Some of them attend the local public school. Outside of her business, Mrs. Chhoeum also assists her husband growing the rice crop on her existing farmland. This couple normally generates an average of $6USD per day to cover their daily expenses for living. Mrs. Choeum has run out of raw materials, so she would like to borrow some funds from Kiva to use as capital to buy additional materials for producing her goods. In the future, Mrs. Chhoeum hopes she will be able to support all her children in achieving a high level of education and to buy a plowing machine for farming business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for producing her goods.

loans.name: Carmen Soledad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Carmen Soledad; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de contadora, ella tiene un estudio contable donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de su trabajo la socia quiere seguir saliendo adelante, la socia quiere seguir estudiando y mejorar en su profesión de contadora. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar la maestría  de su carrera que está realizando en la universidad. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen Soledad belongs to Hatun Rumiyoc Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

She is 27 years old and single.  She alternates her daily activities with her job as an accountant.  She has an accounting office where she works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m.  By means of her job, Carmen Soledad wants to continue getting ahead.  She wants to continue studying and improve in her profession as an accountant.

She is requesting the loan to pay for the master's degree in her field that she is pursuing in the university.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: pay for the master's degree in her field that she is pursuing in the university.

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en: Leonie is 27 years old and is married, with a one-year-old child. She runs a store where she sells clothes. She has been working in this business for 6 years. The business has helped her to provide food for her family. Leonie would like a loan to buy more clothes to sell in her store.  She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and create savings for her family"s future.

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco José tiene su negocio que es la venta de llantas y repuestos para vehículos. Tiene más de 4 años en su negocio, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos por lo que se encuentra muy contento de tener esta oportunidad. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de llantas, sistema de amortiguación, aceites, parachoques, radiadores entre otros. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y al mismo tiempo seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Francisco José has a business selling tires and vehicle parts. He has been in his business for more than four years. This is not the first time that he has taken out loans, so he is very happy to have this opportunity.  

He is applying for the loan in order to buy tires, shock absorbers, oil, bumpers, radiators, and other things. He dreams of expanding his business, and continuing to move forward.

loans.use: To buy tires, shock absorbers, oil, bumpers, radiators and other things.

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Jerlyn is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream - to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Hochi

texts.ru: Хочи является одной из пунктуальных и честных клиентов нашей организации, которая кредитуется в Арванде с 2007 года и каждый свой кредит использует целенаправленно для расширения бизнеса и получения хорошего дохода. Ей 53 года и она мать четверых взрослых детей. Её муж работает на насосной станции и его доход минимальный, всего 270 сомони или 55 долларов в месяц, поэтому бизнес приносит дополнительный доход для семьи. Прожиточный минимум у данной семьи на среднем уровне, по бизнесу ей помогает её младшая дочь Нигора. Её место деятельности  расположено на центральном рынке. В основном у неё свои постоянные покупатели на сумки, а также и клиенты уезжавшие в Россию. Которые покупают у неё чемоданы. На снимке Хочи у кассы в день выдачи, при получении кредита. На кредит в 1500 сомони она собирается завезти новые виды сумок и чемоданов. Она благодарна кредиторам и «Арванду» за понимание и своевременную поддержку ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Hochi is one of the punctual and honest clients of our organization, who has been obtaining loans from Arvand since 2007 and have used each of her loans purposely for business expansion and making good profits.  Hochi is 53 years old, and she is a mother of four adult children.  Her husband works at a pressure station and earns a minimum income of only 270 somoni or 55 dollars per month, and this is why the business brings in an additional income for the family.  The family has an average living minimum.  Hochi's youngest daughter, Nigora, helps her with the business.  Hochi's place of business is located among the rows of women's purses sales at the central Panshanbe market.  She primarily has loyal purse customers and also customers who leave for Russia and need to buy suitcases.  The photograph shows Hochi at the cash register on the day of loan disbursement.  She plans to use the 1500 somoni loan to bring in new types of purses and suitcases.  She is grateful to the creditors and "Arvand" for the understanding and timely support of her business.

loans.use: to expand the selection of purses and suitcases

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
Андрей  - один из лучших клиентов Надежды Украины в данной городе. Он постоянно пользуется микрокредитами. Ему очень удобно, так как кредиты - это быстрая возможность пополнить свои оборотные средства. В этот раз Андрею нужно закупить оптом большую партию пленки для продажи.

В бизнесе Андрея все в порядке. У него много постоянных клиентов, которые покупают у него пленку. Поэтому сейчас Андрей торгует у себя дома, на рынок не выезжает. Это экономит ему время, а значит и деньги.
texts.en:
Andrei is one of the best clients of Hope Ukraine in his town. He uses microloans all the time. This is very practical for him since loans allow him to replenish his working capital quickly. This time, Andrei needs to buy wholesale a big lot of [polyethylene] film.

Andrei’s business is going well. He has many loyal customers who buy [polyethylene] film from him. This is why Andrei is now able to sell out of his home, without traveling to the market. This allows him to save time, which   means saving money too.

loans.use: to purchase  wholesale a big lot of polyethylene film for resale

loans.name: Alejandro Bienvenido

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este hermoso lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive don Alejandro, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 9, 8 y 2 años, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. La mujer se dedica a las labores de la casa.

Él para poder llevar lo necesario a su hogar desde pequeño se dedica a las faenas de la pesca, cuenta que desde hace 12 años con los ahorros que tenia y con ayuda de sus padres pudo adquirir una lancha en la cual realiza sus actividades de pesca, el junto a otra persona se embarcan en la noche y no regresan sino hasta el otro dia con los frutos que el mar les ha dado, para luego entregar estos productos a comerciantes que llegan hasta este lugar para llevar el pescado a otras ciudades.
 
Este crédito es para comprar materiales de pesca y combustibles elementos indispensables para realizar sus faenas diarias. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad de recibir los créditos. 

Sus deseos son siempre tener buena pesca y que no les falte nada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Jaime Roldos communal bank meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo (Manta) canton.  This place is know for its beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this beautiful place.  Most of the inhabitants here are very hard-workers, and they dedicate themselves to tasks related to the sea.

Alejandro, age 29, lives here.  He is in a common-law-marriage, and he has three children; ages nine, eight, and two.  The two older ones go to school.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores.

In order to bring home the necessities for his household he has, ever since he was little, devoted himself to fishing.  He says that 12 years ago he used the savings he had, and with help from his parents, he was able to get a small boat.  He uses the boat to fish.  Together with another person he embarks in the night and does not return until the next day with the fruits that the sea has given him.  He then delivers these products to merchants who come to this place to take the fish to other cities.

This loan is to buy fishing materials and indispensable fuel in order to carry out his everyday business activities.  He has been in the bank since its beginning, and he likes it because of the opportunity to receive loans.

His dreams are always to have good fishing and that his children will lack for nothing.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials and fuel.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is married and has a five-year-old daughter. She describes herself as an honest woman with integrity. She has been selling food products and basins for the last three years. Her business is in a conducive environment. In addition, Pamela provides motorcycle transportation. 
Pamela faces the challenge of insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use this loan of 20,000 KES to buy more products such as flour, snacks, basins, etc. Pamela dreams of expanding her business and owning at least three motorcycles within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy more products such as flour, snacks, basins, etc.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah sells cosmetics at the local market where passersby and town dwellers are her customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Serah is applying for a 50,000 KES loan through Yehu to buy stock such as shampoo, body lotions and hair weaves for her shop. She dreams of growing her business and making more money in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock for her cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce wants to buy 4sacks of sugar, 3sacks of flour, 5boxes of soap and 100kg of cooking fat.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba E. lives and runs a small retail business in Aghsu city where she sells fruits and vegetables. She is a 59-year-old widow of four children. Nasiba wants to expand her inventory to provide other food and household items for her customers.

loans.use: purchase more inventory

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a shopkeeper, selling groceries, soft drinks and canned goods. She is 65 years old and has been in business for 25. Her husband is 83 years old and her three children are married and living independently and do not help her so she must tend the shop to make a living. Her home and shop are in the same building in the Obispo Indaburo neighborhood in La Paz. It is a neighborhood grocery store so she sells every day. She has been an IMPRO client since September of 2004 with a first-class repayment record, which along with her experience recommends her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Francisca es comerciante, tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, refrescos y conservas. Tiene 65 años y tres hijos, su experiencia en el rubro es mas de 25 años, su esposo tiene 83 años por lo que el único ingreso que tiene se origina en la tienda ya que sus hijos son casados e independientes y no le ayudan por lo cual la señora tiene que atender su tienda para solventar sus gastos familiares. Vive en la zona de Obispo Indaburo de la ciudad de La Paz, y su tienda se encuentra ubicada en el mismo domicilio. Sus ventas son diarias ya que como es una tienda de barrio los productos que vende son al detalle. Es cliente de Impro, desde septiembre del año 2004. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Muy Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de abarrotes, refrescos y conservas. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Moy

texts.en: Mrs. Moy Y. is the mother of 3 children and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is 32 years old and makes her living selling fish at a nearby market where she earns around $4 per day. Her husband is a fisherman and makes on average about $4 per day. One of her children is enrolled primary school, while the rest are too young to attend school at the moment. Moy Y. needs a motorbike to help transport her fish from and to the market. In the future, she would like to save enough money to purchase fishing nets, and other tools to help her husband's fishery.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle to take her to the fish market

loans.name: Khatidja

texts.en: Khatidja is 45 years old, single, and lives in Khachmaz town. She started this business five years ago. She sells glassware, and now she needs a loan of $725 to buy a lot of stock to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a lot of glassware

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Mrs. Ruth Yesin is 46 years old and lives in Benin City.  She sells clothes, bags, shoes, cream and powder to people living in her community. She has been in this business since 1997 and a LAPO client for 4 years. She is married with 5 children. Mrs. Ruth hopes to receive $625 for purchase of clothes, shoes, bags, cream and powder for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, bags cream & powder for re-sale

loans.name: Salomi

texts.en: My name is Salomi B.. I am married with two children, both of whom attend school. I wish them a good future and a higher education so that they can find good jobs for themselves. My husband buys the gold residue that is turned out when jewelry is carved out of gold. He then melts this residue and makes small gold bars out of it. He is in the process of expanding his business for which he requests a loan of $250.He will buy the gold residue in suitable quantity with this loan.

loans.use: To expand gold residue business

loans.name: Chavela

texts.es:
Chevela is a brave woman who has done agricultural work in far off fields since she was a child. She takes her cattle and sheep out to pasture every day, and her only means of transportation is her beloved horse who always accompanies her. She enjoys her daily labor, and on weekend she travels to the markets in her area to sell her small animals in order to give daily sustenance to the members of her household. She is a single mother, and she continues working with the great responsibility which she bears. Her dream is to increase the amount of livestock that she cares for. In order to continue realizing part of this dream, Chavela is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of a cow. You can help this brave woman to continue her work.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Chavela es una mujer valiente, que desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas, en campos muy lejanos.Ella se va todos los días a pastar a sus vacas y ovejas y su único medio de transporte es su querido caballo que siempre la acompaña, disfruta diariamente de su trabajo y los fines de semana viaja a las ferias de su zona para vender sus pequeños animalitos para otorgarles sustento diario a los miembros de su hogar.Es madre soltera por la inmensa responsabilidad que recae sobre ella sigue esforzándose. Tiene el sueño de incrementar la cantidad de ganado que posee bajo su protección.Ahora para continuar con parte de esos sueños Chavela solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de una vaca. Ayuda a esta mujer con gran valor para trabajar.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Rahila

texts.ru:
Rahila lives in Saalti with her husband and 10 children. She is 57 years old and has been in business for 25 years. Her husband (shown in the photo) and oldest son help her with her business. They own a veterinary drugstore and need to obtain new supplies of medicine. Rahila has applied to the Saalti branch of Normicro for a loan of $1000, to be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахиля живет в городе Саатлы вместе со своей семьей - мужем и 10 детьми. Ей 57 лет. Бизнесом она занимается вот уже 25 лет. В этом ей помогает муж (он на фото) и старший сын.Они содержат ветеренарную аптеку.В данный момент им нужно приобрести новые препараты. И Рахиля обратилась в Саатлинский филиал Нормикро для получения кредита в сумме 1000 USD на 12 месяцев

loans.use: To buy new medicines

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Mrs. Babita A. lives in a single family with her husband and children in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur, Nepal. Her husband, Mr. Bashanta A., is in the Nepalese army. Her daughter is studying in grade 7 and her son is in grade 6.

Mrs. A. started her poultry farm three years ago to improve their standard of living. She sells her chickens in the local market. People also come to her home and buys chickens from her. Due to the lack of money, she can’t buy small chickens for her farm, so she is requesting for her second loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy small chickens.

loans.use: To buy small chickens

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday U. sells electronics. This is a business he has been into for 2 years. He is from Edo State, Nigeria. He is 27 years old and married with 7 children. He needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more electronics for sale.

loans.use: To buy electronics for sale

loans.name: Soch

texts.en: Mrs. Soch H., 36, earns about $3.66 per day making bricks. Her husband, Srey Pek is a farmer and earns around $4.96 per day. They live with three children in Thmey Village, in the Siem Reap Province. Their children are young and attend school so they are responsible for family’s expenses. To increase income, they need to expand their business. H. is seeking a loan of $1,100 to purchase pieces of wood to stock and fuel oils for machine using in their business. This loan can expand their business and increase income for supporting expenses.

loans.use: To purchase pieces of wood to stock and fuel oils for machine using in their business

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
Sabohat M. is a 32-year-old widow living with her parents. In order to support her parents over the last 10 years, she has been running her own business. In fact, her business is very successful and generates stable, significant income, thereby allowing Sabohat to improve her family's living conditions.

More specifically, Sabohat sells fruits and vegetables, such as tomatoes, cucumbers, apricots, strawberries, and apples. She begins her workday early each day at 5:00 a.m., and she buys fruits and vegetables from local farmers and thereafter sells such produce in the market. Importantly, she sells her goods at attractive (i.e., reasonable) prices, so her business is popular amongst shoppers at the market.

Currently, she is seeking to purchase fresh fruits and vegetables in order to increase the variety of goods she sells. Consequently, she is hereby requesting 2,400 Somoni ($700) to be repaid within 12 months. Sabohat is counting on your help, and she wants to express her gratitude for everyone who supports her.

loans.use: To diversify the products she offers for sale by purchasing additional fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Las Margaritas De Atitlan Group

texts.en:
The women from the Margaritas de Atitlan group from Santiago Atitlan enjoy their community and like working in a group. Their main business activities are weaving and embroidery. They weave some items from the traditional indigenous outfit and embroiders the colorful designs on the top, which is known as a guipil. They sell these pieces to either intermediaries, local buyers or to people who order beforehand in the markets of Santiago and Panajachel, Lake Atitlan’s largest towns. During the rainy season (these months) their sales drop substantively. Otherwise, their microenterprises are doing well.

This credit has enabled them to invest in their small businesses. However, they consistently need more capital to continually spur the growth of their businesses. The credit they have requested will help them invest in not only cloth, dyes and thread, but in larger investments such as sewing machines and equipment.

The words of Maria del Carmen sum up the general sentiment of the mothers from this group, “I desire a better future for my kids and family.” She wants to enlarge the business so that life is a little easier.

loans.use: to purchase thread to embroider and weave guipiles

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sarorn N. lives in the Sya Village, Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer, while her husband, Chean Chuob, earns income collecting palm juice to process into palm sugar. The couple has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while two others are attending school. The youngest one is still too young to study. Mrs. Sarorn N. currently faces an obstacle to her farming business, because she does not have enough animals to plow her field. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy a cow for this purpose. Mrs. Sarorn N. already has experience with borrowing from AMK - she used the previous loan to buy a cow for breeding, and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow for a farming business

loans.name: Thi Oanh's Group

texts.vi:
chị C. thị Oanh năm nay 48 tuổi Ms 06020014, chị là một phụ nữ rất chịu khó, nhiệt tình và năng động. Chị làm chi hội trưởng phụ nữ tại thôn nên chị có điều kiện tiếp cận với các dịch vụ vốn vay, nhờ có chị mà các chị em phụ nữ khác có điều kiện tiếp cận với các loại vốn đặc biệt là tài chính vi mô Bình Minh. Chị tuyên truyền những ưu điểm của vốn, đồng thời tuyên truyền, giúp đỡ, hướng dẫn chị em làm kinh tế để cung nhau thoát nghèo. Chị và nhóm đã vay vốn qua một chu kỳ và trả vốn rất tốt, lần này chị đăng ký vay ở mức 4.704.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. Hàng ngày chồng và con đi làm công nhân, nên gia đình chị có thu nhập ổn định từ 150.000 VND đến 180.000 VND / ngày. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Lê thị Hà Ms 06020015 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để thu mua phế liệu
  • chị Nguyễn thị Phương Ms 06020017 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn
  • anh Nguyễn ngọc Cường MS 06020018 vay mức 4.256.000 VND mua than để sản xuất gạch ngói
  • chị Nguyễn thị Yến Ms 06020019 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để kinh doanh quần áo
  • chị P. thị Thơm Ms 06020020 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để chăn nuôi vịt đẻ
  • chị Hoàng thị Hường Ms 06020021 vay mức 3.360.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn
  • chị N. thị Xuân Ms 06020022 vay mức 2.016.000 VND để chăn nuôi gà, lợn
texts.en:
Mrs C. thị Oanh is 48 years old. She is a hard working woman, active & enthusiast. She is the leader of the women group in her village so it gives her opportunity to come to know about SEDA. Thanks to her, other women from her village have been able to get loans form SEDA as well. She spread words around about the benefits of programs like SEDA. She guides and supports other members to overcome poverty. She and her group has paid back a loan successfully. This time she is seeking 4.704.000 VND to invest in her pig raising business. Her husband and son have a job so their family income is stable, 150.000 VND -180.000 VND a day. Other members of the group are:
  • Mrs Lê thị Hà Ms, she is seeking 4.256.000 VND. She collects/sells waste material
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Phương, she is seeking 4.256.000 VND. She raises pigs
  • Mr Nguyễn ngọc Cường, he is seeking 4.256.000 VND. He is a brick maker
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Yến Ms, she is seeking 4.256.000 VND. She sells clothes
  • Mrs P. thị Thơm Ms, she is seeking 4.256.000 VND. She raise ducks
  • Mrs Hoàng thị Hường Ms, she is seeking 3.360.000 VND. She raises pigs
  • Mrs N. thị Xuân Ms, she is seeking 2.016.000 VND. She raises pigs and chickens

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raise pigs

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Sareth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank, located in Kong Chey Village, consists of eighteen people who plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sok S. has been selected by the members as the village bank president. She is 47 years old, and the mother of two children who attend the local school. She is a farmer who owns a one hectare rice field. She faces a small problem in her plantation, because her field is now infertile. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sok S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers in order to make her field and crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Taing Than, is a teacher who earns roughly $50 per month, but this is not enough income to support their family.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product, because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. This type of loan allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term; but most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a 0% default rate on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers in order to make her rice field and crops more productive.

loans.name: Freddy Santos

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote en la ciudad de León el señor Freddy Z. se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 16 años. Actualmente es padre de dos hijos los cuales debe de mantener brindándoles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo escolar.

La razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar fertilizantes para su cosecha de sorgo y de maíz. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto el como su familia por eso es que espera que su solicitud sea aprobada y de esta forma obtener el capital financiero para continuar en su negocio de Agricultura.
texts.en:
