In the town of Nagarote in the city of León, Señor Freddy Z. is dedicated to agricultural activities and has been for sixteen years. Presently he is the father of two children; he must continue providing them with the conditions necessary for their scholastic development. His reason for coming to Ceprodel is to obtain a loan with which he will buy fertilizers for his sorghum and corn crops. He and his family will benefit a lot from this loan, and so he is waiting for his request to be granted, and in this way he will have the financial capital to continue with his business in agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fertilizers

loans.name: Aem

texts.en:
Mrs. Aem P. is a villager in Prey Takap village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. She faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to support her living. 

Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living with this loan after she sells the cow. 

She is a 68 years old widow and the grandmother of two grandsons who attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Rhoida S.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Rhoida M. from Mbarali. She is married with 2 children, aged 10 and 14.  Rhoida has been running a rice milling machine since 2006. She works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband.  Rhoida  currently earns about 350 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 775 USD in order to renovate her office.  In the future, she plans to change her business.  Rhoida  thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To renovate her office

loans.name: Apaula

texts.en: Apaula F., 27, is married with 4 children. She has 1 year of experience in a pig business. She sells to the public and village people 5 days per week. She is a new member, with just one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala. SPBD loans are Apaula’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther Q. is a married woman with three children. Some have completed junior high school and one has completed senior high school. She is a forty year old business woman. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a suburb of Accra. Esther started trading twelve years ago and she enjoys selling goods. She trades in clothing materials. Esther believes in hard work and dedication. She has gained lots of marketing experience, making her one of the successful traders in Abeka market. She believes the loan would give her the capital to purchase more stock of clothing materials to serve her customers. She procures her fabrics from the textile depots around her community. Esther says she wants to sponsor her children in school to make it to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To procure textile fabrics

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca B. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received no formal education. Rebecca sells clothing at Atobiase near Elmina, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a farmer. Rebecca uses her income to assist her husband with the house keeping expenses. Rebecca will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of clothing and meet the increased demands of her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land for the building of the family house so that she can stop paying rent and also provide comfortable shelter for the family.

loans.use: As additional capital to increase the sale of clothing to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es: E l señor Eliseo C. tiene la edad de 50 años habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla junto a su esposa, ella es ama de casa; ellos tiene cuatro hijos, pero a su cargo tienen tres. El varón de 22 años que  le apoya en el taller de mecánica, la joven de 18 años es estudiante de secundaria al igual que el joven de 13 estudia actualmente y una de 20 años que es casada. Don Eliseo desde hace veinte años trabaja en la agricultura el rubro mas fuerte es el plátano y la piña, el inicio a trabajar las tierras ya que el compro un terreno y con sus propios esfuerzos y el de su familia han logrado establecer una manzana de piña y una manzana de plátano los cuales necesitan manteniendo y no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos. Se siente contento por que tiene la mano amiga de Afodenic que a través de sus prestamos logra tener una producción mejor que es de gran beneficio para su familia.
texts.en:
Eliseo C. is 50 years old, and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla area with his wife who is a homemaker. They have four children, three of whom are still under their care: a 22- year old son who helps in the mechanical workshop, an 18-year old daughter and 13-year old son who are in school, and a 20-year old daughter who is married. Eliseo has worked as a banana and pineapple farmer for the past twenty years. He started working on land that he purchased, and through his own efforts and that of his family, they have managed to establish a block of pineapple and a block of banana. These need maintenance, and he doesn’t have the resources necessary to purchase fertilizers and supplies. He feels content because he has the helping hand of Afodenic and, through its loans, he has managed to have a better crop production which is of great benefit to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase farming/agricultural supplies to improve his crop production.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr:
H. Christine est née le 12/11/1975 à Cotonou mais elle est originaire de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du BENIN. Christine est mariée à VIDJENNANGNI Anasthase un mécanicien auto et elle est mère d'une fille de trois ans qui est à la maternelle. Christine vit chez ses beaux parents à GBENONKPO, un quartier populaire de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Christine a abandonné l'école en cinquième année du cours primaire par manque de soutient financier. Après son mariage,  Christine s'est lancée dans la vente des bassines, bols et plats en série. L'activité de Christine est très florissante. Christine achète ses marchandises à Lomé, Capitale du TOGO un pays frontalier du Bénin. Actuellement, Christine n'arrive plus à satisfaire toute la demande de sa clientèle. En effet, Christine  manque d'argent pour acheter toutes les commandes de ses clients. C'est pourquoi Christine demande un troisième crédit à ALIDé pour renforcer son capital enfin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
H. Christine was born on November 12, 1975 in Cotonou but traces her roots to Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of BENIN. She is married to VIDJENNANGNI Anasthase, an auto mechanic, and she is the mother of a 3-year-old daughter in pre-school. Christine lives in the home of her in-laws in GBENONKPO, a highly populated district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She dropped out of school in her fifth year of primary school due to a lack of financial support. After her marriage, she got started in selling sets of tubs and basins, bowls, and plates. Her business is booming. She buys merchandise in Lomé, the capital of TOGO, a country bordering Bénin. Right now, Christine is no longer able to satisfy all the demands of her customers. This is why she's asking ALIDÉ for a third loan, so as to bolster her capital in order to satisfy her customers better.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basins, bowls, and plates

loans.name: Eni

texts.en: Eni S., 41, is married with no children.  She has many years of experience in the Elei printing business. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Eni’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase printing boards, fabric materials, fabric paints, brushes and roller kit

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
L. Phạm Thị (522980520) is a 57 year-old female living in the town of Nam Định. She is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living L. owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. L. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3500000 VND a month.

In 1998, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. L. successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000000 VND from TYM Fund that she used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. L. is now requesting a loan of 15000000 VND which she will use to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be her 10th loan from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 34 year old woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Iman has owned a sportswear clothing shop. She hasrequested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for the summer season. This is the first time that Iman has requested a loan. 
Iman is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and her shop is well positioned. Her clients are people from her region. Iman decided on doing her business because of her experience in sales. In the future, she plans on expanding her shop by selling sports accessories.

loans.use: Iman will use the loan to purchase merchandise for the summer season.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana A. runs a cold store by the roadside in her community. She sells fresh fish, beef, chicken, turkey, etc. She supplies local retailers and food vendors. Diana buys cartons of fresh fish and meat from big cold stores in Kumasi. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

Diana is the mother of two children, both boys, who are currently in junior high and primary schools. She is 30 years old and married. Diana’s husband is a professional teacher. They live in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She wants to expand her business and give her sons the best of education.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and meat

loans.name: Shamshad Muhammad Bota Group

texts.en:
Shamshad baji has been a citizen of a city named Arifwala in Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband's name is M. B. and he runs a food business in the community. People come from different towns to place orders because of his quality food. He sells specifically Punjabi food items such as samosas and Dahi bhala. Shamshad baji prepares these items. Her husband admits that his whole success belongs to his wife, Shamshad. She feels very proud of this compliment. She is applying for a loan to buy materials (flour, spices and cooking oil) to expand the food-selling business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Rashida baji and Maqboolan baji each want a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy materials (sugar, dry fruits and cooking oil) for her sweetmeat-selling business. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Shamshad baji is seated in the middle of the members.

loans.use: To buy materials for food-selling business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 34 años, tiene 3 hijas que cursan estudios primarios y cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposa. Desde hace 3 años es socio y trabaja en un restaurante especializado en pollo a la brasa, junto con su hermana, él es el encargado de azar los pollos y freír las papas, mientras que su  hermana atiende a los clientes. Jorge se siente muy satisfecho con este trabajo porque es un negocio independiente y seguro. Además le gusta mucho ver a los comensales degustar los pollos dorados y las papas crocantes que elabora. Por otro lado, le es muy rentable porque este tipo de restaurante, conocido como “pollería” es muy concurrido en cualquier zona de su ciudad. El deseo de Jorge para el futuro es tener su propia pollería, donde todas las ganancias sean para él y su familia. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos son muy unidos y cumplidos con sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando lo usará para incrementar su capital de inversión para su negocio y también comprará materiales de construcción para reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jorge is 34 years old and, together with his very supportive wife, has three daughters in elementary school. For the last three years he has been a part-owner of a restaurant that specializes in roast chicken, also working in the restaurant with his sister. He is responsible for roasting the chickens and frying the potatoes while she waits on the customers. Jorge is very satisfied with this work because the business is independent and stable. He also really likes to see his customers enjoy the golden chicken and crispy potatoes that he makes. The business is very profitable, since this kind of chicken restaurant is very popular in any neighborhood in his town. Jorge's dream for the future is to own his own chicken restaurant, where all of the profits will go to him and his family. This is his fifth loan with MFP. What he enjoys about working with his community bank is that everyone is very united and responsible with their payments. The money that he is requesting will be used to increase his capital share in the business and also to purchase construction materials to repair his home.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital investment in restaurant; home repairs

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a 38-year-old divorced woman who has five children between the ages of 9 and 20 years. All of her children go to school. 

She owns and lives in a two-room house with six other people. Madina doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity, but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She lives and works in a semi-urban area.

Madina sells charcoal in one of the Kampala suburbs. She uses public transportation to go shopping. Madina sells to an average of 10 people each day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food for her family. 

She has been in this business for ten years. Madina has been with MCDT for four years and is now servicing her ninth loan with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more rice, cooking oil, wheat, flour, sugar, and salt. Madina hopes that her business grow bigger and she dreams of owning a house on the land that she bought with her business profits.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Señor Daniel tiene 45 años de edad, es casado, vive en su casa propia con su cónyuge y tres de sus hijos de los cuales dos están trabajando por cuenta propia, una de ellas tiene también un Puesto de Ventas a lado del puesto de su padre. El cliente nació y se crió en la zona de Encarnación.
EL cliente trabaja en la zona baja de Encarnación desde hace 15 años, allí posee dos puestos de ventas de mercaderías y de productos naturales, artículos electrónicos como calculadoras, linternas, pilas, accesorios para celulares, etc. El señor tiene ya formada una clientela que semanalmente le compran y le genera un buen ingreso como para que pueda cubrir los gastos del hogar y sus obligaciones. 
El señor también realiza ventas de sus productos en su domicilio en donde tiene un pequeño local del que se encarga de atender su señora, eso hace que se pueda tener otra fuente de ingresos en el flujo familiar y que además su señora pueda ayudar a generar ingresos sin descuidar la casa. 
El Señor Daniel esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de mas mercaderías para surtir sus puestos. El monto que solicita es de gs. 2.000.000.
texts.en:
Daniel is 45 and married. He lives in his own house with his spouse and three of their children. Two of their children are working on their own. One of them also has a sales stand next to her father’s stand. He was born and raised in the Encarnación area. He has worked in the lower elevation area of Encarnacion for 15 years. He has two sales stands there, and he sells merchandise such as natural products and electronic products like calculators, flashlights, batteries, and cell phone accessories, etc. He has an established customer base, and they buy from him weekly. This generates good income so that he can pay the household expenses and his obligations. He also sells products in his home where he has a small place, which his wife runs. This allows him to have another source of family income, and it allows his wife to help generate income and still take care of the house. Daniel is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to stock his stands. He is asking for gs. 2.000.000.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise: calculators, radios, flashlights, clocks, batteries, cell phone chargers, natural remedies, etc.

loans.name: Magna

texts.en:
Magna is a member of the Miraculous Maria village bank. She is 50 years-old and married. She has a son who is 15 years old and studies at a private school. Magna has a business selling newspapers and a motorcyle-taxi that she rents out. 

Magna needs a new loan of 3400 soles to buy merchandise like newspapers and magazines. She is going to start a new newspapers stand in the neighborhood where she lives. She already hired someone to sell the newspapers. Her dream is to give the best education to her daughter.

loans.use: To buy newspapers and magazines.

loans.name: Luceritos De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
“Luceritos De Los Andes”, es el nombre que agrupa una asociación de once personas, se reúnen en el centro focal Los Andes hace tres años aproximadamente y realizan sus actividades de forma responsable.
La base de los negocios que tiene este grupo son los alimentos, por ejemplo Lidia y Fanny se dedican a la venta de pescado crudo, en ferias de la zona, Nincolaza  elabora y vende almuerzos , Victoria comercia con verduras, German tienen una tienda de abarrotes. Las socias precisan capital para poder realizar la compra de  insumos y productos,
texts.en:
“Luceritos De Los Andes” is the name of a group of 11 persons who have been meeting in the Promujer Los Andes central office for approximately 3 years, and who carry out their activities in a responsible manner. Most of the members are involved in businesses related to food, for example, Lidia and Fanny sell raw fish in the markets in the area, Nincolaza produces and sells lunches, Victoria sells vegetables, and German has a grocery store. The members need capital in order to purchase supplies and products for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies and products

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es:
La señora Marciana es socia del Banco Comunal “Primero de Agosto” de distrito de Zepita, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 40 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos, vive en el Barrio Porteño, ella estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde.

Su mayor deseo es sacar profesionales a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sra. Marciana is a member of the Communal Bank “Primero de Agosto” (First of August), which is located in the District of Zepita, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children. Marciana lives in the neighborhood of Porteño and has a high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 3 years. Her first loan of 300 soles allowed her to increase her business capital for buying and selling sheep. Marciana is now requesting a new loan of 500 soles to purchase additional sheep for fattening.

Her greatest wish is to see her children become professionals. She enjoys her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en: Rosenda G. is from the village of Tipan. She is 50 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Rosenda owns and operates a manufacturing business making false teeth in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Rosenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna R. is from the village of Pines Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Myrna is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Myrna owns and runs a "sari-sari" (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling various different products, such as shampoo, toothpaste, sugar, milo, sweet candies, et cetera, to the community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Myrna joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Currently, Myrna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP. She will use the additional capital to expand her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Myrna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and further expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding her business

loans.name: Jitume Group

texts.en:
Hadija S., age 36, is married with 4 children, ages 16, 14, 12, and 3 years old. She has a small charcoal stall and clothes shop. She opened the business in 2008 and works long daily hours from 8 am until 8 pm. By selling charcoal and clothes she is able to earn a monthly profit of around $410.

This will be Hadija’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to expand the charcoal business and open the clothes business. She paid back her first loan successfully. She hopes to purchase additional stock for her charcoal business with this 2nd loan.
\t
Hadija will share this loan with her group of 25 members, who keep each other accountable for paying back the loan. In the picture, Hadija is standing in the center and right of the picture, wearing a yellow t-shirt.

loans.use: Purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 49 años, vive sola en su casa propia, ya que sus hijos conformaron sus propias familias.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de discos musicales, especialmente de música cristiana. Con esta actividad logra solventar sus gastos, pues a ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar y sentirse independiente y útil. 
El negocio va muy bien gracias a la cordialidad y buen trato para su clientela, es por ello que la mercadería se le acaba muy pronto, necesitando renovarla constantemente.
Rosa está pensando agrandar su negocio y mejorarlo cada vez más, pues a ella no sólo quiere vender música, si no también divulgar la palabra de Dios, comenta.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy responsable y puntual con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de CDs para obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 49. She lives alone in her own house because her children have formed their own families. For two years she has been selling music discs, especially Christian music. With this activity she is able to pay her expenses. She has always liked to work and to feel independent and useful. The business is going very well thanks to her cordiality and the good treatment she gives her customers. That is why she runs out of merchandise very quickly; she needs to restock constantly. Rosa is planning on making her business larger and improving it more each time. She does not want to just sell music. She says that she would also like to spread the word of God. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible and punctual with her payments. She will use the money she is asking for to buy a greater quantity of CDs in order to get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy CDs

loans.name: Srey Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Mom M. is the group leader of four members who all live in Chuos village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which to cultivate rice to earn a living. She is also a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more pigs for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. 

Mrs. Srey Mom M. is a 38-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a farmer while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: Purchasing more pigs for breeding

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. R. is from Bacolod Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old. Gloria is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Gloria operates a family member's business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gloria has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Gloria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Esperanza Imelda

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza Imelda B. M., vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte  es madre soltera y sus hijos actualmente estudian la escuela secundaria, ella tiene 43 añso de edad y ha laborado 5 años para la Bicatura Arzobispal de Bluefield. 

Dentro de los Planes de la señora está el abrir un negocio de venta de artículos domésticos y personales, para esto primero desea construir un muro atrás de su casa para cerrar la entrada y con esto dar mayor seguridad a todos, con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo este objetivo.

Ella espera que se le apoye pues no tiene apoyo de nadie y es una mujer muy humilde quien desea tener los recursos necesarios para brindarles a sus hijos un espacio óptimo en donde habiten en un lugar seguro y cómodo.
texts.en:
Esperanza Imelda B. M. lives in the suburb Laureles Norte. She is a single mother and her children study in secondary school. She is 43 years old and has worked for 5 years for the Archbishop of Bluefield. Amongst her plans Esperanza is opening a business selling domestic and personal items. For this she first wishes to construct a wall behind her house to close the entrance and create greater security for everyone. With this loan she will purchase construction materials to realise this objective. Esperanza hopes that she receives support as she doesn't have anyone's support, and she is a very humble woman who wishes to have the necessary resources to give her children optimal space in a safe and comfortable place.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: H. Julienne est née en 1956 et réside depuis 2 ans à Sedjro à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Julienne est mariée à DOMINGO Denis et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Julienne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Julienne n’a jamais été à l’école.  Pour supporter les charges familiales, Julienne vend de la nourriture (riz et akassa fait à base d'amidon de maïs) dans son quartier. Julienne s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Julienne exerce cette activité depuis 10 ans.  Julienne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre crédits, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Julienne sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès à ALIDé en vue de renforcer ses activités et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Julienne H. was born in 1956 and has been living in Sedjro in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for two years. She's married to Denis DOMINGO, and she's the mother of three school-attending children. Juliette lives with her children and her husband, and the couple provides for the family expenses together. Juliette never attended school. To support her family, Juliette sells food (rice and akassa, a traditional beninese food, made out of corn flour) in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. Juliette has been running this business for 10 years. Juliette is a former client of Kiva's partner, ALIDé, who already benefited from four loans, which were repaid without problems. She's seeking her fifth loan from ALIDé, in order to bolster her business and meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, corn, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Elma Beatriz

texts.es:
Doña Elma S. de 28 años de edad, viuda y con un hijo de 1 año, tiene una carniceria en Chimaltenango, vive en San Martín Jilotepeque, viaja todos los dias para su negocio.
Anteriormente el encargado de la carnicería era su esposo, pero fue privado de su vida y ahora Doña Elma atiende la carnicería y con el tiempo ha podido ir superando la perdida de su esposo. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar un molino de carne y asi poder preparar longanizas y chorizos, con anterioridad tenia uno pero ya no funciona. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener su propio local ya que por el momento alquila.
texts.en:
Elma S. is 28 years old, widowed, and has a one year old son. She owns a butcher’s shop in Chimaltenango, lives in San Martin Jilotepeque, and travels everyday to her business. The butcher’s shop was previously managed by her husband, but he lost his life and now Elma attends to it and with time she has been able to get beyond the loss of her husband.

She is asking for a loan to buy a meat grinder with which to prepare various sausages. She had one before, but it no longer functions. Her dream is to grow her business and to own her own store, as at the moment she rents.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in butcher's shop equipment

loans.name: Nurnisa

texts.en:
A. Nurnisa is 44 years old. She is a very active and passionate woman. She started her business in 1994 and since that time, she's become a well-experienced and skilled woman and many people of her village coming to ask her advice about keeping livestock. Her primary activity is selling milk and calves for meat production. 

Nurnisa, together with her son who helps her with the business,find themselves more dedicated to selling milk, and Nurnisa would like to expand her activity in this field. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of 5000 Somoni. She will use this loan to purchase a cow for milking. Let's help her reach her goals!   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a cow for milk production

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is an entrepreneur from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 48 years old and married with one child. She raises hogs and also runs a sari-sari store. She hopes her store and hog-raising business will grow more. She also prays for strength for her to continue providing for her family.

Manuela recently applied to CEVI for a loan of 12000 PHP. She will use it to add supplies to her store. She will also buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pigs.

loans.name: Masese Group, Jinja

texts.en:
W. John is a 25-year-old married father of two. He is a carpenter by profession and operates from Masese in Jinja.

John started his business six years ago after trying his hand unsuccessfully as a fishmonger. He started off as an apprentice carpenter at a neighborhood workshop and it is from there that he nurtured his skills and, as well, started doing carpentry on his own.

John’s determined attitude pushed him to start his own workshop and he has never looked back. Currently he earns monthly profits to the tune of 150,000 shillings, and his customers are mostly students and hotel business people. He mostly sells beds, sideboards, chairs and doors.

With this loan, John says his business will expand as he will be able to buy more timber to make chairs and sideboards.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo R. is from the village of San Jose. He is 49 years old. Domingo is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Domingo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Domingo has been engaged in his business for over 22 years and earns approximately 90,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2005, Domingo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Domingo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Domingo is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Domingo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Pedro Celestino

texts.es:
el sr. Pedro M. se dedica a la produccion y venta de pan, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, Pedro es muy dedicado a su trabajo, todos los dias se levanta a las 2 de la mañana para empezar su produccion y empacarlo para salir a las 5 de la mañana a venderlo y regresa a las 10 de la mañana a su casa. 
Pedro esta soltero.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para fabricar mas pan, ya que quiere expanderse en otras localidades.
su sueño es casarse y tener una bonita familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro M. has been making and selling bread for 15 years. Pedro is very dedicaded to his work. Every day he gets up at 2 in the morning to begin his production and pack up the bread to leave at 5 in the morning to sell the bread. He returns to his house at 10 in the morning. Pedro is single. He will use the loan to buy materials to make more bread since he wants to expand to other neighborhoods. His dream is to get married and have a beautiful family.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sugar, butter, wheat flour, eggs

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en: T. Nguyễn Thị (20211030023) is a 26-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of this six-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Phù Lưu Nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05). T. is married and has two infant children. She owns and operates a handicraft business, selling wood handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month. In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. T. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will again be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. The loan will be her 3rd from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 7,840,000 VND loan to support her handicrafts business. 2. Nguyễn Thị T. H. (0) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 7,840,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store. 3. Trần Thị P. (0) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business providing waste-management services. 4. Đỗ Thị T. (0) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 5. Nguyễn Thị G. (0) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** T. Nguyễn Thị (20211030023) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phù Lưu nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các P. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hàng mỹ nghệ bằng gỗ cho du khách và người dân trong cộng đồng địa P.. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND. Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất hàng mỹ nghệ bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.840.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ. 2. Nguyễn Thị T. H. (0) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.840.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 3. Trần Thị P. (0) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ quản lý chất thải. 4. Đỗ Thị T. (0) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. Nguyễn Thị G. (0) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Annette

texts.en: Annette is divorced with six children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Annette works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. Formerly, she was dealing in local gin but changed her business enterprise to a retail shop. She has been operating this retail shop for three months. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, boxes of soap, and cartons of salt.  In addition to this retail shop business, she also sells cosmetics. She sells to all categories of people. Her customers are people from the village who work seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Annette aspires to own her house and expand her business. She joined MCDT because of timely loans at the village level. She resides in and rents a two-room house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of saop

loans.name: Edwin Ulises

texts.es:
Edwin Ulises tiene 34 años de edad reside en el municipio de Moncagua, departamento de San Miguel, es casado, vive en casa del padre, con su hija Juana de 12 años de edad y la esposa, el tiene un chalet donde vende comida y bebida.
Inicialmente el trabajaba como repartidor de bebida carbonatadas, luego alquilo el local en el parque de Moncagua el negocio se llama Chalet Yany,  el  cual tiene ya hace 6 años de administrarlo,  está solicitando un préstamo para comprar productos para elaborar comida y ofrecer bebidas refrescantes,cafe, pan. asi mismo le gustaría invertir en otros artículos nuevos. Zapatos, pañuelos, bolsones esto contribuirá a fortalecer el negocio que le permita salir adelante con las necesidades básicas.
Las objetivos de Edwin son obtener ingresos para el sustento de la familia, apoyar a la hija con los estudios, que termine una profecion universitaria para que se defianda mejor en la vida.
texts.en:
Edwin Ulises is 34 years old and lives in the municipality of Moncagua in the department of San Miguel. He is married and lives in his father's house with his wife and his 12-year-old daughter Juana. He has a kiosk where he sells food and drink. Initially he worked as a carbonated beverages deliveryman, then he rented a unit in Moncagua park. His business is called Chalet Yany and he has been running it for six years. Edwin Ulises is asking for a loan to buy basic ingredients for making meals and serving cold drinks, coffee and bread. He would also like to invest in other new items, such as shoes, scarves and purses. This would strengthen his business and allow him to get by with life's basic necessities. His aim is to make an income to support his family, and pay for his daughter's studies, including university, so that she can get along better in life.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients for making meals and serving cold drinks, coffee and bread

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Matar H. est un yoffois  de 43 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Mbenguene. Il est marié et père d’un enfant d’un an. 
Monsieur H. a d’abord été pêcheur  avant d’intégrer l’enseignement. De ce fait il est enseignant depuis 1995 et a démarré   par dispenser des cours particuliers. Mais aussi parallèlement  il exerce l’activité de commerce
Monsieur H. est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis avril 2003.Il a déjà remboursé 5 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un  crédit  de 100 000 frs prévu  pour l’achat de divers produits tels que sucre, etc., en provenance de la Gambie et destiné pour son petit commerce durant les vacances. 
La réalisation de bénéfices  qui pourrait découler de cette opération pourrait l’aider a améliorer la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Matar H., 43, is from Yoff and lives in the Mbenguene neighborhood. He is married and the father of a one year old child. Mr. H. was originally a fisherman before going into education. He has been a teacher since 1995 and started off by giving private lessons. At the same time, Mr. H. is involved in commerce and has been a member of the savings institution of Yoff since April 2003. He has already repaid five previous loans. He is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs to buy various products such as sugar, etc., which he obtains in Gambia and sells at his small business during school vacations. The profit that could result from this activity could help him improve the his family's social situation.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; La socia esta ubicada en el barrio D. Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito D. Santiago , provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 55 años D. edad y es separada estudio solo la primaria y tiene 3 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el servicio D. compra y venta D. llantas (para autos), Ella se dedica también al alquiler D. autos, ella alquila autos para ponerlos atrabajar prestando servicio D. taxi; La socia es una mujer pujante y llena D. muchas ganas D. prospera. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. llantas al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the "Vamos Juntos" ("We Go Together") community bank and lives in the community of Arcopata, district of Santiago, province of Cusco, Peru. She is 55 years old and separated from her husband, has an elementary school education and has three children. She alternates her daily activities of buying and selling tires for automobiles and renting cars to make a living. She rents the cars to put them to work for a taxi service. Rosa is thriving woman who is full of desire to prosper. She is requesting the loan to purchase tires at wholesale. She is grateful to those help her reach her dreams through these means and promises to fulfill her payments in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires at wholesale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq and is a 40-year-old married man with four children. He used to repair ovens when he decided to open his own business in 2005. He rented a place where, in addition to repairing ovens, he started selling ovens and stove-tops. He has good manners and a good reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 from Kiva partner, CHF-ACSI. He wants to invest it in renovating his shop and increasing his inventory. He is working on developing his business so he will be able to open another branch and increase his revenues in order to build his house.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and increase his inventory

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of her sister’s children. She lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, medication and feeding the family.

Monica has a business selling bitenge (African wear: a single piece of cloth worn like a sarong). She has been in this business for seven years, and she works six days a week. Monica sells this African attire in a shop which she rents for 40,000 Ugandan shillings per month. She mostly sells retail. She also generates additional income through poultry farming.

Monica has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bitenge. The main business challenges for Monica include seasonality and transportation.

Monica’s goal and aspiration is to construct her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bitenge to sell

loans.name: Philomene

texts.fr:
Femme célibataire âgée de 54ans mère de 5enfants dont l’âge varie de 15 à 58ans.
Depuis  30ans, elle vend de la layette au marché avec un capital de 10000frs

Son étalage et ses articles pour les enfants attirent les futures mamans et parents.
Par jour, elle vend  15000f minimum et 50000f maximum.
Le prêt va lui permettre de renouveler son stock de marchandises pour vendre plus en achetant : 10douzaine de couches, 10 ensembles tricots, 10ensembles « petits bateaux », 
5 douzaines de paires de chaussons, 20robes fillettes, 10bermudas, 5lots  de tee-shirts  et 
Chaussettes mixtes.

Elle voudrait un jour  avoir une boutique et devenir femme d’affaire dans ce domaine.
Avec les revenus  qu’elle va générée, elle va s’occupée de la scolarité des ses enfants et vivre dans des bonnes conditions.
Elle est prise comme exemple dans son quartier.
texts.en:
Philomene is a well known, 54 year old, mother of 5 children, with the youngest  at 15 years old. For 30 years she has sold children's cloths at the market. She maintains a working capital of 10,000 francs. Her shop display of children's articles attracts future mothers and parents. Every day she sells 15,000 to 50,000 francs worth of articles.

The loan will enable her to replenish her stock of merchandise to sell. She will buy 10 dozen diapers,10 knitted outfits and ten "petit bateaux" (little boat) outfits, 5 dozen pairs of shoes, 20 girls dresses, 10 "Bermuda" outits, 5 lots of Tee-Shirts and assorted pairs of slippers.

One day, she would like to own a boutique and be the leader in her business. With the revenue earned from this loan, she will be able to meet the children's school fees and live in better conditions. She is an example to her community.

loans.use: To buy baby bottles, childrens outfits, diapers, slippers and underware for resale

loans.name: Maria Anita

texts.es:
María Anita es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en un caserío del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Piura y ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de bebidas cervezas y gaseosas en un local acondicionado en su vivienda, sus principales clientes son las personas que viven en su caserío. Los ingresos que recibe de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más bebidas para comercializarlas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su meta.

María Anita se caracteriza por ser una persona honesta y entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Maria Anita is a mom, she is 32 years old and she lives together with her husband and their three children in an agricultural community in Tambogrande. It is a region located in the province of Piura, more than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

She sells beer and soft drinks from a store fashioned from a section in her house. His main clients are the neighbors in her community. The profits she earns she uses to contribute with her husband to the family's finances. He is an agriculturist. 

She wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more drinks for resale. She has requested a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 500 nuevos soles and it will help her reach her goal. 

María Anita is known as a very honest person and very devoted to her family. Those that know her consider her to be a calm and responsible person.

loans.use: To purchase drinks for resale.

loans.name: 6 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La  A.C. 6 DE OCTUBRE inicia su primer ciclo  en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Esta asociación está compuesta por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva está compuesta por la  presidenta: la señora Nilda,  la tesorera  la señora Rita y la secretaria de actas la señora Carla.

La señorita  presidenta Nilda es una mujer joven de 22 años de edad, soltera,  las señoras consideraron que era la persona adecuada para el cargo.  Desde hace tres años trabaja en la venta de cosméticos a través de catálogos, las ventas son realizadas todos los días en diferentes horarios de manera ambulante, actualmente recibe apoyo de su hermana.
Cuando se le consulta sobre el servicio que le gusta más en Pro Mujer, ella comenta que el servicio de Salud, porque la atención es satisfactoria.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, ellos tienen negocios como: venta de comida rápida (amburguesas, salchipapas), venta de productos para el hogar (higiénicos, sardinas), venta de lentes, venta de cosméticos, venta de verduras.
texts.en:
The October 6th Communal Bank is starting its first loan cycle as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. The group is composed of eight members, seven women and one man. The Board of Directors consists of the following members: Srta. Nilda (President), Sra. Rita (Treasurer), and Sra. Carla (Secretary of Records).

Srta. Nilda is a young woman who is 22 years of age and serves as President. The other women considered her to be the right person for the job. Nilda has been selling cosmetics through catalogs for three years. She generates sales every day by working various schedules as a street vendor and currently receives the support of her sister. When asked about which service provided by Pro Mujer that she enjoys the most, Nilda said that she likes the health services because the care is excellent.

With respect to the remaining members of the Communal Bank, they engage in the following businesses in order to get ahead: selling fast food (hamburgers, sausages and potatoes), selling household products (toiletries, sardines), selling eyeglasses, selling cosmetics, and selling vegetables.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics through catalog order

loans.name: Jesica Irene

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Irene, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años, el mayor esta en primero de educación básica. Su esposo es agricultor. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya dos años y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 19h00, nos cuenta que su tienda es pequeña pero que tiene de todo, ya son 7 años que lleva con ella y dice que su tienda es su vida ya que en ella además de ganarse el sustento de su familia también se distrae con sus amigas que llegan hasta su local. Su mercadería la compra en Rocafuerte y Portoviejo.  También recibe en su local parte de la mercadería.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mas productos para surtir aun mas su tienda. Su sueño es tener un mini market con todas las comodidades para sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the 'San Esteban' community bank meets every fortnight.  This place is known for its traditional culture and also because it is only a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we find Irene who is 29 years old, married and has two children aged 5 and 3.  Her oldest child is in their first year of elementary school.  Her husband is a farmer.  Irene has been a member of her community bank for two years and she likes it because the interest rates are very low.

Irene has a small convenience store.  She works there every day from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  She tells us that her store may be small but it sells a bit of everything.  She has had the business for 7 years and tells us that her store is her life since it helps her to support her family and she also has enjoys spending time there, chatting to friends who call by.  She buys her goods in Rocafuerte and Portoviejo.  She also receives deliveries of some of her goods directly to her store.

This loan will be used to buy more products to better stock her store.  Her dream is to own a mini market with all the conveniences her customers need.

loans.use: To buy goods such as rice, eggs, soda, oil, etc.

loans.name: Kry

texts.en:
Mr. Kry S. is 31 years old and his wife, Mrs. Samen Sok, is 30 years old. They have been married since 2000 and have three young sons. The family lives along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Kry is a rice farmer. His wife sells Chinese noodle with soup and coffee in her village. Kry is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting because he does not have his own transportation and very often spends a lot of money for traveling costs. He will also use a part of the loan for farming.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting and use for farming

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis Alonso L. de 39 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, en donde vive junto a su esposa, una hija de 6 años de edad y junto a su madre. Desde hace varios atrás que él se dedica a atender su propio negocio el cual es una tienda de productos varios como productos para el hogar, para uso personal y productos alimenticios, y una de sus mayores ventajas es que no posee competencia, lo cual es muy beneficioso para él debido a que es el único que vende en el lugar. Su esposa le ayuda a atender la tienda y ambos trabajan con muchos deseos de salir adelante y así mismo de mejorar su negocio, surtiéndolo con todos los productos posibles para obtener más ganancias. Luis solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en la tienda comprando productos como: pan, medicinas, golosinas, diferentes tipos de bebidas, detergentes, granos básicos y muchos productos más los cuales son primordiales en un negocio como este, ya que son los que más se solicitan. Luis desea mucho poder prosperar en su negocio, sobretodo porque es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Luis Alonso L. is 39 years old and he lives in the region of Ahuachapan. He lives together with his wife, their 6-year old daughter, and his mother.  For several years he has had his own business selling household and personal use products as well as food items. One of the greatest advantages is that he does not have any competition. He is the only one with a store in his location. His wife helps him tend to the store and they both work together with a great dream of coming out ahead. They wish to improve their business, supplying it with all types of products, such as: bread, medicines, snacks, various types of drinks, detergents, basic grains, and many other products which are so important to a business of this type. These products are the most in demand. Luis wants to find success for his business especially because it is their only source of income.

loans.use: To purchase general store merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Enrrique Gerardo

texts.es:
Enrique C. B., tiene la edad de 30 años, está casado y tiene 1 hijo de 10 años de edad que es su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar unos terneros para el engorde y luego cuando estén grandes y aptos venderlos. El cuenta con el terreno necesario para su explotación y además tiene la experiencia necesaria para seguir en el negocio, creciendo como ganadero. Piensa en el futuro de su hijo y su esposa, quiere darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus seres queridos y a su ves crecer como productor de ganado de engorde. 
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Enrique C. B., 30, is married and has a 10 year old son who is his main priority.  He wants to buy some calves to raise and when they are grown and ready, sell them.  He has the necessary land for their exploitation and also the necessary experience to continue in business growing as a cattleman.  He considers his son’s and his wife’s future and wants to provide his loved ones with a better quality of life while at the same time growing as a producer of cattle.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.   He hadn’t had any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has provided a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is a 34-year-old married man from Gaza who lives with his wife and four children. In 2005, Alaa opened his own electronics shop and is now hoping that through this loan he will be able to buy all the electronics needed for his shop. He hopes that this will bring him more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy all the electronics needed for his store

loans.name: Consuela

texts.es: Consuela, de 63 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Iván de 67 años, pues sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes; pero aún así esta pareja se esmera por salir adelante. Desde hace más de 20 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la fabricación de imágenes religiosas, echas a mano. Esta muy satisfecha con esta labor pues es muy tranquila y la realiza junto a su esposo durante todos los días de la semana, sobretodo cuando tienen bastante cantidad de pedidos, principalmente entidades religiosas, que le solicitan estas imágenes por su buen acabado y calidad. Manifiesta que a veces deben amanecerse creando las imágenes (de santos) pues les falta tiempo, pero a su vez dice que es reconfortante darle forma a una imagen que será venerada. Como siempre piensa en el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio, para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Consuela tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de material (como recina, fibra de vidrio, silicona, cobalto, entre otros) que necesita para seguir fabricando las imágenes religiosas, y espera seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Consuela is 63 years old and lives with her husband, Iván, 67 years old, in their own home.  Their children are adults and live independently, but this couple wants to do everything they can to earn an income.  For over 20 years this hard-working woman has made religious icons by hand.  She enjoys her work very much and she and her husband work together all week long, especially when they have a lot of orders.  Religious organizations are their main customers, since the icons are very well made.

Sometimes they to get up very early in the morning to make the saintly icons but it is always comforting to them because they know the figures will be venerated.  Always thinking of the future, they have plans to expand business to increase earnings.  This is the fourth loan through MFP and Consuela is committed to paying it back on time.  She does not want to fail the people who are making it possible for her to get the loan so she can continue working toward progress.  Consuela plans to use the loan to buy material (resine, fibreglass, silicone, cobalt and others) so she can continue making her religious icons and earn a good living.

loans.use: To buy resine, fibreglass, silicone, cobalt and other materials to make icons

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, age 54, is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for ten years now and employs five casual laborers. He sells his horticultural products to the local market. He is the married father of three grown children. 

He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes. He says that these assets will enable him maintain his production capacity, especially during the dry season. He will therefore have stable income from which he will create more wealth to support his family. He also plans to acquire another piece of land to enable him to expand his farming activities in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Florenia

texts.en:
Florenia is a 48-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a grocery store and buying and selling herbal medicines. She lives in the municipality Sta. Fe, Cebu. Florenia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Florenia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 to buy more stock for the store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business.  Florenia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza S. is from the village of Puerta, Lurugan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 59 years old. Esperanza is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, noodles and beverages in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Esperanza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and biscuits. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & biscuits

loans.name: Orfa Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira de 58 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Se inicio hace más de 15 años  en su taller de cerámica y confección.

Ella trabaja todo el día. su esposo trabaja como chofer. Con el préstamo ella desea comprar telas y cerámicas. En su futuro lo que quieres es poner un taller en la principal para así llegar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elvira is 68 years old and she is a hardworking woman. She started her ceramics and clothing shop over 15 years ago. 

She works all day. Her husband works as a driver. With this loan she hopes to buy fabrics and ceramics. In the future she wants to put her shop in the main street so that she can reach her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, jewelry and shoes.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia C. V.  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 22 y 26 años, y allí tiene un negocio llamado “Zulú y Pijao” dedicado a las manualidades como  tejidos,  productos en porcelanicron y  fibras naturales además de cuadros. Ella indicó este negocio en el año  1999 haciendo collares y pinturas que había aprendido  cuando estudiaba en el colegio en el bachillerato y que fue gradualmente diversificando con otras técnicas mediante capacitaciones en el Servicio Nacional De aprendizaje “Sena” un  instituto técnico y tecnológico  estatal  y gratuito que existe en Colombia. Su insistencia en el mejoramiento de la calidad de sus productos le ha permitido perfeccionar  su arte y por eso  hoy participa en diversas exposiciones y eventos  feriales, donde exhibe sus productos, se compra frente a la competencia y consigue clientes. Este es el segundo financiamiento que hace con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará  materiales para producir hilo, accesorios peines, piedras ganchos pinturas porcelanicron cintas y bordadores.  porque con ellos desarrollará nuevos productos  y aumentar su atención a nuevos clientes.  Nidia manifiesta que con sus créditos en la Fundación su negocio ha crecido,  en términos de aumento de su capital de trabajo, ingresos por ventas y número de clientes; eso si agregándole ella su trabajo, la disciplina y el servicio especial a sus clientes. Su meta para más adelante es lograr tener un local comercial, aplicar a su sistema de mercadeo el uso de herramientas tecnológicas  y este es justamente su gran desafío. Mientras sigue trabajando fuertemente con una rentabilidad no menor de un 20%.
texts.en:
Nidia C. V. lives in Cartagena, along with her husband.  They have two children, ages 22 and 26.  They have a business called “Zulú y Pijao," that specializes in crafts such as fabrics, products in porcelain, natural fibers, and paintings.  She began this business in 1999, making necklaces and painting, having learned when she was a bachelor student.  She eventually diversified into other areas through training as an apprentice in the national service corps, a free State technical institution in Colombia.  Her insistence on perfection have allowed her to improve the quality of her products and perfect her art forms.  Now she participates in various expositions and fairs, where she exhibits her products near the competition and wins customers.

This will be her second loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the money to buy thread, accessories, stones, hooks, paints, porcelanicron, laces, and embroideries.  She uses these items to develop new products and increase her customer base.

Nilda says that she has been able to grow in terms of working capital, investments, and number of customers with the help of the loans through the institution.  She likes her work; her skills, especially customer service.  Her goal for the future is to have her own shop, use marketing techniques, tools and technology.  This is a great challenge.  In the mean time she continues to work hard with profits of at least 20%.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her arts and crafts business

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: Soeurn S., age 25, is a building worker and he is able to earn a daily income of around 4 USD to help support his family.
