He has a life partner in his wife who works a garment worker and has a formal salary. The couple is blessed with a young child who is not yet enrolled in school. Soeurn S. will be using the loan to buy jewelry as an inheritance for his kid as well as selling it out whenever he needs an immediate cash for starting up a new business.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en:
Batsuh is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Uvs province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in his parents' backyard. He manages a vegetable-trading business with the help of his wife. 

He started his business in 2007. Now he owns 2.5 hectares of land where he plants daily consumption vegetables including potatoes, carrots and cabbage, etc. He harvests 40-45 tons of vegetables every year. His wife is responsible for selling their vegetables. 

He is planning to have their own plot of land, which will allow him to build a house for his family. He is a polite man who says, "I want to buy a cow for my parents, so they can drink milk every day." 

He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a cow and some seeds for his business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and some seeds

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years old and lives in Pasay City, Philippines. She is married and has three children, one of whom is working while the other two are still in school. Gemma is working hard to put her children through college, because like most Filipino parents she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can give their children.

Gemma makes a living by making clothing and hair accessories, most of which are knitted. She has been in this business for almost eight years and is very knowledgeable about the preferences of her customers, most of whom are neighbors. She earns about Php 4,000 a month.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of Php 12,000. She will be use the money to buy more fabric and thread. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 
 
Gemma dreams of having her own house and land someday. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners which gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Sajidakan's Group

texts.en:
Sajidakan, 51, is the leader of this group. Her husband works in Russia and each month he sends 5,000 KGS to his family to meet their needs.  

Sajidakan has three children. The older daughter is married and lives separately with her family and the other children study at school. 

In order to earn money to support the family budget, Sajidakan cultivates vegetables and cotton. She has been doing it for 15 years. This business helped her to contribute money for celebrating her daughter’s wedding. 

Sajidajan applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase mineral fertilizers for cultivating cotton. In the future, she wants to provide her children a good education and plans to start building a fence around the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Joselo Ernesto

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí conversamos con Joselo, tiene 32 años,  está casado y de esta relación  tiene dos hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad, la mayor estudia en escuela, su esposa una muy buena ama de casa y también le ayuda en su trabajo.

El se dedica a la artesanía, tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que elabora botones pero en forma cruda, nos cuenta don Joselo que todos los fines de semana el lleva lo que ha elaborado a la ciudad  de Manta para entregar sus productos a comerciantes los mismos que se encargan de exportar a otros países donde les dan el acabado para luego ser comercializados. Trabaja de lunes a viernes ocho horas diarias con la ayuda de su esposa, la materia prima la compra en su localidad en un deposito que le deja a buen precio.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar tagua para la fabricación de los botones. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cinco ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos.
 
Su sueño es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en: Every two weeks, the Virgen del Rosario community bank meets in Colorado, in Montecristi canton. This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are nationally and internationally renowned. Most of the people work making buttons from 'tagua', making handicrafts and engaging in general commercial activities. Here we chat to 32 year-old Joselo who is married and has two children aged 7 and 2. His eldest child is in school. Joselo's wife is a very good homemaker and she also helps him in his work. Joselo makes handicrafts. He owns a lathe (a machine for cutting 'tagua') which he uses to make buttons but crudely. He tells us that every weekend he takes what he has made to the city of Manta and delivers his products to salespeople who export them to other countries where they are finished off and then sold. Joselo works from Monday to Friday, eight hours a day, with the help of his wife. He buys his raw materials in a warehouse in his town where they sell at a good price. Joselo will use this loan to buy 'tagua' for making buttons. He has been a member of his community bank for five loan cycles and he likes it because the loans are quick. Joselo's dream is to continue growing in his business.

loans.use: to buy 'tagua'

loans.name: Miryam

texts.es: Miryam vive en el municipio de Soledad con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 11 a 21 años, allí se dedica a la producción y ventas de picadas, negocio creado por la necesidad de generar ingresos, e iniciado como una venta de fritos , en el momento que su esposo se encontraba desempleado. Cuando el negocio empezó a tomar forma, fue agregándole otros productos derivados de la harina de trigo,  aunque contaba con muy poco capital de trabajo  para cubrir sus primeras demandas, pero aun así hizo muchos esfuerzos para lograrlo;  su esposo siempre la ha acompañado,  pues cuando Miryam se enfermó él  asumió toda la operación de este y aun continua apoyándola.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará materias primas e insumos como maíz, azúcar yuca, harina de trigo y leche. Su sueño es lograr posicionarlo y está empezando a hacerlo. Con el apoyo de la Fundación ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo, diversificar su oferta, y concentrarse en nuevos mercados, como en las casas de eventos sociales y fiestas familiares que son sus más apreciados clientes. En la actualidad tiene la expectativa de recibir el subsidio de vivienda en el megaproyecto Villas de San Pablo, donde la Fundación desarrolla su enfoque misional en la fundamentado en la construcción de comunidades sostenibles
texts.en:
Miryam lives in the town of Soledad with her husband and four children whose ages range from 11 to 21.  She makes and sells “picadas” (combination plates containing various fried meats, sausages, offal, manioc and potatoes), a business that arose from the need to generate income and that started as a sale of fried fast food when her husband became unemployed.  As the business started to take shape she started adding other items derived from wheat flour.  Although she had very little working capital to cover her initial demand, she still stove to accomplish it.  Her husband has always been by her side and when Miryam became ill he took over the entire operation and still continues to help her out.

Her Kiva loan is the first financing she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy raw materials and ingredients like corn, sugar, manioc, wheat flour and milk.  Her dream is to position it and she’s starting to do so.  With help from the Fundación she’s managed to increase her working capital, diversify her offer and concentrate on new markets like sites that are used for special events and family parties which are her most valued customers.  

She is currently hoping to get a housing subsidy for Villas de San Pedro where the Fundación is developing its mission statement‘s focus on building sustainable communities.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies like corn, sugar, manioc, wheat flour and milk.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 49-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has 5 children aged 24, 22, 20, 17 and 14. She has 1 additional dependant who lives with her because he is her husband’s relative. In 2003, Fatmata established her egg and soft drink business. She started her business because she wanted to help her husband to provide for their family. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 to buy eggs, soft drinks and pure water for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Fatmata plans to build a house and educate her children to university level.

loans.use: To buy eggs, soft drinks and pure water

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent, 25, is a business oriented business lady. She is married and blessed with three children, two of whom are school going. For the past three years, she has been selling charcoal and milk to make a living and make life more comfortable for her family. In the next five years, she wants to make her business a huge success and her dream is to buy a piece of land and develop it.

Millicent is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase dairy cows. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to increase her clientele and thus increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 56 years old and married. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She has only one adult-aged child. She is raising bananas to make a living. She sells ripe bananas in the market to make money. Monthly earnings of PHP 4,000 are generated from this activity. She had this business for 15 years.

Earlier this year, Florencia joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase manure and pay for weeding costs. She hopes to improve her production and sell her produce at a very good price. Florencia plans to buy a motorcycle for easy transport of goods.

loans.use: To purchase manure and pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto, de 28 años de edad, habita en Pueblo Nuevo, municipio de Estelí, soltero, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas.  Este es su segundo préstamo en Kiva, fue muy positivo para el, ya que  con el primer crédito el pudo mantener la siembra de tomates, compro insumos, fertilizantes, pago mano de obra además tuvo un buen rendimiento que era uno de sus objetivos al empezar la siembra pero tuvo pequeños problemas por la baja de precio en le mercado de las hortalizas. Pero ahora que ya hay mas estabilidad en el área de las hortalizas las posibilidades de ventas son mas positivas y el no quiere perder la oportunidad de sembrar y vender su producción de tomates los cuales el considera son de muy buena calidad, pues son frutos de su arduo trabajo y la ayuda de su familia.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar tomates, pagar mano de obra. Con esta inversión tiene la visión de sacar una excelente producción vender toda la cosecha,pagar los créditos, ampliar sus aéreas de siembra.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto, aged 28, lives in Pueblo Nuevo in the mucipality of Estelí. He is single, and is a farmer who grows vegetables.

This is his second loan through Kiva.  He was very positive about his first loan, as with it he was able to keep up his planting of tomatoes, buy supplies and fertilizers, and pay for labor.  Additionally, he had a good yield, which was one of his goals in beginning the planting.  However, he had some small problems because of the low price of vegetables in the market.  But now that he has become more established for his vegetables, his sales possibilities are stronger and he does not want to lose the opportunity to grow and sell his tomato production.  He considers them to be of excellent qualitiy, and they are the fruits of his hard work and the assistance of his family.

He is requesting the loan to plant tomatoes and pay for labor.  With this investment, he has a vision of achieving an excellent crop, selling his entire harvest, paying off his loans, and increasing his area for farming.

loans.use: to grow tomatoes and pay for labor.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar de 40 años de edad, natural de la comunidad de Triboline caserío de la ciudad de Sivia. Esta casado con Eugenia de 37 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 02 hijos y habitan en su propio casa construido a base de material rustico madera y techo de calamina. Oscar con tanto cuidado logró reanudar su trabajo en áreas verdes, rodeado de árboles frondosos a la vez cultivados con plantas de cacao, café y árboles maderables, donde viene realizando esta actividad desde hace 15 años. Menciona que desde muy niño aprendió a arar la tierra gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres. Su producto mas rentable es la venta de café, porque los vende en cantidad  y a un buen precio,y gracias a las ganancias adquiridas, logró comprar animales de carga para facilitarse con el trnasporte de sus productos. La temporada de invierno no es de su agrado por la abundancia de insectos razón por la cual Oscar acude a la entidad Financiera para tramitar un préstamos y llevar consigo uno de sus propósitos, que es combatir la plaga de isnectos y salvar las florecillas de sus plantaciones. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir sembrando y adquiriendo mas espacios de terreno para así sobresalir de la pobreza que convive su familia. Este es su tercer crédito y esta muy contento de  saber que tendrá el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar trabajando. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará insumos naturales para combatir los bichos que asechan sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Oscar, 40, is a native of the community of Triboline, a settlement in the city of Sivia. He is married to Eugenia, 37, and they have 2 sons and live in their own house, constructed of rustic wood material with a corrugated iron roof.

Oscar, with great care, succeeded in taking up green farming. He works surrounded by luxuriant trees at the same time as he cultivates his own cacao, coffee and timber trees, work he has been doing for 15 years. He mentioned that when he was a young child he learned how to till the soil thanks to instruction from his parents. His most profitable product is the sale of coffee because he sells it in a large quantity and at a good price. Thanks to his profits, he was able to buy pack animals to facilitate transport of his crops.

The winter season is not to his liking because of the abundance of insects, which is the reason he came to MFP, to request a loan and carry out another of his projects, which is to combat pest infestations and save the flowers in his fields.

Oscar’s plans are to continue planting and acquiring more land so that he can emerge from the poverty in which his family lives. This is his third loan and he is happy to know that he will have the support of each one of you to continue his work. With the loan he has requested, he will buy natural supplies to combat the insects that threaten his fields.

loans.use: to buy natural supplies to combat insects.

loans.name: Abesamihigo C Group

texts.fr:
Sylvère fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo C. Le nom du groupe signifie « performers ». Il est né au Rwanda et il a 45 ans. Il est marié avec 5 enfants de 3 à 13 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 8 ans de primaire. 

Sylvère est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est la semence du riz sélectionné. Dans les prochaines années, Sylvère voudrait récolter une grande quantité de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Sylvère is part of the group called Abesamihigo C. The name of the group means « performers ». He was born in Rwanda and he is 45. He is married with five children from 3 to 13 years old, of whom four are enrolled in school. His own educational level is eight years of primary school. 

Sylvère grows rice. This is his second loan through ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop. 

His strategy for growing his business is sowing special sorts of rice. In the coming years, Sylvère would like to grow a lot of rice. With the profit, he intends to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with two school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has operated a cafe business for the past six years; her potential clients are the local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of opening a retail shop one day.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase blocks and cement to expand her business premises. She decided to join Yehu to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase blocks and cement to expand her business premises.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила замужем, у нее взрослые дети. Людмила живет и занимается своим делом в городе Каховка, Херсонская область. Она торгует женской одеждой на местном Каховском рынке вот уже 18 лет. На данный момент количества товара у нее – на сумму 60 000 гривен. 

Людмиле необходим кредит в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить теплую одежду на имеющуюся сумму, а именно купить оптом свитера, кофты, куртки и продать их по розничным ценам в своем киоске. Развитие бизнеса и стабильный доход дадут клиентке возможность содержать семью.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Ludmila is married and has adult children.  She lives and runs her business in the town of Kahovka in the Kherson region.  Ludmila has been selling women's clothing at the local Kahovka market for 18 years.  Currently, the quantity of her merchandise is valued at 60,000 hryvnia.  Ludmila needs a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia in order to buy warm clothing using this sum.  Specifically, she plans to buy sweaters, cardigans, jackets at wholesale prices and sell these goods at retail prices in her store.   Business development and stable income will provide our client with the opportunity to support her family.

loans.use: to buy warm clothing, specifically, to buy sweaters, cardigans, jackets at wholesale prices and sell these goods at retail prices in her store

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 36 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.  He does carpentry to earn a living, which he has been doing for 11 years.  He  employs three people to assist him in the business. He has increased his business stock with his previous loans.

Daniel is requesting a loan for 30, 000 Kenya shillings, which he will use to buy timber. He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase timber.

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Olivia, es comerciante de ropa, vive con familia y sus 5 hijos. La venta de ropa la realiza de manera ambulante, lleva tres años en el negocio y este surgió por iniciativa propia, para mantener en el hogar todo lo necesario.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de blusas, camisas, short, esta inversión le permitirá mejorar tanto el negocio como sus ingresos familiares, ofreciendo a la clientela prendas de vestir nuevas en otros estilos.
Su aspiración es tener un mejor negocio, que sea estable y contar con un local fijo, dando así una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Olivia sells clothing.  She lives with her family and her 5 children and sells clothing door to door.  She has had this business for 3 years, which she started on her own initiative to provide her household with the necessities.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase blouses, shirts, and shorts. This loan will help her to improve her business and her family income, offering her customers new clothing items in different styles.  

Her dream is to have a better business, one that is stable and with a shop, so that she can provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, shirts, shorts.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years now. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. In the future, Nelly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Hyline Kerubo

texts.en:
Hyline Kerubo is 27 years old and single. She runs a grocery store where she sells fruit and vegetables.  Her business faces the challenge of inadequate capital to purchase additional produce stock. 

Hyline will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more fruit and vegetables for sale. In the future, she wants to run a restaurant and sell fish.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 
Marietta has a shop that sells COSPACHEM products like lotions, liniments, shampoo, body spray & food supplements.  She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy stocks of COSPACHEM products.
Marietta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future,Marietta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of COSPACHEM products

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is 32 years of age and is married, with three children.

Sina owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. Sina needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 250, or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Sina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sina's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Songa Group

texts.en:
Selemani, who is in his early 40s, is married with three children who are still at school. He has been running a fruit and vegetable business since 2007. He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 
This will be his second loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loan to increase his stock, pay school fees and meet household expenses, and he paid back his loan successfully. He wants a new loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell. His dream is to one day be able to raise enough money to send his children to good schools.
Selemani will share this loan with his loan group "Songa," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Enkhtuvshin

texts.en:
Enkhtuvshin is a 35-year-old married woman who lives with her family in a small apartment in the outer district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her elder child, a son, attends secondary school, while her spouse works as a director at a local company.  

Since Enkhtuvshin’s major is in technology, she supports her family by operating a translating service business at home. She receives mail or gets news about the mining sector from international websites, translates it, and sends it to local mining companies. In the last few years in Mongolia, the mining sector is very popular, therefore she can do her job at home and also take care of her baby daughter.  

Thus, she is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase support facilities such as a hard disk and one more computer and other necessary things which will be very useful for her profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase necessary facilities for her translating service.

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Dembagnouman, sont toutes des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Biba, commune de Massigui, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales et de condiments.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Dembagnouman  sont à leur dix neuvième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments et des céréales.                                                                                                                                                                                               
La cliente AWA ALOU, première personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter des condiments avec les fournisseurs de Massigui pour ensuite les vendre sur place à domicile dans le village à une clientèle composée de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 14 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The members of the Dembagnouman group are all married women with an average age of 40, on average 3 children, and who all live in traditional, extended family environments in the village of Biba, in the Massigui commune, in the Koulikoro region (the 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met thanks to family and neighbourly relationships, and bonds of friendship. They sell condiments and cereals. The women of the Dembagnouman group are on their 19th group loan which will be used to buy condiments and cereals.

The customer Awa Alou, standing first on the left in the picture, plans to buy condiments from the suppliers in Massigui and then to resell them locally door-to-door in the village to a clientele composed of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 14 000 francs, part of which will be used to take care of the family's needs and part of which will be reinvested in her condiment-selling business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Tito

texts.en:
Tito is 51 years old and lives in Tipan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is single.
 Tito has a sun breaker making business and earns approximately 8,000PHP each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to purchase on his sun breaker making business.
 Tito has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Tito hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase on his sun breaker making business.

loans.name: Upendo Oysterbay Group

texts.en:
Lydia is in her late 30s and not married. For one year now, she has been running a business selling charcoal. She buys a few sacks and splits them into small sizes to resell. She works from 6 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her 24th credit request, to be apportioned among Upendo Oysterbay, an 11-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She used the previous loans, all paid back successfully, to buy more stock of charcoal. 

Lydia has done a lot to improve her business and life, and she is so thankful for Kiva's support. In the coming years, she would like to build a nice house. With this new credit, she will buy more sacks of charcoal for her store to resell.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for her store to resell.

loans.name: Silvia Isabel

texts.en:
My name is Silvia S. I am in the business of making bed linens. I have been having my business for 2 years. My business is to generate income to support my family. My daughters help me in the business as well. My goal is to increase my inventory and production line. My goal is to be able to remodel my house, buy a new machine to cook, and to sustain my family.

Mi nombre es Silvia S. me dedico a la produccion y venta de ropa para camas, tengo mi negocio hace 2 años, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, tengo la ayuda de una de mis hijas para la venta de mi producto, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios para una mejor produccion y con los ingresos que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa, comprar una maquina nueva de cocer y sustentar mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de Telas, hilos, esponja, tijeras

loans.name: Malahat

texts.en: Malahat K. owns a furniture store in the small town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Malahat is looking for funding so that she can increase the quantity and quality of her inventory. Her small town is growing and people need to furnish their homes. Her business is family business and she runs the store with her husband Hasanaga Kazimov who also received loan from Normicro Baku branch and used it in the same store. Together they need 2350$ to buy new inventories for the store. Hasanaga applies for the half of that amount.

loans.use: To increase quantity and quality of her inventory

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Mrs. Um M. D. is 35 years old and a widow living with her son in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She struggles to make her living by owning a clothes-making business with 2 workers. She can typically makes around $6/day from this business. Her child is a student and aids his mother when he is free from class.

D. hopes to use the loan to purchase more cloth and pays her workers' wages. In the future, if she saves enough money, she hopes to purchase two or three sewing machines in order to facilitate her business. If possible, she will build a garment shop and send her son to a university.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth and pay her worker's wage.

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Mrs. Kemi S. is a 30 year-old woman, married with three (3) children, and living in the semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She learnt her trade business for one year before she started her business in the year 2000. She is eager to access the loan amount to acquire more goods for sales.

loans.use: To buy more plastics and provisions

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela is a very hard-working woman. She is 39 years old, is not married and is a single mother of three children who currently live wth her. She works two jobs in order to support her family. During the day she works at a nursery and at night she sells food from her home. She has very good experience in both of these arenas, especially in the latter as she has been doing it for nearly six years.

There is quite a lot of competition in the food selling market, so Adela has to work very hard at it. However, thanks to the time that she dedicates to it ,it has gone very well for her to date, although she obviously always needs money to keep developing her activities.

Due to this, she is not asking for much. As the market prices fluctuate, she will use this money to buy basic products such as: meat, potatoes, onions and oil. This present loan would be Adela's thrid with Agrocapital, having demonstrated good responsability in repaying the two previous loans. One can note that the loan goes up to $106.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Adela es una mujer trabajadora de 39 años de edad, no está casada, es mamá soltera de tres niños con los que vive actualmente. Ella se dedica a dos negocios que la ayudan a mantener a su familia, en el día atiende a niños en una guardería y por las noches vende comida en su domicilio. Tanto en el cuidado de niños en la guardería como en la venta de comidas tiene buena experiencia, sobre todo en el segundo negocio donde trabaja por cuenta propia ya cerca de 6 años. El mercado de venta de comidas es bastante amplio, por lo que Adela tiene que trabajar más duro ya que la competencia es elevada, pero gracias al tiempo que la se dedica a la venta de comidas hasta la fecha le va bien, claro que siempre necesita recursos económicos para porder seguir desarrollando sus actividades. Debido a que el monto solicitado es pequeño y los precios en el mercado son bastante fluctuantes, este crédito le servirá para la adquisición de productos básicos como ser: carne, papa, cebolla y aceite. La presente solicitud es la tercera de Adela con Agrocapital, habiendo demostrado gran responsabilidad y excelente cumplimiento en sus dos anteriores préstamos. Se hace notar que el monto del préstamo asciende a $us. 106.-.

loans.use: To increase her capital from selling food/Incremento de Capital de trabajo para la venta de comida

loans.name: Vesta Da Conceição

texts.pt:
Vesta da ConceiçãoN. is 45 years old, divorced and a mother of two children. She lives in the neighborhood of Malhangalene in Maputo and works for LAM. She started in the program in April of 2007 with a loan for 10,000MT which she repaid without any problem. She wants to take out another loan for 30,000MT to increase her capital savings and to purchase equipment for her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Vesta da ConceiçãoN. tem 45 anos de idade, é divorciada e mãe de dois filhos. Vive no bairro da Malhangalene em Maputo e é trabalhadora da LAM.Entrou para o programa em Abril de 2007 com um empréstimo de 10.000MT e pagou sem quaisquer problemas. Pretende tomar 30.000MT para aumentar com sua poupança e aplicar na compra de uma viatura.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: I am Bushra T. from Lahore, a big and a busy city. I wind thread on plastic spools and then wrap them in plastic covers formt daily wages. My husband works at a private company for a scant wage. If you lend us $175, we will start our own business producing thread spools. With this loan sum we will buy thread, reels and boxes to pack them. We want to achieve a better financial future for ourselves.

loans.use: To start producing thread spools

loans.name: Sonia Yanira

texts.es:
Señora Rodríguez has her business in La Libertad in a very strategic place in front of the bus station for the province's busses. She has two children, for whom she fights to get ahead. She started her business selling food, but after having some problems, she discontinued it. She didn't give up, though, and restarted it with $7. Now she has 17 years of experience selling traditional food, agua D. coco (the water that is found in coconuts), beverages, and fast food. She uses her profits to buy necessary things: she started with a plot of land and then constructed her house. Her financing has helped her keep her business going, and she has invested her profits in her home. She has had five credits with this institution, and all of them have been paid back in a punctual manner. The investments she has maD. in her business are noticeable, and she has improved it with her previous credits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra R., tiene su negocio en La Libertad en un punto muy estratégico ya que esta frente al punto D. buses departamentales, su familia esta compuesta por dos hijos que es por los cuales lucha para salir adelante inicio con venta D. comida pero por algunos problemas lo descontinuo , pero no se dio por vencida y lo reinicio con siete dolares, hasta la fecha tiene diecisiete años D. dedicarse a la venta D. comida típica y agua D. coco, refrescos y comida rápida, D. las ganancia D. su negocio a podido ir comprando cosas necesarias, comenzó con un terreno y luego construyo su casa los financiamientos le han ayudado en gran manera para sostener su negocio y a si ir invirtiendo D. la ganancia en su vivienda,, a tenido cinco créditos con la institución y todos los a cancelado D. forma puntual, y se ve su inversión en el local que tiene y como la a mejorado con los financiamientos anteriores.

loans.use: With the financing, she want to finish buying furniture for her business like benches, chairs, and tables so she can attend to her clients better

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca N. prepares a special type of doughnut which is commonly eaten by workers who might be too busy to take their breakfast in their homes. Rebeccais divorced and has a child who is 12 years old. She wants to improve upon her working conditions so as to attract more customers.

Rebecca is asking for $400 to enable her to buy a Beff (doughnut) stand which will make her business very attractive and also improve her sales.

loans.use: To buy a doughnut stand to improve her sales.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.es:
Adelita M. is a single mother of 2 children, to whom she wishes to always give the best, which is why she started making and selling paintings to her friends and family. She started with one painting, then two, and so on. Little by little and with a lot of effort, Adelita was able to support her two children through this business.

Nevertheless, it is time for her to get more capital so that she can offer a greater variety of merchandise to her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $650.00 USD, which she is willing to repay in 6 monthly installments, so that she can buy a painting simulator and make frames for her art. With your help, Adelita will be able to move her family forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Adelita M., es madre soltera de 2 pequeños. A quienes desea brindarles siempre lo mejor. Es por eso que comenzó a elaborar y a vender cuadros entre sus familiares y amigos. Primero con un cuadro y después con dos y así consecutivamente. Poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo Adelita a podido mantener a sus dos hijos con este negocio.

Sin embargo es momento para que el negocio se inyecte de más capital para poder tener más mercancía y así ofrecerles variedad a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Adelita podrá comprar un simulador de pinturas y formar un marco para sus diseños. Con tu ayuda Adelita podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of painting simulator

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort O. is 52 years old and lives in Benin City. She is married and has five children. She goes to the northern part of Nigeria to buy yams, which she sells in Benin City. She spent a year learning this business and started her own business in 2002. She is seeking a loan of $450 to buy more yams to sell.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Rajabmo

texts.ru:
Rajabmo I. lives in Yavan. She is a widow with four children. In order to provide for her children after her husband passed away, Rajabmo started trading milk and dairy products. She purchases milk from her neighbors and makes cottage cheese and sour cream which she sells at the regional market. She wants to get a loan to purchase a cow to be able to make dairy products from her own milk. This will help to cut costs and increase her profits. She plans to repay her loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Исмоилова Раджабмо жительница города Яван. Вдова , и имеет 4 детей. Для того , чтобы прокормить детей , после смерти мужа Раджабмо занялась торговлей молоком и кисло-молочных продуктов. Скупает молоко у соседей , производит творог и сметану и вывозит в район для реализации. Сейчас хочет купить собстенную корову , чтобы производить продукты из собственного молока. Это поможет сократить расходы и увеличить доход. Для этого ей нужно получить кредит. Погасит кредит сможет в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Saom Sovanna and her husband, Lim H., live in Siem Reap province in Cambodia with their two children. She is 29 years old and works selling groceries in a busy market, where she earns around $25 in revenue each day. Her husband, aged 33, has been a farmer since 1998. On average, he makes less than one dollar per day.

Since the market price of rice is good, Lim would like to purchase another plot of farmland to grow more rice to sell. (Saom Sovanna is pictured with two children.)

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland.

loans.name: José Ramon

texts.es:
Mr. José Ramón C. is a man who is dedicated to his agricultural business in the municipality of Somotillo, which is in the city of Chinandega. He worked hard to stand out in the business, for he had a family to maintain - his wife and their four children who are all students.

As in all growing businesses, C.'s needs to invest in oxen for his livestock. For this reason, he approached Ceprodel to obtain a loan which will be used to buy the farm animals and also continue to establish his business in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

El señor José Ramón C. es un caballero que se dedica a laborar en el negocio agropecuario en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Con mucho esfuerzo se ha destacado en el negocio ya que ha logrado mantener a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos en edades escolares.

Hoy en día como todo negocio en desarrollo, el negocio agropecuario del señor C. requiere invertir en la compra de bueyes para su respectiva crianza. Por este motivo es que él muy confiadamente acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de estos animales y así continuar con su negocio en su comunidad.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Sabohatoy

texts.en:
Sabohatoy M. is 49 years old, married and has four children. She makes a living as a vendor, selling clothes and shoes for children. She has been in this business for 13 years, and her ability to pick out items her customers will like and buy has allowed her to build a stable and successful business. With the help of her husband, she gets goods in the neighboring town of Dushanbe. She aims to buy good-quality items that she can sell at a price which is acceptable to customers with average incomes. Thanks to her success, Sabohatoy is able to contribute considerable sums to the family budget and help her husband support his parents as well as their family.

Sabohatoy is looking for late-summer items to sell to her customers. To make this possible, she has applied for a loan of $1,000 which she will repay in 12 months. She hopes this loan will increase her income and allow her to send her daughter to college. Sabohatoy promises to make payments on time and thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy new clothes and shoes for children to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sud Alimimium Group

texts.fr: Sud Alimimium est une societe, compose de jeunes, et dirige par Cheikh Tidiane. Ils ont un atelier, qui leur permet de repondre a la demande de la clientele tout en formant des jeunes. Grace a ces activites les deux associes gagne leur pain quotidien. A present, ils sollicite un pret pour renforcer leur atelier.
texts.en:
Sud Alimimium is a company made up of young people and headed by Cheikh Tidiane. They have a workshop which allows them to respond to customer demand at the same time as training young people. Through this business, the two partners earn their daily bread. They are now requesting a loan to improve their workshop.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capacity

loans.name: Mrs. Sun Kan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank loA. is compromised of nineteen members all of whom live in the Tang Thlaeng Village in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Mrs. S. K. was selected by the members of the Village Bank to become the President. She is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectare rice fields. But, she does not have enough money to purchase rice seeds so she is asking for a loA. so that she cA. continue cultivating rice. With the remainder of her money, Mrs. S. K. would purchase fertilizer to help the production of her crop. Her husband, Mr. Suk Sam, is a construction worker who makes around $1.50 per day. With this small income, it is very hard to meet the needs for their family’s expenses. Mrs. S. K. is 40 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one, age 3, is still too young to work or study. Mrs. Yoen S. represents her husband who is not in the picture but is applying for a loA..

This is a village bank loA. consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eleven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loA. until the very end of the loA. term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loA. term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds to cultivate rice and she would use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Marbelly Dayana

texts.es: Doña Marbella tiene 29 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama, Villa Nueva, su esposo es tipógrafo y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, sus ventas son cosméticos y  es asalariada tiene 12 años estar en las ventas inicio con dinero que ahorraba de su salario y apoyo de su esposo. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en compras de cosméticos y cumplir con pedidos que sus clientes le hacen, pues viene la temporada en que la gente compra todos estos productos para regalos de sus familiares y las ventas son altas. A largo plazo es aumentar su inventario y poder invertir más, y hacer mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Marbella is 29 years old and lives in the Villa Nueva neighborhood. Her husband is a printer and they have a two year old child. She has been selling cosmetics for 12 years which is a business she started with money she saved from her salary and with the help of her husband. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase cosmetics and fill her client's orders since the season when people purchase these products as gifts for their families is coming up and her sales are high. Her long term goal is to increase her inventory, to be able to invest more and to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetic products.

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: Mrs. Tum K. is a villager in Kor Chenleng village in Takeo Province. She is a hen breeder. Her husband, Mr. Hun Hoem, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to earn his living. Since Mrs. Tum K.’s business is going well, she wants to expand; unfortunately, she does not have enough money to buy hens and hen food. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to support her husband's field to make his crop more productive. She is 32 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy hens and hen food and fertilizers to support her husband field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Rene Milagros

texts.en:
Rene Milagros M. R. is a member of the Confianza (“Trust”) Village Bank. Rene is 37 years old and lives with her common-law husband and her three children. She and her husband sew curtains, reupholster furniture, and deal in other kinds of home décor. The couple works every day, and when there is a lot of demand for their services they hire help, too. Rene buys her materials in Lima and brings them to Ayacucho.  Rene needs a loan of $325 to buy a variety of fabric.  Rene’s dreams are to finish building her home, to expand her business, and to open other branches. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Safole

texts.en: Safole F., 36, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in a plantation business. She sells to the general public 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD). SPBD loans are Safole’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The usage of her loan is to purchase taro tops, sacks of fertilizers, chemicals and a carpet together with paints to renew her house.

loans.use: To purchase taro tops, knives, crowbars, fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
Maria Leticia se inicio en los negocios cuando tenía 20 años de edad.  Ella estudio corte y confección y cuando empezó su negocio solo tenia un capital de Q.500.00, con ese dinero compro telas para hacer trabajos de costuras para las personas que Vivian cerca de su casa.

Ahora esta casada, tienes 2 hijos, y además de su negocio de fabricar cortinas y sabanas vende oro, dándolo al crédito a sus clientes.

Sus hijos están estudiando, y su deseo es darles todo lo que ellos necesitan para completar sus estudios.

Este préstamo lo necesita para invertir en la compra de telas, ya que cuenta con varios pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Leticia started her first business when she was 20 years old. She studied dressmaking, and when she started her business she only had capital of Q.500.00. With this money she bought fabric to sew items for the people in her neighbourhood. She is now married and has two children, and in addition to her business making curtains and sheets she also sells gold, offering credit to her customers. Her children are studying, and she wishes to give them everything that they need to complete their studies. She will use this loan to buy fabric, as she has several orders from customers.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for sewing orders

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
K. B. Karim, 29 years old and married with three children, has been running his salon in Kamuli for a period of six years. He has two experienced hairdressers who offer quality services to customers.

The business generates an average profit of ush 200,000 per month from which he pays rent of ush 600,000 per annum. To replenish his stock, Karim is requesting a loan to purchase hair additions and cosmetics. His dream is to own a chain of beauty salons.

loans.use: To purchase hair additions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 42 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a vender ropa, sale en busca de clientes cada día y de casa en casa caminando por toda su localidad, luego reparte los pedidos que le hicieron y en días posteriores cobra poco a poco lo que dejó al crédito. Esta actividad la realiza de desde hace 3 años y aunque su trabajo requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico al caminar largas distancias, Maritza se mantiene tranquila, ya que con este esfuerzo puede solventar los gastos de su familia. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta por haber sido partícipe de trabajar en un banco comunal y tiene muchos deseos de continuar. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará, al por mayor, zapatos para estudiantes en diversas tallas para la campaña escolar.
texts.en:
Maritza is 42 years old and lives with her three children in her parents’ home. She sells clothes, and every day, she goes out in search of customers by walking from house to house throughout her town. Later, she distributes the orders she acquired, and in the following days, she gradually collects the money for what was paid with credit. She has been doing this for three years, and although her job requires much physical effort to walk long distances, Maritza stays calm, as this effort can cover the costs of her family. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she is very happy for having been involved in working in a community bank and is eager to continue. With the money that she now seeks, she will buy shoes for students in various sizes for the school campaign at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the increase of her merchandise

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes R. is 52 years old. She is a divorced mother of three children. She says it has not been easy for her providing for the family as a single mother of three children. One of them is currently in the senior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Agnes is a trader and a food vendor as well. She sells kenkey and also trades in maize. She prepares the kenkey in the house she lives in and sells it by the roadside in the evenings. Kenkey is served hot with pepper and fried fish. It is prepared from maize (corn dough). 

Agnes procures the raw materials such as maize, fish and other vegetables from the local market. She has been in business for 12 years and wants a loan to procure raw materials in bulk. She hopes to give her children the needed support she can give them to further their education.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize, fish and vegetables

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
A. Said is 26-years old. He is married and has a little daughter. He sells cattle. As a rule, he purchases calves in the central market, feeds them and than resells them at higher prices in the local market. Having been in this business for ten years, he knows very well how to choose the animals and how to breed them. He gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate a stable solid income for his family.

Said is planning to enlarge his stock and purchase cattle. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of $500 US to spend on the purchase of two calves. You could become an important player in the life of Said's family! He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Kasuku Group

texts.en:
Christopher C., 30, is married and has three children between the ages of 6 months and 6 years ago.  He has a business selling rice from Kyela, which is upcountry, since 2001.  He works daily from 8am until 6pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $133.
 
This will be Christopher’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He wants to use this loan to expand his business by buying more rice from the same area.  In the picture, Christopher is on the left in a white t-shirt.
 	
Christopher will share this loan with his loan group, Kasulu, which has a total of 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more rice from the upcountry to sell

loans.name: Zouhair

texts.en:
Zouhair is a 24 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Zouhair has been working as a motorcycle repairer for seven years. He also sells motorcycle spare parts. Zouhair is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase stands for his work because he doesn't have enough space in his garage. This is the first time that Zouhair has requested a loan.

Zouhair chose his business because of his experience in his work and he is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn't have the startup capital. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle stands to repair motorcycles.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana N. is thirty-one years old. She is married and has three children, a son and two daughters. Two are in the junior high school; the youngest is too young to attend school. Juliana lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Her husband works with at a local saw mill firm.

Juliana sells second hand clothes, children’s clothes, and bed sheets. She buys her goods in Kumasi and sells them at the market square in her community. She also treks to other markets to sell. Juliana has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy bales of textiles in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best of education that she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S., 44, manages a small furniture workshop where her 59-year-old husband Oscar (shown with Teresita in the picture above) and youngest son work as craftsmen.  They live in Bagong Silang, one of the biggest barrios in Caloocan City. Teresita and Oscar also have four grown children.

The business, which Teresita started in 1985, supplies wooden beds, cabinets and other household furniture to a number of stores in the city as well as to individual customers who place orders in advance. The business earns Php 2,500.00 profit per week.  Teresita will use her new loan to purchase raw materials like wood, paints, varnish, nails. and other tools of the trade.

Teresita hopes to see her workshop someday employing skilled men around her community. Oscar dreams of purchasing a second-hand delivery truck in the near future.

loans.use: Raw materials (wood, paint, nails and tools)

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es:
La señora Marcia Emma natural D. tarma,tiene 25 años D. edad, conviviente,  tiene 02 hijos D. 7 y 3 años,  todos a su cargo, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía comunal “Las Maravillas”.
Trabaja con EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad, recientemente desD. unos días, su alcancía comunal esta conformada por 10 socios  los cuales realizan actividades como comercio y servicio. Maria se dedica a la venta D. comida jugos ambulatorio en el M. productores, desD. hace 4 años y en los fines D. semana se dedica a al venta D. salchipollos.
Con el préstamo D. S/.400.00  Nuevos soles, le servirá para acondicionar a  sus clientes comprando una carreta y sillas para su negocio.
Maria anhela para su futuro comprarse un puesto en el M. para que pueda vender su comida y comprarse su terreno.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Emma is a native of Tarma. She is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 children (ages 7 and 3). She serves as president of the communal bank group “Las Maravillas”.

She works with the Prosperidad branch of EDAPROSPO. Her communal bank group recently formed a few days ago. It consists of 10 members who engage in various retail and service businesses. Maria sells food and juices on foot through the farmers market. Within the past four years, she has been selling salchipollos (chicken & potatoes) on the weekends.

With her loan of 400 soles, she will purchase a vending cart and chairs for her business. This will equip her to serve her customers. Maria hopes that in the future she can buy her own vending stall at the market to sell her foods and also purchase a plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a vending cart & chairs

loans.name: Zenaida Julia

texts.es:
Zenaida es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Zenaida es casada, tiene 46 años y 7 hijos, Zenaida vende billeteras, lapiceros, entre otros productos, actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria en las calles céntricas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Zenaida vende ropa en la feria de las Américas, actividad que realiza los días domingos.
Zenaida necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas y polos.
Los sueños de Zenaida son educar a sus hijos y tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Zenaida is a member of the village bank "Amuata."

Zenaida is married, 46 years old, and has 7 children. Zenaida peddles wallets and pencils among other products on the central streets in the city of Ayacucho. Also, Zenaida sells clothing in the market known as "la feria de las Américas" on Sundays.

Zenaida needs a loan of 1000 soles that she will invest in buying sweaters and shirts.

Zenaida dreams are to educate her children and have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sweaters and shirts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 45 años, vive con sus hijos Estefany de 12 y Matías de 9, en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 años se dedica al cuidado de niños en su Wawahuasi (Programa gubernamental de madres que cuidan otros niños en su casa cuando las madres de éstos salen a trabajar) llamado “Los Chocolatitos”. María estudió obstetricia y cuida a los niños desde las 6 de la mañana hasta aproximadamente las 5 ó 6 de la tarde, dependiendo del horario de trabajo de sus madres, dándoles en ese trayecto el almuerzo y muchas veces la cena. A ella le gusta mucho el trabajo con niños porque piensa que son almas inocentes, aunque esto no indica que su trabajo sea fácil, ya que por el mismo hecho de ser niños juegan, se pelean, lloran y ella tiene que abastecerse para cuidar a los 7 que están a su cargo. Pero María no sólo los cuida, si no también los educa como en un jardín de niños, con juegos educativos, tareas, etc. Ella se siente muy feliz y en el futuro espera albergar a muchos más niños, contratar a personas que la ayuden y así poder brindar un mejor servicio. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos de sus créditos anteriores. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de muebles (sillas y mesitas) para ambientar su local, así también alimentos (no perecibles ) para preparar los alimentos de los niños.

loans.use: Compra de muebles y comestibles

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 41 años, 03 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Aurora, lleva 01 año dedicándose a la venta de verduras y a su edad no tiene dificultad de seguir adelante con el trabajo que realiza, nos cuenta que se siente muy bien con lo que hace, se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para ir al Mercado Central “Pomarosa” de su Distrito y vender sus productos.

En la actualidad ya es conocida por sus clientes, que a diario acude a su puesto a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende, con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará sacos de yucas, camotes y fréjoles, kilos de culantros y cebollas chinas y otros productos para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Aurora, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante hasta donde Dios le de las fuerzas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Aurora belongs to the Communal Bank "Micaela Bastidas", in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín. She is 41 years old, married and has three children who depend on her. For one year, Aurora has been working selling vegetables and at her age she wants to move forward with her work. Aurora enjoys what she does, getting up at 5am to go to the "Pomarosa" Central Market to sell her products.

At present, Aurora is known by her clients who come to her daily to buy all that a housewife needs and she looks after them with the charisma that characterises her.

With this loan of 1,000.00 soles, Aurora will buy sacks of yucca, sweet potatoes and beans, kilos of coriander, chinese onions and other products to enable her to better assist her clients.

Today, Aurora feels like a fulfilled woman, keen to move forward with God's will. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for having helped her to start her business and the many women who want to set up their own enterprises.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Marcelle

texts.fr: K. Marcelle est née en 1981 à Azovè, au Sud du Bénin. Marcelle est mariée à OUINSOU Dodji, un employé de la société MAGUESTRO  à Cotonou au Bénin. Marcelle réside depuis trois ans à Hêvié au Sud du Bénin et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Marcelle est une couturière qui a pour activité secondaire la vente de tissus, de vêtements et de sous-vêtements qu’elle distribue à domicile. Marcelle ambitionne remplir sa boutique de tissus bazins et Hitarget. C’est la raison pour laquelle Marcelle s’est rapprochée de ALIDé pour obtenir un crédit.

loans.use: Achat de 05 pièces d tissus, 10 douzaines de sous-vêtements et de 02 rouleaux de tissus.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn E. is already 37 years old. She lives in Barangay Bantay Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Romulo who is a local farmer in their community. They are blessed with three children and they are Maica - 14 years old, a sophomore high school student; Marco - nine years old, a presently a grade II pupil; Francisco E. Jr. - four years old. According to Marilyn, her family has a good bonding and live happily in their simple village. 

Marilyn is running a village store business for almost 14 years now. She works hard and gets up early in the morning to prepare for her store to operate. She buys different goods in the market twice a week. She is requesting to borrow loan from KIVA lenders the amount of PHP5, 000. She believes that this amount will enable her to buy more grocery items to retail. She hopes this will help her attain a better living standard for her family.

loans.use: additional capital for purchasing more items for her store

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora R. strives so hard to support her children and to enable them to finish their studies and become professionals. She’s now 55 years old and has four children, her eldest being 26 years old. As a widow, she spends her time managing a food canteen in their place.

Dioscora needs additional capital to finance her business. She’s now requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. This will help her buy food supplies and ingredients for her small canteen.

loans.use: To buy food supplies and ingredients for her small canteen

loans.name: Lek

texts.en:
Lek S., 35 years old, is a humble villager living in the capital, Phnom Penh, in the middle of Cambodia. She is married and blessed with a young school-aged child, while her husband is a motorbike taxi driver.

To earn a living, Lek S. sells many kinds of flowers which she either buys in bulk from her supplier or grows them. Her husband always picks up the flowers for her before he starts providing his taxi service.

Unfortunately, an existing motorbike often has broken down during use. Because of that, Lek S. has decided to seek a loan of $500 from Kiva, which she will use to change the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To change her husband's broken motorcycle

loans.name: Jurnalyn

texts.en:
Jurnalyn T. is from the village of Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jurnalyn owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fish in the local community. Jurnalyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Jurnalyn joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jurnalyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Jessenia

texts.es:
Jessenia S. es una mujer dinámica y optimista, vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha, ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 32 años, es madre de tres hijos menores y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposos.
Jessenia es vendedora ambulante de golosinas, actividad que realiza en el distrito de Yarinacocha. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace ocho meses y el primer crédito que recibió fue 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtió en la compra de golosinas.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà golosinas para su negocio. 
La meta de Jessenia es tener una tienda de abarrotes bien implementada, seguir progresando y aportando económicamente a su hogar.
texts.en:
Jessenia S. is a dynamic and optimistic woman who lives in the district of Yarinacocha, city of Pucallpa, region of Ucayali. She is 32 years old, is the mother of 3 underage children, and counts on the support of her husband. Jessenia is a traveling saleswoman of candy in the district of Yarinacocha. She has been part of the communal bank "Courageous Mothers" for 8 months. Her first credit, which she received in the amount of 300.00 soles, she invested in the purchase of candy. Currently she needs a credit of 500.00 soles with which she will buy candy for her business. Jessenia's goal is to have a well set-up grocery store, to continue progessing and contributing economically to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her credit in the purchase of candy for her business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca J. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 46 years-old and is married with four adult children. Francisca owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Francisca is just starting this business.

In 2005, Francisca joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Francisca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products.

loans.name: Maura Estela

texts.es: Maura Estela S. R. de 25 años de edad, reside en Rosario de Mora, vive junto a su único hijo de 5 años, el cual asiste al kinder. Maura es una madre joven la cual se ha visto en la necesidad de trabajar mucho más que otras madres, debido a que ella no cuenta con la ayuda y apoyo de un esposo, debido a que es madre soltera. Maura posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el Mercado Central, este es uno de los mercados más grandes de la ciudad de San Salvador y es uno de los lugares que cuenta con más clientes, debido a que se comercializa a menor precio que en otros mercados. Maura solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar una mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras. Para ella es de mucha importancia obtener este préstamo, debido a que Maura compra todos los productos al contado, y a pesar que sus ventas son diarias, no cuenta con la capacidad económica de poder surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Maura Estela S. R. is 25 years old and lives in Rosario de Mora. She lives with her only son who is 5 years old and who attends kindergarten. Because Maura is a single mother she has had to work more than other mothers, since she cannot count on the help and support of a husband. Maura has a business selling fruits and vegetables that is located in the Central Market, which is one of the biggest markets in the city of San Salvador. This market has an abundance of customers, since goods here are sold at lower prices than in other markets. Maura requests a loan through which she will buy a large quantity of fruits and vegetables. For her this loan is very important, because Maura buys all of her products with cash, and since she has daily sales she does not have the economic capacity to be able to restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits that are in season

location.town: Rosario de Mora, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo S. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 75 years old. Alfredo is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Alfredo raises pigs for sale. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Alfredo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for house repairs. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Alfredo from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repairs

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.en: Fifteen kilometers from Fundación Paraguaya's Paraguarí office, the 'La Esperanza' (Hope) group met to learn about the Women Entrepreneurs Program and the benefits it offered. The group is comprised of fifteen hardworking women who are in their tenth loan cycle. They work hard to improve the quality of their family's lives. These women will invest the loans, averaging 1,507,000 GS, in their respective businesses.

loans.use: Purchase thread, corn meal, cheese, eggs, fabric, sugar, flower, vegetables, fruit, dairy, sweets, drinks

loans.name: Fuente De Vida 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Sobeida is the coordinator of her group 'Fuente D. Vida' (Source of Life), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally.
