Her group is located in the areas surrounding L. Romana, an agricultural area based around the sugarcane harvest where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Sobeida is excited to be taking her second loan  with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small 'colmado' or corner store, and she will invest by purchasing the essentials, rice, beans and cooking oil, to sell in her store. She will use the profits to save towards investing in her business further. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Rice, beans and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia S. is happy for having five children whose age range is from 4 to 17 years. However, because of her small income from selling fruits and vegetables raised by her husband, who is a farmer, she feels guilty sometimes because she can’t give her children things they need. But despite that, she still feels privileged because her husband and children are all loving and understanding.

In 2007, Sonia joined ASHI in order to have the opportunity of obtaining a loan to finance her business growth. Since then she has also been able to receive loans which support her husband’s business. With that, the volume of fruits and vegetables she sells has increased a bit as well as her profit.

With the hope that, by making her business profitable and sustainable, she will  be able to reach her dream of graduating her five children from college, Sonia is requesting a larger loan from ASHI.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, insecticide and herbicide for her husband's farm

loans.name: Keut

texts.en: Mr. Keut N. is 41 years of age and currently works as a repairman in a motor company. Keut N. has a life partner in his wife who appears in the photo. She earns a living by sewing clothes in industry.  The couple has three teenage children: one is no longer in school and is working in construction, and the remaining two are students.   Keut N. will be using his first loan to buy a couple of cows to raise for their offspring, which he can sell for extra income. The loan will provide the family with new assets.

loans.use: To buy a couple of cows to raise

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, por lo que es por medio de los financiamientos que ha progresado. Samuel tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. Su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. El dio inicio a este negocio porque no tenía un trabajo que le proporcionara un salario diario, esto lo motivo a establecer lo que actualmente tiene. El solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, gaseosas y granos básicos. El desea obtener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Samuel has worked with the Foundation for a long time, and it is by way of financing that he has made progress. Samuel has 2 children and they are both studying. He has a local store. He has had this business for more than 5 years. He says he started this business because he did not have a job that provided him with a daily salary and this caused him to set up what he currently has. He is requesting this financing for working capital to buy candy, fruit drinks, bread, soda and basic grains. He wants to have better economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn G. lives in the town of Cabuling. She is 44 years old, married, has three school-aged children and makes a living by raising livestock, especially ducks and pigs. She has been in business for more than 12 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is now applying for her first loan, for 6,000 PHP, which which she will use to buy livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About CEVI:
Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training through regular group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina J. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 59 years old. Angelina is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Angelina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Angelina has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Angelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Angelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Angelina is requesting a new loan of ,6000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Angelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda H. is from the village of San Jose. She is 43 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Yolanda owns and operates a business raising pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her twelfth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.  About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria G. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Gleceria is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Gleceria owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily-use products in the local community. Gleceria has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gleceria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gleceria is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gleceria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Crecencio

texts.es: Don Crecencio B. tiene 46 años de edad y reside en Barrio El Tolulo del Triunfo Choluteca. Es un padre de 3 hijos los cuales ha mantenido en la escuela junto con la ayuda de su esposa. El es un señor emprendedor que se dedica a la fabricacion de camas para venderlas en Choluteca y ha trabajado en este negocio por varios años. El prestamo lo utilizara para comprar madera y asi poder fabricar mas camas para venta. Las ganacias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y la educacion de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Crecencio B., 46, lives in Choluteca’s Tolulo del Triunfo neighborhood. He has three children that he has been able to keep in school thanks to help from his wife. He is an enterprising man that manufactures beds to sell in Choluteca. He has been in this line of work for several years. He will use the loan to buy wood in order to make more beds to sell. He needs the profits to cover household expenses and pay for his children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood to manufacture beds.

loans.name: Adowa

texts.en: Adowa S. operates a salon at Elmina. Adowa has received senior high education.  She is married and takes care of five dependents. Her husband is a trader. Adowa has been a hairdresser for ten years. With the profit she makes from her salon she helps her husband in providing the needs of her family. Her loan which she hopes to receive will be used to buy more hair creams and other hair products to use on her customers' hair at the salon. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: buy more hair creams and other hair products

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo P. is 44 and lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, where he earns a living as a construction laborer. He is also hired by people to construct buildings. Besides his job, Keo P. and his wife take the time to cultivate rice crops on their own farmland. The couple has been married for years and have five children. One of the children helps support her family by working in the garment industry, while the other four go to school. The family living situation is not comfortable because their house is old and often needs repairs. Because of that, Keo P. has decided to pursue a loan in the amount of $600 from Kiva’s project partner, HKL, in order to mend their old house.

loans.use: To mend their old house.

loans.name: Pedro Javier

texts.es:
Pedro Javier B.  es  de la ciudad de Ybycui, tiene 24 años y  está cursando el 5° año de la Carrera de Contaduría Pública en la  Facultad de Ciencias Económicas de la Universidad Nacional de Asunción (UNA) Filial Paraguarí.
El es el último hijo de la familia y el único que aún vive con la madre, tiene dos hermanas una de 28 y la otra de 32 años ambas casadas y con hijos y un tercer hermano que ya falleció hace algunos años en un accidente.
Su madre es comerciante, su padre también ya falleció hace algunos años.
Pedro Javier actualmente trabaja en la Municipalidad de Acahay, como secretario donde se encuentra adquiriendo experiencia laboral.
 El solicita el préstamo para el pago de la matrícula del decimo semestre de  su facultad. 
Pedro agradece el préstamo que la Fundación Paraguaya le otorga, ya que le servirá de gran ayuda para culminar su carrera y cumplir con su metas.
texts.en:
Pedro Javier B. is from the city of Ybycui. He is 24 years old and a 5th year accounting student in the school of Economics at the National University of Asuncion (UNA), Paraguari campus. Pedro Javier is the youngest of his siblings and the only one still living at home. He has two sisters: one, 28 years old and the other, 32 years old. Both are married with children. A brother died in an accident some years ago. His father, too, died some time ago. Pedro Javier lives with his mother who is a merchant. He works as an assistant for the municipality of Acahay where he is gaining workplace experience. Pedro Javier is applying for a loan to pay tuition for his tenth semester at the university. He is grateful for the loan extended to him by the Fundacion Paraguaya because it will allow him to finish his degree and meet his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University tuition.

loans.name: Hatem

texts.ar: يعمل حاتم البالغ من العمر 41 عاماً في مجال السمانة، فهو يملك دكان سمانة صغير في منطقة بنت جبيل منذ عام 1994، يعتاش منه هو وزوجته وأولاده الثلاث.  يبيع حاتم في دكانه المواد الغذائية، المشروبات الغازية، المياه، والمعلبات، خضار وفاكهة، بالإضافة إلى الألعاب والهدايا. وبسبب الظروف الإقتصادية الصعبة في المنطقة، يعمل حاتم أيضاً في نقل الطلاب من وإلى المدارس خلال الموسم الدراسي. سمعته الطيبة في محيطه هي أساس تمكنه وتطوره في المنطقة، فهو يمتلك جميع الصفات الحسنة التي تدفع الأهل إلى الإسراع في تسجيل أولادهم معه. سبق وتعامل حاتم مع المجموعة، وكانت طريقة تسديده للقرض جيدة جداً، وهو الآن يتقدم بطلب قرض آخر لشراء سيارة للعمل عليها كمدخول إضافي، بالإضافة إلى تسديد الأقساط المدرسية المترتبة عليه، وشراء القرطاسية لمدرسة اولاده. إتقانه لعمله هو سر نجاحه.  يهدف حاتم إلى التوسع في المستقبل إن كان من إمتلاك شبكة نقل طلاب من وإلى المدارس، أو من خلال التوسع في مجال السمانة والمواد الغذائية بالجملة
texts.en:
Hatem, who is 41 years old, works as a grocer. Since 1994, he has owned a small grocery store in the area of Bint Jbeil. The store earns a living for him, his wife, and his three children. Hatem sells food products in his store, including soft drinks, water, canned products, vegetables and fruits, as well as toys and gifts. Due the region’s difficult economic conditions, Hatem also works as driver, transporting students and to and from their schools during the academic year. His good reputation in the area is the main reason behind his success, as he has all the qualities that motivate parents to use his services in transporting their children. Hatem had previously dealt with Al Majmoua, and was well able to repay his loan. He is now coming forward with a request for another loan to purchase a car that will help him earn additional income. The loan will also help him pay school expenses and purchase new school stationery for his children. His diligence is the secret to his success. Hatem aims to grow in the future by owning a transportation network that services students, or through expanding in the grocery and wholesale food products field.

Translated from Arabic by Ghaydaa Fahim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a car for personal use and to expand his business.

loans.name: Jesus Fuerza De Vida Group

texts.es: Herlinda tiene 42 años y es conviviente, vive en la zona de Pariachi en Huaycan es la presidenta del grupo “Jesús Fuerza de Vida” que lleva 6 años trabajando con Edaprospo y es conformado por 7 vecinas las cuales son amigas y comparten la devoción a Cristo. Herlinda vende productos Omnilife  para ayudar a su pareja en el mantenimiento de su hogar, también ah logrado poner una bodega en su casa para así poder tener los recursos para mejorar y arreglar su casa. Herlinda desea ampliar su negocio y poner una librería pero para esto necesita que Edapropso le ayude con las habilitaciones que aportan de capital a su negocio.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 42 years old and living with her partner in the Pariachi zone in Huaycan.  She is the president of the “Jesus Fuerza de Vida” (Jesus Force of Life) Group, which has been working with Edaprospo for 6 years.  The group is composed of 7 neighbors who are friends and share their devotion to Christ.

Herlinda sells Omnilife products in order to aid her partner in maintaining her home.  She has also managed to create a general store in her house, in order to have the resources to repair and improve her home.

Herlinda wants to expand her business and install a book store but for this, she needs Edaprospo's help with the financing that will contribute to her business capital.

loans.use: BUYING PRODUCTS AND SUPPLIES TO SELL IN HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For her husband's carpentry shop

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy S. is currently in the business of selling maize grain at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more maize grain to sell.
Lucy is 39 years old and married to a builder. She has two children who both go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for her goods.

loans.use: To stock more maize grain to sell

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is married with two sons, both of whom work in a factory on a monthly salary. She lives in a small city named Samundri in the Punjab area of  Pakistan, which is known for its agriculture. She has been living there since she got married.

Naseem is a housewife, stays at home and does her household work. Her husband has a grocery store, located in the market. As grocery stores are considered to be some of the most profitable businesses, in every community there are two to three grocery stores available. Due to this, the competition is increasing day by day among grocery store owners and the only way to win business from the other grocery stores is to be better stocked than the competition.

Therefore, Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With her portion of this group loan, he will purchase the groceries in bulk quantity that will enable him to compete with the other grocery shops and in fulfill the demands of his customers.  Naseem is hopeful that with the help of this investment that her husband will successfully be able to get the desired results from his business.  This is her first loan application with Asasah and she hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her.

Note: In the photo that accompanies this profile, the woman holding the Asasah Passbook is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a grocery store.

loans.name: Moun

texts.en:
Mrs. Moun M. (in the photo with her loom) and her husband, Mr. Chorm Kheun, have been married since 1970 and have five children--one son and four daughters. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Moun has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. She is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase weaving materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials to continue her weaving business

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia Z. L., vive junto a dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y quienes dependen por completo de Marta, ella reside junto a su familia en Soyapango en el departamento de San Salvador. Marta posee un bazar en el que comercializa: accesorios para regalar, centros de mesa, juguetes y así mismo comercializa diferentes tipos de papelería. Su negocio es bastante estable, razón por la que desea aumentar su inventario y de esta forma mejorar sus ganancias, ya que de esta manera ella podrá atender a más clientes, ofreciéndoles nuevos productos. Por esta razón,  Marta solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda aumentar sus productos.
texts.en: Marta Alicia Z. L. lives with her two children who are studying and who are completely dependent on her.  She lives with her family in Soyapango, in San Salvador department.  Marta owns a stationery store in which she sells: gifts, table decorations and toys as well as different types of stationery.  Her business is quite stable and, for this reason, she would like to increase her inventory and thereby improve her profits as she will be able to serve more customers, offering them new products.  Marta is requesting a loan which will allow her to increase her number of products.

loans.use: To buy paper and different types of accessories to sell

loans.name: Unidos Por El Triunfo Group

texts.es: Hersilia  tiene 60 años D. edad es socia D. la Alcancía Comunal Unidos por el Triunfo desD. hace tres años. Ella se dedica a elaborar manualidades como son bolsos en macramé, muñecas y también hace un poco D. costura, todos estos objetos los ofrece ella misma, además D. saber tejidos en macramé está estudiando manualidades en cuero para lo cual solicito un préstamo a EDAPROSPO e invertir en materiales para elaborar carteras en cuero. El sueño  D. Hersilia es que su último hijo termine la universidad y terminar D. construir su casa.
texts.en: Hersilia is 60 years old.  She has been a member of the 'Unidos por el Triunfo' (United for Victory) community bank for three years.  She makes handicrafts such as macramé bags, dolls and she also does a little sewing.  She sells all of these objects herself.  As well as knowing how to make macramé products, she is also studying how to make leather handicrafts.  She is requesting a loan from EDAPROSPO to invest in buying materials for making leather purses.  Hersilia's dream is for her youngest child to finish university and to finish building her house.

loans.use: Material (leather) for making purses

loans.name: Ramonito

texts.en:
To make a living, Ramonito runs a grocery store selling household items. He is from the village of Poblacion, Lalibertad. Ramonito is 40 years old, married and blessed with two school-aged children.

In 2009, Ramonito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramonito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new stocks. Ramonito is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used as working capital for his business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Ramonito from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Working capital for store

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita B. is from the village of Bandera. She is 51 years old, married, and has two adult children. Cristita operates a family member's business raising pigs in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cristita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials for her pig fence and feeds. Cristita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional piglets and feeds. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Cristita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Samuel Miri

texts.en:
Samuel has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years. He is 42 years old and married to Rose Njeri. Together they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He paid  all his previous loans in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

In the future Samuel hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 31 years old and married to Getrude Kiprop, who produces some additional income to the family. They have four children between the ages of 1 and 11. He has been farming for eleven years, planting assorted fruits and vegetables which he sells later to his customers. He earns a monthly profit of approximately $208.

He requesting a loan of 60,000 KES which he plans to use to buy watermelon seeds, fungicides and insecticides, and to plow and also to pay labor. He plans to save the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his children,

loans.use: To upgrade his farming of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita G. is from the village of Bayabo 2, Tumauini, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Isabelita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5000 Php a month for these activities.

In 2007, Isabelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and rice to sell. 

Isabelita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 8th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and rice to sell

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Doña Domitila, es una señora de 64 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, posee un negocio al que nombra “Tienda Tila”, ella vive con su hermana, en su negocio ofrece artículos de primera necesidad y consumo, también hacen tortillas para vender.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería para el negocio, para abastecer el inventario y ofrecer a los clientes diversidad de productos necesarios para el hogar como aceite, arroz, embutidos, bebidas y pan.
Esta ayuda mejorara sus ventas y por consiguiente sus ingresos, estabilizando su condición económica y continuando con su comercio.
texts.en:
Domitila, 64, is a woman living in San Miguel.  She has a business called “Tienda Tila.” She lives with her sister.  Her store stocks basic need and consumption items; they also make tortillas to sell.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for the store to stock inventory and offer customers a variety of products that are needed in the home, such as oil, rice, sausage, drinks and bread .

This help will improve sales and thus income stabilizing her economic situation and keeping her in business.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, drinks, sausage and bread.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa tiene 31 años, es madre soltera que vive con su hijo en su casa propia. Hace más de 2 años ofrece el servicio de transporte, ya que posee una vehículo grande para transporte público asimismo contrata los servicio de un chofer para que realiza la ruta Inter distrital de su zona, es así que trabaja todos los días de manera interrumpida incluidos los domingos. En ocasiones ella realiza el trabajo de cobrador así controla los ingresos. Por otro lado, también tiene responsabilidad sobre el buen funcionamiento de su vehículo y cada cierto tiempo debe llevarlo para su debido mantenimiento. Con el paso del tiempo ha visto que su negocio es rentable,  Su anhelo es comprarse otro vehículo por ello deberá seguir esforzándose para cumplir con su meta. Es su primer crédito con MFP, como es su primera experiencia  de crédito en su banco comunal por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos, ha ingresado  por tener buenas referencias de su persona y esta segura de demostrar un buen comportamiento con la puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento mecánico y renovación del seguro contra accidentes de transito.
texts.en:
Elisa, 31, is a single mother living with her son in her own house.  For over two years she’s been providing transportation services because she owns a large vehicle for public transportation.  She hires a driver who covers the inter-district route in her zone so work is every day, including Sundays, with no interruption.  Sometimes she acts as fare collector thereby controlling income.  On the other hand, she’s also responsible for the good functioning of the vehicle and every so often has to take it in for servicing.  As time’s gone by she’s seen that the business is profitable.  Her wish is to buy a second vehicle so she has to keep working hard to reach this goal.

This is her first loan with MFP and since it’s her first experience with loans in a communal bank she commits to be very punctual with her payments.  She was able to join thanks to her good personal references and she’s sure that she’ll exhibit good behavior with respect to punctuality of payments.  She will use the requested loan to service the vehicle and to renew her accident insurance policy.

loans.use: to service her vehicle and renew her accident insurance policy.

loans.name: Fernando Lourenco

texts.pt:
Fernando Lorenço S. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casado e pai de 3 filhos todos vaõ a Escola. Fez 9ª classe nao continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua familia e sustenta a maê enviando dinheiro.

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, faz prestação de serviços de canalização de agua e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt, a 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despasas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu cunhado que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção ( areia, pedra, blocos, cimento, ferro e outros) para continuar com a construcao da sua casa.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro, pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para construir um armazem de venda de material de construçaõ.
texts.en:
Fernando Lorenço S. was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has three children who all go to school.  Fernando finished ninth grade but did not continue because of financial problems. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his mother by sending her money.

He has never left his hometown. Fernando installs plumbing for running water and earns about 3,000 to 4,000 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account.

He has never had loans from other banks, and he learned about Hluvuku through his brother-in-law, who is a customer of this institution. This is Fernando's first Hluvuku loan. He is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy construction materials (sand, stone, blocks, cement, iron and other items) to continue construction on his house.

He promises to make his payments on time so he can take out other loans in the future. He intends to ask for more loans to build a warehouse for selling construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, stone, blocks, cement, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie D. is 31 years old, married and has two school-aged children.  She lives in Calabayan Ozamiz City.  Girlie owns and runs a general store.  The main source of her income comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Girlie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Girlie joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC.  Girlie is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to purchase dried fish, bagoong and softdrinks to sell in the community. This loan will be her eighth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC):

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish, bagoong and softdrinks to sell in the community

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past eight years, he has operated a charcoal selling business, selling at retail to his neighbors and passersby. In addition he also operates a motorcycle business which contributes another source of income. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. His dream is to expand his business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell and repair his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en: Minda is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Minda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, biscuits & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Minda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Minda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es: Heriberto tiene 34 años. Es un hombre casado y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo que dependen de él. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de reparación de computadoras. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ayudado mucho para el apoyo familiar. Heriberto es un hombre muy humilde, pero trabajador, por lo que es siempre se ha encargado de vigilar que a sus hijos no les falte nada. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuesto de computadoras.
texts.en:
Heriberto is 34 years old.  He is married and has two dependent children under his care.  His business activity is repairing computers.  He has been in this business for over ten years.  It has helped him a lot in supporting his family.

Heriberto is a very humble, yet hardworking man.  He has always been vigilant so that his children lack for nothing.

The loan he is requesting is for work capital in order to buy computer replacement parts.

loans.use: to buy computer replacement parts.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita, es de un lugar  llamado san Juan  de coapilla  Chiapas México, vive en unión libre con el señor  Aricel  y con quien procreo un hijo de nombre Fabián de tan solo cinco años de edad.

   Ella se dedica  a su hogar, como también a la compra y veta de frutas y verduras, para salir a venderlo en su hogar, en esta actividad lleva  dos años y dos meses en lo que comenta que le bar bien ya que con ello esta a aumentando su solvencia económica. 

    En esta actividad se inspiro para apoyar a su poso a  aportar dinero y así juntos sacar adelantes a su único hijo  y quiere darlo lo mejor para que su crecimiento valla mejorando día a día.

      Lo único que desea es que con sus ahorros que baya obteniendo, logre incrementar mas su negocio y con el tiempo construir un local para que pueda seguir vendiendo.
texts.en:
Margarita is from a place called San Juan, in Copainalá, Chiapas, Mexico.  She lives with her common-law husband Aricel with whom she has a son, Fabián, who is only five years old.

Margarita looks after her home and also buys and sells fruit and vegetables.  She sells her produce from her home.  She has been in this business for two years and two months.  She says that her business is doing well since it is helping her to increase her financial solvency.

Margarita started out in this business in order to support her husband by contributing money to their household.  Together the couple manage to get their son ahead in life.  They want to provide him with the very best so that he can grow every day.

The only thing that Margarita wishes for is that she can increase her business through the savings that she has made and that, over time, she is able to build premises so that she can continue making her sales.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Lucia Erlinda

texts.es: Lucia Erlinda se caracteriza por tener un buen carisma con sus clientes, siempre está hablando con ellos y aconsejándolos de los productos de calidad que ofrece. Ella tiene su actividad que es la venta de mercadería en general, hace mas de 32 años que tiene el negocio, empezó a muy temprana edad porque no tenía un trabajo estable para mantener a sus hijos, con las ganancias que obtenía decidió dedicarse por completo en este trabajo logrando tener una gran variedad de clientes. Actualmente está solicitando este crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, bolsos, calzado y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Lucia Erlinda is noted for the good charisma that she has with her customers.  She is always talking to them and advising them about the good-quality products that she sells.

Lucia Erlinda's business is selling general merchandise.  She has been in this business for 32 years.  She started out at a very young age as she didn't have a stable job with which to support her children.  She used the profits that she made to start working full time in this line of work, gaining a wide range of customers.  She is currently requesting this loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, footwear and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, footwear and cosmetics

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is 42 years old, married, with four children all of whom are still below the age of eighteen years.  He operates a boutique at the New Market in Malindi town.  He has been in this business for the past five years now and it usually gives him a monthly income of about KES 10,000 with which he uses to support his family.

He has been loaned KES 30,000 by KADET LTD and this serves as his first loan from the company.  He plans to stock up his business with ladies’ make ups, body lotions, perfumes, bathing soap, hair weaves as well as wigs, necklaces and bracelets.

He wishes to use the anticipated profit from the boutique to continue looking after his family as well as to continue restocking and gradually expanding the business so that in future, he may come to own his own well established beauty store in the area.

loans.use: TO HELP EXPAND THE CLIENTS BOUTIQUE

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru:
Фируза ответственная и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 4 детей.  С детства она мечтала отрыт свой собственный бизнес, и всегда старалась в этом. Вот уже более 10 лет она занимается торговлей. Она начала этот бизнес с куплей продажей детской одежды, а постепенно перешла на продажу женской обуви. В бизнесе помогает её муж, и они дружно вместе работают. Фируза хотела бы расширить свой бизнес и  получить максимальной прибыли. С этой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000$ США.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Firuza is a dependable and honest woman. She is married and is a loving mother of 4 children. Since her childhood she has dreamed to open her own store and has always worked towards that goal. And now, for more then 10 years she has been managing her own stall at the local market. She first started to sell children's clothes and slowly moved to sell women's shoes. Her husband helps her in her business and they work well together. Firuza would like to expand her business to maximize the income from it. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of 1000 USA dollars.

loans.use: to purchase of women's shoes for her store

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta del Socorro es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien desde hace 10 años se dedica a la realización de bebidas nacionales pinolillo(maiz y cacao), pinol(maiz), además comercializa ropa, calzado, chiverías…etc. Ella con el crédito comprara mercadería en ropa camisas, pantalones, blusas…etc.
texts.en: Modesta del Socorro is a hardworking and resourceful woman, and for the past 10 years she has been engaged in preparing the national drinks “pinolillo” (maiz and cocoa) and “pozol” (maiz). She also sells clothes, shoes and snacks among other products. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy items of clothing such as shirts, trousers, blouses and so on.

loans.use: To buy items of clothing such as shirts, trousers and blouses.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima -Jauja Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Elva emprendedora y luchadora  de 41 años de edad, soltera con 1 hijo menor de edad en etapa escolar ,es socia de la nueva alcancía comunal Santa Rosa de Lima-Jauja , se dedica actualmente  a la  venta de pasteles ,también se dedica  a la venta de productos unique ,como podemos observar Elva se dedica  a muchos trabajos con la intención de ser mejor cada día y dar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y buena educacion.Solicito este préstamo para poder  comprar más productos unique ,para  así  generar más ingresos y a la  vez poder tener más productos en oferta .Elva desea para el futuro tener una tienda en una zona comercial , para poder mostrar mejor los productos de unique .
En la foto Elva  viste  una casaca color negro y polo color mostaza, se encuentra ubicada a lado izquierdo de la Sra. que viste  una chompa color blanco.
texts.en:
Elva is an enterprising and combative woman who is 41 years old and single with a young son of school age. She is a member of the new Santa Rosa de Lima – Jauja communal bank. At present, she sells cakes and, also, 'Unique' cosmetics. As we can see, Elva dedicates her time to many jobs, with the intention of improving herself each day and providing her son with a better quality of life and a better education.

She is requesting a loan to buy more Unique cosmetics in order to generate more income and at the same time, to have more products to offer. 

In the future, Elva would like to have a store in the commercial zone, so she can better display these Unique products.

In the photo, Elva is wearing a black coat and a mustard coloured polo shirt, and is located to the left of the woman in the white sweater.

loans.use: buy more 'Unique' cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Zacaerias

texts.pt:
Nasceu em chibuto, Provincia de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 6 filhos 3 maiores de idade e 3 ainda frequentam a escola. Fez  4ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 
Saiu da sua terra natal para Boane a procura de melhores condicoes de vida, trabalha na bananalândia e pescador ha mais de 25 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de 10.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos  conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar redeS de pesca
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para comprar gado bovino, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Zacaerias was born in the city of Chibuto, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of six children, three of whom are adults and three of whom attend school. He went to school through the fourth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. 
He left Chibuto for Boane in search of a better life. He's worked as a fisherman and on a banana plantation for more than 25 years. He earns about 10,500 meticals a month, which he uses to cover household expenses. He is also able to save a small amount in his bank account.
He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to buy fishing nets.
In the future, he hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to buy some cattle.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Josinta

texts.en:
Josinta is a 30-year-old woman; she is married to Timotius, a 35-year-old man. Josinta has been blessed with three children, they are: Inyo, who is 10 years old and is in the fifth grade of elementary school; Rafly, who is seven years old and is in the first grade of primary school; and Intan, who is five years old and is not at school yet. 

Josinta's husband runs a betel nut business. Her husband is only able to sell betel nut in small quantities, so their daily income is not sufficient to fully cover their daily needs. Josinta realized that she cannot rely solely on her husband's income. To support her husband in generating income, Josinta runs a home-based kiosk business. 

She started this business two years ago by utilizing the very small amount of capital that she had. She first received loan assistance from TLM in a group loan (she joined a group lending program twice). The loans were used to purchase more daily household items such as; coffee, sugar, tea, betel nut, detergents, snacks etc. to be sold at her kiosk. 

Josinta wishes to stock her kiosk with varied items such as: kerosene, rice, cooking spices, and instant noodles as requested by her customers. However, she doesn't have enough capital to make it happen. Josinta then submitted her loan application and requesting a loan of 5,000,000 Rupiah (IDR) from TLM. Josinta is expecting that TLM will assist her again with the loan.

loans.use: To purchase stock such as: kerosene, rice, cooking spices, and instant noodles

loans.name: Nouha

texts.fr:
Nouha est de la région sud du sénégal age de 40 ans,il pratique ce metier pendant 15 ans.
IL achète ses outils de travail dans la meme région.Pendant la période de la chaleure,il est charger dans son atelier pour les bobinage de ventilateur chambre,de réfrigérateur,de groupoe électrogène.
Nouha marié depuis juin 2010,avec son metier,il assure la restauration de sa famille et la location de sa chambre.
texts.en:
Nouha, age 40, is from Southern Senegal. He's been repairing electronic devices for 15 years. He gets his work tools from the same region.

In his workshop, during the hot season, he's in charge of windings for fans, refrigerators, and diesel generators. 

Nouha has been married since June 2010 and, with his job, he pays his family food expenses and rent.

loans.use: to buy work tools and counters from Senelec

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en: Baigalmaa is 43 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger (the traditional Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She is a single mother, and her daughter is disabled and stays at home. She started her dairy retail business in 2000 by renting a counter in a local market. Also she operates a grocery trading business. She is very experienced in her field. She wants to expand the range of products. She is a strong and hardworking woman who says, "Ever since my daughter got into that accident, it has been hard. However, I love my daughter and I will support her as long as I live." She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy dairy and grocery products.

loans.use: To purchase dairy and grocery products.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 30 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy sociable. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus dos hijos en su propia casa, inmueble que logró comprar a base de mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza, es la venta de pescado, producto que lo adquiere de los puertes fluviales ya que son varios comerciante que traen este producto de la costa, asimismo lo compra en las piscigranjas donde crían pescados. Su centro de trabajo se encuentra en el mercado municipal de su distrito y desde hace seis meses es que se dedica a éste trabajo. Lo que le de esta actividad es el tener un ingreso económico, gracias a ello puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, asimismo ayudar en la educación de sus hijos. Esta feliz por que su negocio le ha resultado rentable, pues el pescado tiene mucha demanda en su población. Tiene planes de poder incursionar en la venta al mayoreo de éste producto para lo cual necesita mayor cantidad de capital de trabajo. Este seria el segundo crédito con MFP, se siente muy contenta de poder contar con el apoyo de la institución, manifiesta que seguirá siendo puntual en el pago de sus cuotas para poder tener acceso a más créditos futuros. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de pescado al por mayor y así poder tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 30, is a hardworking and sociable woman. She lives with her partner and their two children in their own home, which they were able to purchase through much effort. Sonia sells fish and acquires her products at the river ports where several merchants bring them from the coast. She also acquires some of her inventory from fish farms. Her primary workplace is at the municipal market in her district where she has been performing her job for the past six months. What she likes about this business is being able to generate an income. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to cover the household expenses and provide an education for her children at the same time. Sonia is happy that her business has produced profitable results since fish is in great demand in her town. She has plans of become a wholesaler of this product, but she needs to acquire more operating capital.

This will be her second loan with MFP. Sonia is very pleased to have the support of the organization. She says that she is confident that she can submit her payments on time so that she will be eligible to access more loans in the future. The amount she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of fish in bulk so that she can generate better earnings.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Delmy

texts.es: Delmy D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo D. 45 años y sus dos hijas D. 19 y 17 años. Delmy ha trabajado toda su vida para sacar adelante a su querida familia la cual cada día le demanda más. Ella se dedica al comercio. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado establecer una tiendita en el mercado central D. la zona donD. ella habita, en la que venD. diferentes productos como: arroz, frijoles, pan dulce, golosinas, detergente, papel, aceite, etc. Gracias a su carisma ha logrado ganarse la confianza D. sus vecinos y estos cada día la prefieren más ya que siempre encuentran lo que buscan. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que trabaja duramente para poder colaborar con la economía del hogar y así poder aspirar a un mejor futuro. Su sueño es seguir manteniendo su tiendita en marcha ya que esta le brinda los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento del hogar. Es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra D. artículos (frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, aceite, golosinas, leche, pan dulce, papel, detergente, etc.) al por mayor para surtir su tienda y así seguir trabajando por lograr un mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en: Delmy is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her family: her husband who is 45 years old and her 2 daughters who are 19 and 17 years old. Delmy has worked her whole life to take care of her beloved family which each days demands more. By means of a lot of effort and dedication she has managed to establish a small shop at the central market of the area in which she lives, where she sells different products such as: rice, beans, pastries, candies, detergent, paper, oil, etc. Thanks to her charisma she has managed to gain her neighbours' trust and these days they prefer her store as they always find what they need. The most important for her is her family, working hard to contribute to the household expenses and thus aspiring to a better future. For this reason she has decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in the purchase of products (beans, rice, sugar, coffee, oil, candies, milk, pastries, paper, detergent, etc.) wholesale to stock her store and so continue to work towards a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, oil, candies, milk, bread, pastries, paper, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Sheywe Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sheywe Farmers Group in Western Kenya! Peter is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Peter takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, he had a good maize yield harvesting nine bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Peter was only able to harvest two bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peter and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Peter will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Sheywe Farmers group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. He is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Rufina has a rice field that sells rice grains during harvest time. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

Rufina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rufina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is married with four children. Bernadette is 24 years old and resides in Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Bernadette owns and operates a home products sales business to earn a living. She's been in this business for one year. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Bernadette is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Bernadette hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Enagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sabira Aurore est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sabira Aurore est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Sabira Aurore a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Sabira Aurore est mariée à un certain Pierrot. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Sabira Aurore vend depuis une quinzaine d’année, divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, etc.) à son domicile. Sabira Aurore s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sabira Aurore sollicite ensemble avec le second membre du groupe ENAGNON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: ENAGNON is a group composed of 2 people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that this group requests a loan from ALIDÉ, in order to increase their business. The group representative, Sabira Aurore, is the one raising her hand on the picture. She is 32 and lives in Bénin. Sabira Aurore quit school at the primary level. She is married to a man named Pierrot. They care for their 2 children, who both go to school. They both take care of the family financially. To meet the financial needs of her family, Sabira Aurore has been selling miscellaneous items (pasta, etc.) at home for about 15 years. She buys those items in a market in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Sabira Aurore, along with the other member of ENAGNON, is applying for this first loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items (pasta, etc.)

loans.name: Wondoima Group-I

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Wondoima” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sia. Sia is 33. She was born in Wordu (Sandor), in eastern Sierra Leone. Her husband is a trader and her two children are attending primary school. 

Sia sells clothes, bed sheets, towels, toothpaste, soap, etc. She has been doing this business for four years now. With the help of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edward, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy clothes, bed sheets, towels, toothpaste, soap, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Fuamoli

texts.en:
Fuamoli is thirty-seven years of age and is married with four children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling soft drinks in the local community.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.  Fuamoli needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve the business.

In 2010, Fuamoli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Fuamoli's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar and cordials to produce products for sale.

loans.name: Julia Ester

texts.en:
I have had a small grocery store for five years. I ahve a good cutomer base in my neighborhood because my clients like the quality products I offer them. My store is by the exit form Danli. Commuters pass through my store to buy supplies. I have been able to improve my house and educate my children with the profits.

Loan Use: Purchase of chicken, milk products, softdrinks and other products

Hola me llamo Julia, y me dedico a vender productos de consumo popular, tengo una pequeña pulperia desde hace 5 años, tengo muy buena clientela en mi colonia ya que mis clientes prefieren la calidad de producto que les ofrezco. Mi pulperia esta en la terminal de la salida de Danli, por lo que muchas personas que viajan a diario a caserios u otras aldeas pasan por mi negocio comprando su provision. Gracias a las ganancias he podido hacerle mejoras a mi casa y ayudar a mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de pollo, lacteos, refrescos, embutidos y otros

loans.name: Ramziyya

texts.en: Ramziyya is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Jabrail region, settled in Sumgait city. She has 2 children. This 23-year-old woman has been engaged in her business for 2 years. Ramziyya sells women’s clothes. She supports her family with this business. Now Ramziyya needs a loan amount of $1100 to be busy with selling the clothing.

loans.use: To be busy with selling clothing

loans.name: Joseph  Isaac

texts.en: Joseph is married with two children, one in primary school and the other still at home. He finished his secondary school successfully and wishes to join college in two years. He started his business in 2005 in order to sustain his family. His business includes buying cereals from farmers and selling them at the local markets during market days. Through his business, he has been able to help his parents pay school fees for his younger brothers. He is requesting a loan from PEMCI so he can increase his cereals stock during this harvest season and improve his income.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en: For Sanobar, who has secondary education, there is no permanent source of income, as she does not work anywhere. She is 31, is married and has 2 children. Her husband went to Russia for work. She has been engaged in small business for several years already. It enables her to feed her family. Her assortment of wares includes footwear for children and teenagers. She came to MicroInvest 2 years ago and having received the first loan, has spent it on increasing the quantity of the goods she sells. At present she wishes to receive the loan for future expansion of her business. Sanobar would now like to sell more expensive and high quality summer footwear.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en: Gibrilla T. is a father of two children. He runs a small store selling soft drinks, water, and other essential items.  He used to take the goods on credit and could hardly make a profit.  With his previous loan, Gibrilla said he has been able to stand on his own capital.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $200 to continue building his capital base.

loans.use: Increasing his capital base to ensure larger profits.

loans.name: Elisabete

texts.pt:
Location: Chali neighborhood – Catembe-Maputo
Client: Elisabete P.
Activity: Retail
Loan amount: 20,000.00 Mozambique Meticais (MT) (US$ 800)
Use: Purchase essential products
Start date: 10/08/07
End date: 01/30/09

Elisabete Paço, 36 years of age, was born in Filipe-Catembe on January 15, 1971. She is married and attended school until the 4th grade. She supports five people and lives with 4. She lived the greater part of her childhood with her mother and attended school at the Chiango Educational Center. In her free time, she would help her mother chop wood for resale. In 1990, she married and moved to the Costa do Sol neighborhood, later migrating to Filipe, Matutuine district. Together with her husband she entered the retail business and also performed some agricultural work. Due to difficulties with her children’s schooling, she decided to move to Catembe where she currently lives.

She operates her retail business from her backyard and has been active for 20 years. Her husband is trained in business administration. They have no employees as they are able to run the business themselves without assistance. With the current loan of 20,000 MT she plans to purchase rice, sugar and corn starch in 50 and 25 kg bags, respectively, as well as other grocery products. The store's opening hours are from 6:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. She purchases goods in Maputo and rents a car to transport them. The business does not enjoy any peak periods; however, during weekends demand is higher. Her daily revenue is 3,000 MT. The most lucrative products are rice, sugar and oil. She keeps a log where she records receipts and sales as well existing stock. Her main constraint is the lack of transportation and conventional installations.

Her monthly profit margin is 12,000 MT, which she uses to support the family, improve the shop and put her kids through school. In the future, she plans to build a conventional store, own a form of transportation and if possible set up a hardware store. This may require an additional loan once the current one has been repaid. The client is very happy with the loan as it has helped her increase her sales volume and diversify her product range.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chali, Catembe-Maputo Cliente: Elisabete P. Actividade:Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 20.000,00 MT (800.00US$) Aplicacao: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade Início: 08/10/07 Fim: 30/01/09 Elisabete Paço de 36 anos de idade, nasceu em Filipe-Catembe aos 15 de Janeiro de 1971, casada maritalmente, estudou até 4ªclasse, sustenta 5 pessoas e vive com apenas 4. Viveu grande parte de sua infância com a mãe e estudava no Centro educacional de Chiango e nos tempos livres ajudava a mãe no corte de lenha para posterior venda, assim em 1990 casa-se e passa a viver no bairro Costa do Sol e mais tarde emigram para Filipe – distrito de Matutuine e juntamenete com o marido abraçam o comércio a retalho e também fazia alguns trabalhos agrícolas. Devido a dificuldades na continuidade dos estudos das crianças decide mudar-se para Catembe onde vive actualmente. Excerce a actividade de comércio a retalho no seu quintal e desenvolve-a a 20 anos e o marido é que tem formação de Gestão comercial, não empregam nenhum trabalhador dado que eles mesmos é que gerem o negócio. Com o presente crédito de 20.000MT pretende comprar arroz,açúcar,farrinha de milho em sacos de 50 e 25 Kgs respectivamente e outros produtos de mercearia. A abertura da mercearia é as 6:30 e encerra as 18:30mn e compra-os em Maputo e para transportá-los aluga um carro. O negócio não tem épocas no entanto aos fins de semana a procura é maior, e receita diária é de 3.000MT, os produtos que dão maior lucro são Arroz, açúcar e Óleo .Tem um livro de registo de entradas e vendas de produtos bem como do stock existente. O maior constragimento é falta de transporte e falta de instalações convencionais. A margem de lucro mensal é de 12.000MT e com os rendimentos usa-os para sustento familiar, melhorar a mercearia e por as crianças a estudar. No futuro a perspectiva é construir uma loja convencional, ter transporte e se possível montar uma ferragem e para o efeito poderá preciasr de outro empréstimo assim que terminar o presente empréstimo. A cliente está bastante feliz com o empréstimo pois ajudou a aumentar o volume de negócio e diversificar ainda mais outros produtos.

loans.use: Increase stock in her business

loans.name: Israfil

texts.en: Israfil has lived in Saatli for his entire life. He is 45 years old, married and has 4 children. He is the owner of a small farm and sells dairy products and calves for meat production to the local bazaar traders. He started his business in 1997 when he borrowed money from Aqroinvest CU, and he established a reputation as a punctual and honest person. Now his next step for successful business continuation is to apply for 1200 USD loan to purchase four calves each for 300 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves

loans.name: Sanober

texts.en:
Sanober B. lives in the second largest city of Pakistan, Lahore. She has three daughters and two sons. Her eldest daughter has finished tenth grade and is now married. Her eldest son works with his father in a tiles and marble factory. Her other children, except for the youngest son, have dropped out of school due to high education costs, while Sanober's youngest son is currently too sick to attend school, but will hopefully be able to continue. 

Recently, Sanober has been busy preparing for her eldest daughter’s wedding, but now that the wedding is over, she has time to re-start her business in making traditional textiles. Sanober needs a loan of US$250 to purchase raw materials, including cloth and thread. In addition, she will use some of the money to pay wages to the workers who she has hired from the community, including dyers and designers. Sanober's two daughters who live with her also design and embroider clothes. She then sells these traditional clothes in Lahore and other surrounding cities with the help of her son-in-law. Sanober is very hopeful that she will receive the loan and be able to re-start her business.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth and thread

loans.name: Iin

texts.en: Iin, 27, is the mother of 3 children ages10, 7 and 1. She sells kitchen wares such as glassess, plates, rice cookers, etc. on credit door-to-door around the villages, earning $10 a week. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of $100 to add to her inventory .  She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her inventory

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
Maria Ofelia always liked sales and interacting with people, so she took advantage of her popularity in the neighborhood and opened a small general store in her home. The store is now recognized by many people in the neighborhood, and because of this, she would like to keep growing, and with the increase in profits, improve her and her family's quality of life.

However, currently Maria Ofelia does not have enough merchandise to offer to her customers. This is why she is requesting a loan for US $250, which she is willing to pay in a period of 3 months. With this money Maria Ofelia will be able to buy more merchandise so that her customers can always find what they are looking for. With your help Maria Ofelia will be able to establish her business more solidly, and in this way help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

María Ofelia, siempre le gustaron las ventas y el trato con L. gente y aprovechó que era conocida en L. colonia, y con un ahorro abrió una tiendita D. abarrotes en su casa, que hoy ya esta reconocida por mucha gente D. L. colonia, por ello quiere seguir creciendo y con las ganancias mejorar su calidad D. vida y L. D. su familia.

Sin embargo actualmente María Ofelia no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito D. US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo D. 3 meses y con este dinero María Ofelia podrá comprar más mercancía para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan. Con tu ayuda María Ofelia logrará establecer mejor su negocio para así apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancía)

loans.name: Celio

texts.pt:
Celio M. was born in August, 1981 in the Magude district and grew up with his parents. When he was 2 years old his father, who worked for the Ministry of Health, was transferred to the Namaacha district Hospital which meant his whole family had to move. He began his education in 1988 at a local school and finished 12th grade in 2005. The following year his father informed him that he was financially unable to continue with the cost of his college studies now that he was also paying for school for his younger siblings. His father had retired.

It was in this situation that Celio decided to begin producing income raising chickens. He got experience from the other operators that do the same thing. With HLUVUKU beginning operations in 2007 he submitted a request for financing to purchase chickens to enlarge his business. He says that he had success and that is the reason he is submitting a second loan request for 25,000MT for the same purpose. He intends to increase his business and hire 3 people to care for the business while he resumes his studies at a university in the Capital of the country (Maputo) that is located 72 km from the town of Namaacha.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Celio M., Nasceu em agosto de 1981 no distrito de Magude e cresceu na companhia dos pais. Com os seus dois anos, o pai que trabalhava para Ministerio da Saude foi transferido para o hospital distrital de Namaacha tendo significado mudança de residençia para toda familia. Iniciou os estudos no ano de 1988 na Escola local e concluiu a 12ª- classe no ano de 2005 No ano seguinte o pai informa lhe da indisponibilidade financeira para contiuar a custeiar os seus estudos no nivel superior, uma vez que tambem estava a pagar escola para os filhos mais novos. O pai ja encontrava se reformado.

Foi perante esta situaçao que o celio decidiu iniciar a pratica de actividade de rendimento, fazendo avicultura. Buscou experiencia nos outros operadores que fazem a mesma actividade. Com a entrada da HLUVUKU a operar, em 2007, submeteu um pedido de financiamento para compra de pintos para ampliar o seu negocio. Diz que tem tido sucesso, razao pelo qual submete o seu segundo emprestimo no valor de 25.000 meticais com o mesmo proposito. Tem como perspectiva, ampliar a sua actividade de forma a empregar 3 pessoas para cuidarem do negocio enquanto ele retoma os estudos numa das universidades da cidade capital do pais (Maputo) que dista se 72 km da vila de Namaacha.

loans.use: to raise chickens

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is married and has two children, ages 16 and 15. Digna earns income selling used clothing and milk; she started her own business in 2007. Every day, she works from 7 am to 6 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$40 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of second-hand clothing for sale

loans.name: Grace Ddamba’S Group

texts.en:
Grace D. is a 30-year-old married mother of five children. She has been a member of MCDT for the past four years. For the past eight years, she has run a shop where she sells sodas and juice, with sodas being the best sellers. Passion fruit juice is also popular. In her shop, she has two refrigerators so people can buy cold sodas.

Grace and her group have received multiple loans in the past, which she says have helped her keep her children consistently in school. With a new loan, she will be able to add on to her business. Currently, at the end of the day, she is sold out. With a loan, she will be able to keep more beverages in stock so she can sell more drinks each day and make the business more profitable.

Ultimately, her goals are to build a house and to help her children go on to university. In the meantime, the loan helps her to take care of all her day-to-day needs.

loans.use: To increase beverages in stock to sell

loans.name: Teresa Del Pilar

texts.es:
Teresa Del Pilar C. M. es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada”, lives in the Departament of San Martín, province de San Martín, District de Tarapoto. She sells beauty products (ESIKA, AVON, UNIQUE), and her customers are friends who in turn recommend other customers to her. Her customer base is always growing. Teresa studied to be a secretary, but since she was a child, she has always had a head for business. She started by selling clothing, and two years ago became a beauty consultant. She is enjoying the experience of selling by order and now has a steady customer base. With the loan of 1000.00 Peruvian Soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy various items such as perfumes, talc, creams, shampoos, soaps, cosmetics, deodorant, and other products. In addition, she will buy jewelry items such as earrings, chains, bracelets, and rings, in order to keep them in stock, vary her selection, and satisfy the tastes and demands of her customers.
