Teresa is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children. She has the desire to move forward and explore new paths, and would like to have a well-equipped business.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Teresa Del Pilar C. M. es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza (ESIKA, AVON, UNIQUE), sus clientas son sus amigas quienes le recomiendas a otras personas así va creciendo su numero de clientes. Teresa estudió Secretariado Ejecutivo pero desde pequeña se inclinó mas por el negocio, ella se inicio vendiendo ropas, pero hace 2 años es consultora de Belleza, la experiencia le agrado mucho, y vende a través de pedidos, actualmente ya tiene cliente fijos y conocidos. Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1000.00 que será devuelto en 6 meses, compró diversos artículos como perfumes, talcos, cremas, champús, jabones, maquillajes, desodorante y otros productos más, también comprará artículos de bijouteria como aretes, cadenas, pulseras, anillos de diferentes modelos, para tener en stock y variar sus productos y poder satisfacer los gustos y exigencias de sus clientes. Teresa es una mujer joven de 33 años vive con su esposo y sus 03 menores hijos, con ganas de salir delante y emprender nuevos caminos, anhela tener un negocio de abarrotes bien surtido.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty items and jewelry.

loans.name: Fridah's Rehema Group

texts.en:
Fridah is a 37-year-old widow with two children, ages 10 and 17. She owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2007. She works from 8AM to 11PM and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Fridah has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more crates of beer and soda for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with fish sales, food sales, grocery stores and vegetable sales.

loans.use: To more crates of beer and soda to increase sales

loans.name: Mujeres Para El Futuro Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras del barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de Caacupé, que en su mayoría se dedican a la elaboración y venta de chipas, actualmente el grupo ya está en su 7 ciclo del programa comité de mujeres y sus inicios y su conformación se debió a la gran colaboración que brindo la señora Teresa Martínez, quien inicialmente fue la coordinadora del grupo y en su domicilio se realizó las primeras reuniones del comité.

Todas son vecinas del barrio, y una de las virtudes de este comité el buen cumplimiento de las normas y reglamento del programa de comité de mujeres emprendoras, y esta demostrado por su buen cumplimiento en el pago de sus cuotas, además poseen un ahorro gracias a las actividades que realizan cada fin de semana como ser feria de comidas, rifas, torneos deportivos, entre otras actividades.

Todas las integrantes reciben un promedio de gs. 833.000 y lo invierten para la producción de sus productos descriptos más arriba. Todas tienen actividades que desarrollan para aumentar el ingreso de sus hogares, además de ser amas de casa. Entra esas actividades tenemos vendedoras de chipas que es la actividad más popular de este comité ya que 11 de las integrantes se dedican a la venta de esta comida típica muy consumida en nuestro país. Dos de ellas poseen despensas y las dos últimas se dedican a la venta de ropas.

El comité tiene como objetivo este mes de Agosto la de juntar a todos los niños de la cuadra y el día del niño ofrecerle una chocolatada, incluidos algunos juegos infantiles.
texts.en:
The committee is comprised of 15 female workers from the town of San Francisco in the city of Caacupe. They are mainly dedicated to the making of Chipas, a local dish of the country. The group is actually in the their seventh cycle of the this program, with its beginning and organization mainly attributed to the work of Mrs. Teresa M., who initially was the coordinator of the group, and in her home organized the very first group meetings. All are neighbors in this area, and one of the virtues of the committee is to carry on tradition by organizing committee programs. This is demonstrated by their routinely successful repayment rate of their loans. On top of that, they have been able to save thanks to the activities that they hold every weekend offering food, raffles, games, and more. All of the members receive a portion of 833,000 guarani (aprox $200usd), and they invest it into the activities previously mentioned. They all have specific activities that they develop in order to increase their profits, in addition to being homemakers. Among the things that they partake in doing is to be Chipas vendors, which is the most popular activity since 11 of the member partake in the sale of this very popular national dish. Two of them have small stores, and the last two sell clothing. The committee’s objective in the month of August is to gather all of the children from the neighborhood together for Children’s Day and have a fair for them with games and entertainment.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of raw materials to make Chipas like, starch, cheese, and vegetable oil.  Others will buy cloths like shorts, shirts, and socks to sell.

loans.name: Khadija's Tusaidiane Group

texts.en:
Khadija, 22, is widow with two children, ages 3 and 5. She has been selling potatoes, tomatoes, and onions since January 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Khadija is looking for a loan to buy more tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwanakhamis and Tumu.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Melania Patricia

texts.es:
El nombre del cliente es Melania  Patricia V. P. su edad es de 48 años de edad su estado civil es casada no tiene hijos, su compañero de vida labora como transportista,
Los deseos que tiene son lograr acondicionar su casa para poder vivir un poco mejor debido a los diferentes gastos para poder costear las compras de materiales y con esto podría mejorar en  darle mejoras a su casa, ya que ella trabaja para poder, otras de las cosas es poder aportar alguna ayuda a algunos familiares.


El tiempo que ella posee de tener el negocio es de 17 años ella es modista, costurera 
La forma en como empezó su negocio fue en la búsqueda de un negocio donde ella podría defenderse para mantenerse a ella y a su familia con la intención de trabajar para ayudar de alguna u otra forma para ayudar en los diferentes gastos de la casa el trabajo de costurera le gustaba y para ayudarse compraba ropa para vender así presentaría su producto al publico en general, el crédito lo utilizara para el capital de trabajo como lo es la compra de una variedad de tela  para lograr su propósito ella cuenta con  dos maquinas de coser una que es eléctrica y la otra que es de pedal. El financiamiento que esta solicitando es para adquirir materia prima relacionado con  su pequeño taller de costura, ya que tiene clientes fijos a quienes les entrega trajes de niños, camisas escolares y al no tener suficiente capital de trabajo requiere del apoyo de los créditos para  poder cumplir con su demanda, esperando contar con el apoyo nuestro para lograr su objetivo y satisfacer su demanda.
texts.en:
The client’s name is Melania Patricia V. P.. She is 48 years of age. She is married and does not have children. Her life partner works as a transportation provider. She wants to be able improve her house to live a little bit better. Since she has many different expenses, to be able to purchase materials, she needs this loan which will allow her to make improvements to her house. She works to be able to do this and to do other things including being able to help some of her relatives.

She has been in her business for 17 years. She is a dressmaker and seamstress. She started her business when looking for something where she would be able to support herself and her family. Her goal in working was to take care of herself and to help in one way or another with the different household expenses. She enjoys working as a seamstress and to help purchase clothing to sell. This is how she presents her products to the public. She will use the loan as capital for her work to purchase a variety of fabrics to succeed in her goal. She has two sewing machines, one is electric and the other is manual. The financing she is asking for is to acquire raw material for her small dressmaking shop. Now she has established clients for whom she makes suits for children and school tops. She needs loans to be able to satisfy demand because she does not have enough capital. She is hoping to count on our support to be able to met her goals and satisfy demand.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Gulru

texts.ru:
Назарова Гулру Пиримшоевна, 1974 года рождения, замужем и у них 2 детей. Начала свой бизнес с продажи кондитерских изделий. Со временем она перешла в продажу различных тканей. Сейчас в ассортименте ее товаров постельное белье, мужские свитера, женские пуловеры, детские зимние одежды, а также зимние носки. В бизнесе ей помогает дочка. Они вместе торгуют в отдаленных районах. Они возят товар прямо им домой, это куда выгоднее покупателям, чем тратить на дорогу. У нее 8 лет опыта в этой деятельности. Она покупает товар на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. У Гулру есть постоянные клиенты, которые заказывают все новые товары, она постоянно обновляет свой товар, чтоб не потерять постоянных клиентов. 
Гулру хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 1100 сомони чтоб закупить зимние товары.
texts.en:
Born in 1974, Gulru N. is married and has two children. She started her business by selling confectionery products and then transitioned into various fabrics sales. Her current goods assortment includes bedding, men’s sweaters, women’s pullovers, children’s winter clothes and winter socks. Gulru’s daughter helps her with the business. They travel together extensively to make sales and deliver products directly to customers’ homes. Gulru has 8 years of experience in this business. She purchases goods at the Korvon wholesale market in Dushanbe. She has repeat clients who order new products from her, thus she has to often update her inventory in order to retain her clients. With the help of the Kiva program, Gulru wants to obtain a $325 loan in order to buy winter goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase winter socks

loans.name: Anie

texts.es: Anie tiene 37 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Tiene un local de recreo turístico, donde brinda  platos típicos y vende bebidas a las personas que vienen a pasar un momento grato por la zona, esta actividad la viene realizando por más de 5 años, y le va muy bien. Dentro de su actividad, le agrada atender a las personas de la mejor manera posible, siendo muy amable, lo cual no es difícil para una persona tan sencilla y acogedora como Anie. La venta de  bebidas y platos típicos es rentable, ya que los precios son elevados, pero de mayor consumo, por el lugar turístico donde está situada. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Anie  tiene pensado invertir en la compra de vitrinas para exhibir los deliciosos  platos y bebidas que ofrece.
texts.en:
Anie is a 37-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 3 children. She has a small restaurant in which she sells traditional food and drinks to tourists who come to spend a pleasant time in the area. She has been in business for over 5 years, and has prospered. In her business, it pleases her to serve her patrons in the best possible way, being very pleasant, which is not difficult for such an unassuming and welcoming person like Anie. Her beverage and food business is very lucrative because prices are high due to the tourist area in which the business is located. This is her first loan with MFP. Anie plans on investing the loan in purchasing a food display case for the delicious meals and drinks that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food display case

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena I., 54, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in making handicrafts. She sells to the hotels and gift shops 6 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Filomena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase tools for carving

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Juana es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Juana tiene una tienda en una casa alquilada, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos en sus ratos libres.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, fideos, arroz.
Los sueños de Juana son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocios, tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the town bank Lila. Juana lives with a common law partner, is 39 years old, and has five children. Juana has a store in a rented house where she sells groceries, vegetables, and fruits. She does this with the help of her children when they have free time. Juana needs a loan of 800 soles that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, noodles, and rice. Juana's dreams are for her children to be professionals and to expand their businesses and have their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, noodles and rice.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola A. is 62 years old, married, and has 8 children. A. provides laundry services. He requests a loan of $350 (50,000 NGN) to purchase more laundry supplies to effectively provide his laundry services. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase laundry supplies

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi W. est un jeune homme de 34 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Womé. Il exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans, mais avec une moto dont il n’est pas le propriétaire. Avec ce crédit, Kossi espère acheter sa propre moto. Ceci lui permettra de mieux épargner pour répondre aux aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossi W., age 34, is married and the father of one child. He's a motorcycle taxi driver in Womé. He has been running this business for 3 years, but with a motorcycle that he doesn't own. With this loan, Kossi hopes to buy his own motorcycle. This will enable him to improve his saving, in order to support his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy his own motorcycle

loans.name: Nafissatou

texts.fr: Nafissatou Dramé 45 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Face Néma depuis 2 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des tissus teintés et des bijoux (chaînes plaqués). Elle veut  renforcer son commerce pour mieux participer aux charges familiales. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Nafissatou Dramé, 45, is married and raising 5 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Face Néma for two and a half years. Her business consists in buying and re-selling dyed cloth and costume jewelry (gold-plated chains). She wants to bolster her business so as to participate better in covering family expenses. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of dyed cloth and jewelry for re-sale

loans.name: Khursanoy

texts.en:
E. Khursanoy is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Seven years ago she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available on their land for this business.

Khursanoy is engaged in this business together with her adult children. Slowly the number of cows increased and at the same time, her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan. Be an important part of the growth of Khursanoy’s business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr.: ELEUTERIO, el vive en el barrio mateo pumacahua, a 20 minutos de la plaza principal de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 39 años, es soltero y es socio antigua de la institución, el trabaja con este medio de los bancos comunales hace ya 9 años, el socio, alterna sus actividades con la artesanía, el hace con sus manos todo tipo de vasijas, utensilios para el hogar, ceniceros, adornos, floreros todo en arcilla, para lo cual el socio solicita el préstamo para poder implementar su mercadería y comprar la materia prima.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda.
texts.en:
Eleuterio lives in the Mateo Pumacahua neighborhood, which is twenty minutes from the principal plaza in the city of Cusco. He is 39 and single. He has been a member of the institution for a long time. He has worked with community banks for nine years. He alternates his handicraft activities. With his hands he makes all types of vessels, utensils for the home, ashtrays, decorations, and clay vases. He is asking for a loan to be able to buy raw materials to make his merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials for his handicrafts

loans.name: Jhanet Rosa

texts.es:
Jhanet es socia del Banco Comunal Rosas.
Jhanet es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Jhanet vende cosméticos por catálogos, sus ventas son al crédito y ofrece a amigos y familiares. Jhanet estudia educación inicial en un instituto.
Jhanet necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos.
Los sueños de Jhanet son tener una casa, local propio y que su hijo estudie.
texts.en:
Jhanet is a member of the communal bank, "Rosas" (Roses). She is married, is 23, and has 1 son. Jhanet sells cosmetics by catalog. She makes her sales on credit to friends and family members. Jhanet is studying early education at a school. She needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of cosmetics. Jhanet's dreams are to have her own home, her own location for her store, and for her son to go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel tiene 35 años, es un hombre muy noble y amoroso; está felizmente casado con la madre de sus hijos, quienes son el motivo de sus desvelos. Cuando era soltero era muy buen hijo y hermano, ahora que formó su propia familia lucha cada día en sus tierras de cultivo por brindarles una vida feliz. Con las ganancias que ha obtenido de sus cosechas logró comprar un motocarro, con el cual también se dedica a sacar la carga de productos de las chacras más lejanas donde no hay acceso de movilidad. Desde entonces a cada solicitud de sus servicios acude inmediatamente, porque de ese modo acumula ingresos adicionales para sus cultivo, por lo que se propone en seguir trabajando así sin descuidar sus propias siembras, a las que les tiene mucho cariño. Durante los 4 créditos consecutivos demostró puntualidad en cada uno de sus pagos y del mismo modo se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su banco comunal, por lo que en cada una de las reuniones actúa con mucha sobriedad, guardando el orden de los demás integrantes. El dinero que ahora solicita planea invertirlo en la compra de repuestos para su moto y fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years old. He is a very noble and lovely man. He's happily married to the mother of his children, who are the reason for his efforts. When he was single, he was a very good son and brother. Now that he had a family of his own, he works hard daily on his arable land to give them a happy life. With the earnings he made from his crops, he purchased a motorized rickshaw, which he also uses to transport products from the outlying farms where there is no access to vehicles. Ever since, he has attended immediately to every request for his service because by doing this he earns more income for his farm. And so, he continues working like this, without neglecting to care well for his own crops. Throughout the four consecutive loans that he has had, he has demonstrated punctuality in making each one of the payments, and in the same way, he's continued to fulfill his duties to his communal bank. At each of the bank's meetings, he's been very serious, maintaining order among all the members. He is now requesting money to purchase replacement (parts) for his rickshaw and chemical fertilizers for his coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts for his rickshaw and fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Lem

texts.en:
Lem K., 29, is a Chinese interpreter for a garment factory, Blossom, run by a Chinese guy in Cambodia. He has an income of US$5 per day. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. His wife stays at home and has been involved in the business of raising pigs since 1979 with an income of around US$1.6.

Seeing the chance that he is able to sell pigs with a fairly profitable price, he wants to take a loan of US$600 to buy more pigs for his wife to raise and sell them back at the right time when the price of the pigs goes up. If he succeeds with his business plan, he really wants to use his savings to build a house made from bricks.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace D. is a single parent and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Grace has a small boutique where she sells shoes, panties and clothing at Abura, which she has done since 2002. Grace uses her income to pay house-keeping expenses. Grace will use the loan to buy more shoes, panties and clothing. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to save and re-invest.

loans.use: Grace will use the loan to buy shoes, panties and clothing.

loans.name: Yaoitcha

texts.fr:
Yaoitcha is married and has four children.  She lives with her husband in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin.  Yaoitcha sells fish and charcoal.  She started selling fish when she was younger because her mother also sold fish.  Yaoitcha buys her fish from venders in Porto-Novo markets and her charcoal from a man who delivers it to her home.  She decided to start selling charcoal because of its high demand for cooking and heating.  Yaoitcha sells her products to people in the neighborhood.  

Yaoitcha is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin, in order to increase her sales.  She would like to replenish her supplies of fish and charcoal, which are running low.  In the future, with more financial support, Yaoitcha hopes to expand the variety of goods that she sells.
texts.en:
Yaoitcha is married and has four children. She lives with her husband in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin. Yaoitcha sells fish and charcoal. She started selling fish when she was younger because her mother also sold fish. Yaoitcha buys her fish from vendors in Porto-Novo markets and her charcoal from a man who delivers it to her home. She decided to start selling charcoal because of its high demand for cooking and heating. Yaoitcha sells her products to people in the neighborhood. Yaoitcha is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin, in order to increase her sales. She would like to replenish her supplies of fish and charcoal, which are running low. In the future, with more financial support, Yaoitcha hopes to expand the variety of goods that she sells.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and fish

loans.name: Monh's Group

texts.en:
C., 20, has been married to Bunran, 29, for years and has a child who is still young and attends school. C.'s family lives along the Mekong river and C. earns a living selling fish caught by her husband. She is taking a loan to renovate parts of her house.

C. is the leader of this group which consists of five members including her. The other members are:

L., 62, who is also a fish seller and sells next to her house.

T., 42, who is a fisherman along the Mekong river.

H., 56, who is a middleman buying fish in bulk from the fishermen and then selling the fish in bulk to the retail sellers in the market.

T., 27, who owns a small place for selling fish in the market.

loans.use: To renovate parts of her house

loans.name: Aneth

texts.en:
Aneth is a member of the Ikuti borrower group in Nzonwe, Mbeya, she is 45 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 18 and 16  years  old.

Aneth has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 10 years, she works 8 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Aneth`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the the amount of 200,000 Tsh  in order to buy more clothes fro sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Aneth hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more  clothes

loans.name: Tuyana

texts.en:
Tuyana is single. She lives with her mother and helps her as her Mom is retired and has some health issues. They live in Berdyansk which is a resort town in the south of Ukraine. Tuyana runs a small enterprise selling women’s clothing, bijouterie, scarves, socks, leggings, etc. in the central market of her home town. She has been in this trade for 15 years and has gained much experience working in this sphere of business. Presently, Tuyana has about 18,000 Grivnyas in working capital. Her income amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Tuyana is seeking a loan of 8,700 Grivnyas to diversify assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her vending kiosk. She is hoping to use additional funding to grow and expand her trade and her income as a result. Tuyana is an entrepreneur of integrity. Her professional management skills and friendly customer service have ensured her business a stable standing in this market niche.

loans.use: to increase assorted merchandise and turnover capital

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor D. Locumba” del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 57 años D. edad, estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Tanapaca, ella pudo seguir estudios superiores incompletos.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos mas D. 2 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. artesanías.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar bisutería y cosméticos por pedido.

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda D. venta D. cosméticos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor D. Locumba”, which is located in the District of Yunguyo, Yunguyo Province, Department of Puno. She is 57 years old, married, and has 4 children. Margarita lives in the community of Tanapaca. She was able to pursue a higher education, but did not finish.

Margarita has been working with Manuela Ramos for more than 2 years. Her first loan in the amount of 300 soles provided additional capital for her handicraft business. She is now requesting a new loan of 2000 soles to purchase costume jewelry and cosmetics that she will sell by order.

Margarita hopes to open a cosmetics store. She enjoys her savings and the simplicity of her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & costume jewelry

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 45 years old and living in Larion Alto, Tuguegarao, City. She is married and they were gifted with two children.  

Fe is engaged in a meat-retailing business, while her husband is working as a carpenter in their village. Together they are helping one another in providing the needs of their family.  

Fe wants her business to improve, and this is why she is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 from the Kiva lenders. She plans to buy kilos of pork and other commodities that she can offer to her customers. She is hoping that her business will continue to improve through the help of the lenders.

loans.use: To buy kilos of pork and other commodities to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, a 55-year-old businesswoman, is married to Marcelino, who manages their farm lot in their village. They have three children, all married and living separately from them. She hopes and prays that they will remain healthy and strong to be able to provide for the needs of their own families.

Rebecca, who raises hogs, wants to grow her business by purchasing additional piglets to raise and so is requesting a loan of PHP6,000 from Kiva lenders. In addition to hog raising, Rebecca sells vegetables in their village, her income from this being used for the basic needs of their family. She hopes to expand both businesses to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents and their 3 children. He has owned a cell phone shop since 2007 to earn money to help satisfy the needs of his family and supplement his father's income. Today, Mohamad is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy more merchandise and enlarge his shop to meet the requirement of his clients and make money for his family.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Melita

texts.es:
Melita es una mujer emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 22 años y es soltera.
Melita se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, actividad que realiza desde su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas” desde hace un año, tiempo que sus ventas han mejorado.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò golosinas, negocio que por el momento ha dejado.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà prendas de vestir para posteriormente venderlas a sus clientes y amistades. 
La meta de Melita es tener una tienda de prendas de vestir y artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Melita is an enterprising woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 22 years old and single. Melita sells clothing from her home. She has been a member of “Las Tigresas” Communal Bank for one year and in that time has seen her sales improve. She invested her first loan for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles in the purchase of sweets, a business she is no longer pursuing. She is currently requesting a loan for 800 nuevos soles to purchase clothing to sell to customers and friends. Melita's dream is to have a clothing and household items store.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Adelina's Group

texts.en:
Adelina L. is from the village of Bayabo East,Tumauini,Isabela. She is 46 years old and the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by the KIVA field partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Adelina L. group.

Adelina is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Adelina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Adelina has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2004, Adelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Adelina has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Adelina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 10th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shirendev

texts.en: Shirendev T. is 53 years old and lives with his wife and 2 adult sons, aged 24 and 21. His oldest son, Ulziibayar, helps operate the family business and his younger son, Sandagdorj, is a student at the Economics Institute. Shirendev has an underground well in his soum (county) and provides 50% of the soum residents with clean water. Shirendev started his business in 2002 and since then has continually earned more customers because his well is known for its pure, clean water. He is a very hard-working person and his dream is to renovate the well and build a bathhouse for the soum residents in order to increase his family's income and help the soum residents improve their sanitary conditions and health. He is requesting a 400,000 tugrug loan to purchase a water pump that will enable him to increase the water output amount from the well.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten is a 29-year-old, married woman with one child. She has been working as a private teacher in her town since 2002. She really likes her occupation because, as she said, it allows her to help the students of the region to obtain a good education. Today, Faten is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a desk, bookcase and a computer that will improve her work.

loans.use: to buy a desk, bookcase and a computer

loans.name: Artesanas De Narancay (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Artesanas de Narancay está localizado  en la ciudad de Cuenca en la parroquia Baños siendo reconocida por sus aguas termales, los bosques protegidos, los paisajes naturales únicos que son considerados atractivos turísticos.

Las integrantes del banco  son mujeres  luchadoras que no se detienen a pesar de los inconvenientes que se presentan en el día a día  y salen victoriosas junto a sus familias y siempre están dispuestas a regalarnos una sonrisa y a compartir sus historias.

La señora Zara Z. es socia de éste banco desde hace  apenas un ciclo, vive en  la comunidad del mismo nombre de su banco comunal junto a su esposo que labora como guardia de seguridad con quien procreó seis hijos que oscilan entre los 34 y 16 años, de ellos dos ya son casados y viven independientes sus otros hijos son solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente con los gastos del hogar, gracias al apoyo familiar han logrado cimentar su casa propia.

Zara  tiene 55 años se dedica  al cultivo de maíz, lechuga, zanahoria, cebolla, etc., esta actividad la realiza hace varios años y fue inculcada por su madre, todos sus productos los vende en la feria libre (mercado de Cuenca), con el crédito que reciba de la fundación va a comprar  semillas de maíz, plantas de lechuga, zanahoria, cebolla, etc. y una parte para comprar libros para su último hijo que aun está estudiando.

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sobresalgan en su vida profesional y familiar.

Al igual que Zara la señora Maura C. lleva un ciclo trabajando en su banco comunal, ella es una socia muy alegre  y nos comenta que su cuñada la invito a formar parte de este gran grupo y acceder a los beneficios que brinda la Fundación, nuestra amiga cuenta con 32 años, esposa cariñosa  y madre de dos niños de 10 y 8 años, realiza varias actividades  entre ellas vende productos cosméticos por catálogo de la línea Yanbal hace tres años, también  lava ropa ajena de sus vecinas  hace dos  años y por supuesto se dedica  a los quehaceres del hogar y cuidado de sus niños.

Maura nos comenta que su esposo migro al exterior hace siete años  en busca de mejores días para él y su familia pero no ha sido fácil, aún no tienen casa propia y viven  en casa de su hermana, con el dinero de su crédito  va a  comprar cremas, perfumes, labiales,  maquillajes entre otros productos de la línea  Yanbal,  teniendo como meta seguir incrementando  su negocio.
texts.en:
The community bank "Artesanas de Narancay" is located in the city of Cuenca in the parish of Baños, which is know for its hot springs, protected forests, and unique natural landscapes that are considered tourist attractions.

The members of the bank are strong willed women who are not held-back despite the difficulties that face them day to day. Together with their families, they move forward victoriously and are always ready to give us a smile and share their stories.

Zara has been a member of this bank for just one lending cycle. She lives in the community of the same name as her community bank together with her husband who works as a security guard. Together they have had six children who vary in age from 34 to 16. Two of these children are already married and live independently, the other single children work and help with the household expenses. Thanks to the family help they have been able to lay the foundations for their own home.

Zara is 55 years old and she works growing corn, lettuce, carrots, onions, etc. She has been doing this for some years and was taught by her mother. She sells all her products in the Cuenca market. With the loan she receives from the Foundation she will buy corn seed and seedlings of lettuce, carrots, onions, etc, and she will use part to buy books for her youngest son who is still in school.

Her greatest dream is that her children will stand out in their professional and family lives.

Just like Zara, Maura has been working with the community bank for one loan cycle. She is a very cheerful member and she told us that her sister-in-law invited her to be part of this great group and access the benefits offered by the Foundation. Our friend is 32 years old, an affectionate wife, and the mother of kids of 10 and 8 years old. She carries out various economic activities including selling cosmetics from the Yanbal catalog (which she has been doing for 3 years), also washing clothes for her neighbors (for two years), and, of course, caring for her home and her children.

Maura tells us that her husband moved abroad six years ago in search of better opportunities for him and his family, but that it hasn't been easy. They still do not have their own home and they live in her sister's house. With the money from her loan she will buy creams, perfumes, lipsticks, and makeup, along with other products from the Yanbal line. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn seed, seedlings of lettuce, onion, and carrot; also creams, makeup, perfumes, eyeshadow, lipsticks, etc.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
LA Sra. Catalina  anteriormente fue favorecida con la tasa preferencial, por lo que ella pudo invertir y pagar sus cuotas sin retraso, ella se dedica al hilado y tejido de mantas de lana de vicuña dese hace más de veinte años, ella compra generalmente la lana en la feria de R. que se realiza en la zona de El Alto cada año, razón por la cual ella  solicita el crédito con anticipación, las mantas reparte po la zona sur, ella vive con dos hijos menores, ya que el esposo viaja constantemente siendo ella la que mantiene a ellos, y tiene tambien que cuidar de un hijo enfermo, además de estos gastos ella paga puntualmente  sus pagos mensuales, ya que recupera de sus ventas mensualmente. Con el dinero del credito comprara lana por mayor para la realizacion de sus mantas.

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada por la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Catalina was previously granted a preferential rate which made it possible for her to invest and repay on time. She has woven and knit vicuña wool blankets for more than 20 years. She usually buys the wool in the R. fair that takes place in El Alto yearly. She needs funding ahead of time for this reason. She sells the blankets in the southern zone. She lives with her two youngest children because her husband travels constantly and it is she who supports them; she also must care for a sick child. Desite these expenses, she makes her monthly payments on time because she earns enough in her monthly sales to do so. She will use the funds to buy wool for her blankets at wholesale. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Yalama-Yalama Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Yalama-Yalama sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et  vivant dans des familles monogames à Noumousso, un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire.
Tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font la vente d’huile, de pagnes wax, de pommades cosmétiques et de la restauration.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 4 bidons d’huile de 20litres, 6 pièces de pagnes wax, 4 cartons de pommades cosmétiques, 1sac de 100kg de riz, 3 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 1sac de 75kg d’haricots. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent au marché, à domicile et de façon ambulante au comptant  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 30.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille,  l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités
texts.en:
The members of the group Yalama-Yalama are essentially married women averaging 40 years of age and five children each living in monogamous families in Noumousso, a district of Kadiolo City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers.  They are now on their fifth solidarity loan.  All the preceding loans have been repaid. The group members sell oil, wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and cosmetic ointments, and they work in food catering.  With their new loan, they intend to buy four 20-liter containers of oil, six bolts of pagnes, a 100-kg sack of rice, three packets of condiments, and a 75-kg sack of beans.  Supplies are gotten at the big market of Kadiolo City and from neighboring villages. Sales are made at the market, out of the home, and by going door-to-door.  Cash and often credit is accepted from customers composed of men and women.  The group members each envision making a monthly profit of 30,500 francs CFA.  A portion of the profits will be put into savings and used for family needs.  The other part will be invested in the businesses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various goods

loans.name: Savoen's Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people, who are all living in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province, make up this village bank loan. Each member will use the loan to support a different purpose.

Mrs. Savoen B. is the village bank president who has selected by the members. She sells clothes to support her family living. Her husband, Mr. Lay Now, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family.

In order to support her clothing business, Mrs. Savoen B. is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to enlarge her business. She is 36 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is married and has four children. She has been through senior high school.  Mary sells varieties of biscuits and sweets at Abura. Her husband is a mason.  Mary uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Mary will use the loan to purchase more biscuits and sweets for sale. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Mary plans to build a better shop for her business.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase more biscuits and sweets for sale

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah C. was born in 1962.  She is married to Kimaloi Kiptui who is a 58-year-old farmer. Her farm is in Kipsaraman- Koyoin in Kabernet, Kenya.  She has 7 children, and amongst them are Kipkoech (29  years; Information Technology Officer), Barnabas (28 years old; a banker), Lillian (23 years old; an O-level graduate, works in the judiciary), Samson (20 years old; a teacher), Enock (16 years old; in high school), and Jebet ( 8 years old; in Standard Four).

Florah is a fruit farmer.  She started this venture eighteen years ago. The orchard generates a monthly profit of Kshs 40,000. Florah’s customers are residents of Koyoin–Kipsaraman, Nakuru, and Nairobi. A community leader introduced her to KADET. 

 Florah has taken out a loan of Kshs 60,000. Out of this loan, Kshs 5,000 will be used to purchase insecticides; Kshs 10,000 to purchase fertilizers; Kshs 15,000 to purchase mango and orange seedlings ; Kshs 20,000 to plant maize and bean seeds. and Kshs 10,000 to pay for labor.  

If this loan boosts her business, Florah will use the extra profit to plant more fruit, trees, maize, millet and buy  a dairy cow. She dreams and hopes to be a large-scale farmer. Florah describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine P. is from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Catherine is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Catherine owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Catherine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Catherine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catherine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Catherine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn M. is from the village of Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Merilyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing, shoes and school products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Merilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Née en 1961, F. Bernadette vit depuis seize ans au quartier Zounga à Cocotomey dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Bernadette est mariée à AVOKPAHO Antoine et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Bernadette et Antoine ont deux autres enfants à leurs charge, en plus de leurs enfants. Bernadette vient en aide à son mari et assure avec son mari les différentes charges familiales. Bernadette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Bernadette mène comme activité, la vente de sacs de charbon de bois et de maïs à son domicile. C'est dans le nord du Bénin que Bernadette achète ses produits. Bernadette exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année et a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Bernadette désire accroître davantage son activité et gagner une grande part de marché à Cocotomey et environs, ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus de revenus. C'est pourquoi Bernadette sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1961, Bernadette F. has been living in the Zounga district of Cocotomey in the Abomey Calavi commune for the past sixteen years. She is married to Antoine Avokpaho and has two children, both in school. Bernadette and Antoine also care for two other children in addition to their own. Bernadette helps her husband to make sure the family is well taken care of. Bernadette has never been to school. Bernadette sells bags of charcoal and maize from her home in order to make enough money to take care of her needs. She buys her stock in the north of Benin. She has been doing this for about ten years and has already paid back two loans. Bernadette wants to expand her business and gain a bigger share of the market in Cocotomey and the surrounding areas, which will help her generate more income. This is why Bernadette is asking for a third loan.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 50 bags of charcoal and 50 bags of maize.

loans.name: Linda Rosa

texts.es:
la señora Linda Rosa E. G. tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Santos Pedro Mayorga Licona no tienen hijos que dependen de ellos, el esposo es albañil de construcion y Linda se dedica a la comercializacion de hamacas, utencilios de cocina, carnes, lacteos y gallinas. Linda vive en su casa solo con su esposo, tienen 32 años de vivir juntos. Sus hijos ya estan casados 

el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en dos fardos de ropa, compra de sandalias.
Linda es una persona muy amigable y luchadora que tiene todos los deseos de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Linda Rosa E. G. is 52 years old and married to Sr. Santos Pedro Mayorga Licona. They do not have any children who are still dependent on them. Her husband is a mason and works in construction. Linda sells hammocks, cooking utensils, meat, dairy products, and chickens. Linda and her husband live alone in their house and have been together for 32 years. Their children are already married.

This loan will be invested in two bundles of clothing and sandals. Linda is a friendly, yet determined person who has every desire to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase used clothing & sandals

loans.name: Everine

texts.en: Everine J. is an entrepreneur running a small business selling food to customers in Kigamboni ward, Dar es Salaam. She is a food vendor, preparing both cooked and fried food of different types, and selling soft drinks and "bites" to her customers. She purchases goods from foodstuff shops and the city market. She pays her children's school fees and meets daily family needs from her business income. She needs a loan of 800,000 Tanzanian shillings to buy foodstuff to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for food preparation

loans.name: In

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the main part of 22-year-old Mrs. In N.'s daily duty at the garment industry. In N. has been engaged in her job since 2008 and has a formal salary.

She has a life partner in her husband (pictured) who works in the construction field. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their two kids. Both of the kids are attending school. 

In N. is concerned that she faces difficulties in travelling to her workplace. She and her husband always travel to work by hiring a taxi or walking because they don't have their own vehicle. To solve the problem, In N. has requested a loan in the amount of $1100 to be used to buy a new motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is a 46-year-old single lady.  For a living, she does tailoring.  She started her business twenty-one years ago.   She hopes to open other outlets for her business in the future.  She also runs a grocery for extra income.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy fabric. She dreams of buying a plot in the future.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in a city called Gujranwala which is one-and-a-half hours away from the city of Lahore, Pakistan. Gujranwala city is well known as an industrial city.

Razia is 42 years old and is married to M. S. who is a loader by trade: he loads vegetables and delivers them from one place to another using a vehicle called a Hyundai Shahzore (a small truck). Razia supports her family by doing sewing work for her neighborhood clients.

Razia is the mother of three daughters. 17-year-old Saba is in 10th standard and 10-year-old Ayesha is studying in 3rd standard. Razia’s eldest daughter, Sonya, runs a beauty salon from her home. She is 21 years old and left school after completing 10th standard.

Razia has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will repair his vehicle and be able to continue his business in an efficient way.

Razia is a regular loan user of Asasah and is on her 3rd loan. In her previous loans she has proved herself a responsible client who never missed a single meeting and paid her installments on time.

loans.use: To repair her husband's vehicle that he uses in his business

loans.name: Yèmi Florence

texts.fr: B. Yèmi Florence est née le 24 Décembre 1971 à Adjohoun, dans le département de l’Ouémé. Mariée à TANDJI Dénis, Florence est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge. Florence vit avec ses enfants et son mari à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins du ménage. Florence n’a pas été à l’école. Pour répondre à ses besoins, Florence mène comme activité, la vente de mèches et de différents produits cosmétiques et de beauté à Agblangandan. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Florence achète ses produits. Florence exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année et a déjà obtenu trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Florence désire agrandir son activité et mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Florence sollicite un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
Yèmi Florence B. was born December 24, 1971 in Adjohoun, in the department of Ouémé. She is married to Dénis TANDJI and a mother to six children, all in school, three of which are in her care. 

Florence lives with her husband and children in Agblangandan, in the town of Sèmè-Podji. Together, the couple provide for the family’s needs. 

Florence never attended school. To make a living, she sells hair extensions, cosmetics and beauty products in Agblangandan. She gets her stocks in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also in Nigeria, a country next to Benin. 

Florence has been in this business for ten years or so, and has already obtained three loans, which were all properly repaid. She is seeking a fourth loan to expand her activities and better meet the needs of her clientele.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and various cosmetics

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
Nely B. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. She is 57 years old. Nely is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nely owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nely has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Nely is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nely from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jeiko Pora Rekavo Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo donde todas ellas tienen reuniones y actividades constantes, donde todo lo deciden en grupo y han crecido durante los años de que lleva trabajando el comité. Desean seguir alcanzando nuevos beneficios dentro del programa y se encuentran muy animadas.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Amalia quien se dedica a venta de productos de consumo del hogar, y está muy satisfecha porque le va muy bien con su negocio, comenta que mediante el grupo pudo conocer mucha cosas y pude capacitarse y mejorar especialmente en la administración de su despensa. 
Ella desea seguir surtiendo su negocio con mercaderías ya que su familia se alimenta con las mercaderías del negocio y por ello debe  comprar especialmente las mercaderías que se vende diariamente como fideos, arroz, harina, y otros.
texts.en:
All of the members of this group are engaged in constant activities and attend the meetings in which they decide everything as a group. Over the years of working together, they have grown as a committee. They desire to achieve new benefits under the program and are very excited about the possibilities.

One of the members is Sra. Amalia, who sells consumer household products. She is very pleased because she has done well in her business. Amalia says that through her group, she has learned many things from the training classes, especially how to manage her business. She wants to continue stocking her store with merchandise in order to feed her family. Amalia specifically wants to buy products that she sells on a daily basis such as noodles, rice, flour, and other items.

loans.use: Purchase flour, noodles, oil, cleaning products, and other items

loans.name: Matilde De Los Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Colon  que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Matilde, tiene 62 años de edad y hace varios años su esposo falleció quedando ella viuda y con seis hijos a su cuidado, en la actualidad ya todos mayores de edad, con ella vive una de ellos que es discapacitado.

Tiene un local en su casa donde vende carne asada, cueritos, y chinchurrias, bocadillos que son muy apetecidos por los turistas y personas del lugar. Trabaja de jueves a domingo por las tardes desde las 15h00 hasta las 19h00. Ahora desea incrementar su negocio para vender meriendas por las tardes y noches.

Este nuevo crédito es para comprar tres mesas y diez sillas, además de platos, ollas y cucharas para el nuevo negocio que va a iniciar. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace seis ciclos y le gusta el Banco porque gracias a los créditos ha podido salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y que su hijo este bien de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Colon gathers every fifteen days in the Colon parish of the City of Portoviejo, the Manabita Capital known as the City of the Valley because it is surrounded by many hills.  

Here we find Señora Matilde of 62 years old.  A few years ago, her husband died leaving her as a widow with six children under her care.  Currently, all of them are adults and only one of them live with her because he is disabled.

She has a business in her home where she sells carne asada (grilled beef), cueritos (little fried cakes), chinchurrias (grilled animal intestines), and bocadillos (jellies), which are very popular with tourists and locals.  She works from Thursday to Sunday in the afternoons from 3pm to 7pm.  She would like to expand her business by selling snacks in the afternoon and at night.

This new credit is to purchase three tables and ten chairs, along with plates, pans, and spoons for the new business that she is going to start.  She has been a member of the Communal Bank for over six cycles.  She likes the Bank because thanks to their credit, she has been able to move ahead.  Her dreams are to have a great restaurant and for her son to have good health.

loans.use: Purchase three tables, ten chairs, plates, pans, and spoons.

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Meng Thids is 30 years old and married to 31-year-old Oreim Sum, who helps support the family by running a motor taxi. Meng Thids is devoted to her two children, who are students in the local public school. 

She earns an income by selling  fruit in the local market. This couple can make a profit of approximately $13 per day to support their family. Currently, Meng T. always needs to hire a taxi when she needs transportation. To reduce the cost of transportation, she would like to borrow some funds in order to buy a used motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is from the village of San Roque. She is 35 years old. Evangeline is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Evangeline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es:
Anatolia es socia del Banco Comunal Geraneos, es separada, tiene 52 años y 7 hijos. Se dedica a la venta D. queso, pan chapa, wawas (pan dulce tipico D. la Región) frutas y preparación D. comidas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. quesos, pan chapla y wawas.
Anataolia se dedica a la comercialización D. quesos, pan chapla y wawas, viaja a Lima ahí los venD. semanal, viaja a Huaral ahí compra frutas que trae para Ayacucho y lo venD. en el Mercado Chorro o a veces venD. las frutas en la heladerías para la preparación D. helados. Cuando Anatolía no pueD. viajar manda los quesos a sus familiares que los distribuyen entre sus caseras.
Le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal, porque le dan créditos y pueD. ahorrar y aprenD. en las capacitaciones y comparte momentos gratos con sus consocias.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Anatolia is a member of the Geraneos communal bank.  She is 57 years old, separated, and has seven children.  She sells cheese, bread, wawa (sweetened bread typical of the region), fruit, and prepared food.

She will use the money from the loan she is requesting to buy cheeses, bread, and wawas.  Anataolia travels to Lima weekly to sell her wares.  She also makes trips to Huaral to buy fruit to bring back to Ayacucho and sell in the Chorro market.  Sometimes she sells to ice cream vendors who use it to make frozen treats.  When she can’t travel, she sends the cheeses to her family, who deliver them around their neighborhoods.

She likes her communal bank meetings because she is able to obtain loans, can save money, training, and she can share good times with her friends.

Her dream is to grow her business.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Wilbert

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Wilbert; el tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fotocopiadoras, el tiene una tienda de fotocopiadora y también trabaja como técnico electricista, el socio por medio de estos trabajos el socio saca adelante a su familia, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de fotocopiadora.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para arreglar la maquina fotocopiadora.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Wilbert is a member of the “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Wilbert is 38 years old.  He lives with his partner and has 3 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his photocopier business.  Wilbert has a photocopier store and also works as an electrician.  Through this work he gets his family ahead in life.  Wilbert would like to expand and improve his photocopier business.  He is requesting this loan to buy spare parts for fixing a photocopier.

Wilbert is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to fix a photocopier

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
This is 25 year-old Kalpana K..  She is married and has one child, age 2.  In 2006, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy grocery goods for her business.  

In the future, Kalpana plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page     

Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru: Норов Азимчон житель Гиссарского района. Ему 33 года. Он женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена домохозяйка. Сам Азимчон более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: N. Azimjon lives in the Gissar region. He's thirty-three years old, married and has four children. His wife takes care of the family, while Azimjon works as a farmer. He mainly grows vegetables, which he then sells. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es: La Sra. Alcira  de 37 años,  de estado civil casada, con 2 hijos, uno que se encuentra en edad escolar y la otra es pequeñita,  tiene ya varios años  haciendo  trabajar su micro ella percibe una renta diaria . La Sra.  Alcira  se dedica también a la venta de comida en su propio domicilio desde hace varios años. La Sra.  Alcira se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la necesidad que tiene de mejorar las condiciones de su micro y así prestar mejor servicio al ciudadano, con el dinero del credito comprara material para tapizar asientos de su micro. Ella es cliente antigua de nuestra institución, con buen comportamiento de pago,  cuenta con domicilio conocido ubicado al  Sur de nuestra ciudad, es un persona muy responsable y trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Alcira is 37 years old, married, and has two children. One child is of school age and the other is still small. For several years, Alcira has owned a mini-bus that generates daily rental income. She has also sold food from her home for the same length of time. Sra. Alcira is requesting a loan from Emprender because she needs to improve the conditions of her mini-bus so that she can provide better service to the public.

The money will be used to buy material for reupholstering the seats of her mini-bus. Alcira is a longtime client of Emprender and has demonstrated a good payment history. She has a home located south of the city. Alcira is a responsible and hardworking individual who is grateful to Emprender for its support.

loans.use: Purchase material to reupholster the seats of her mini-bus

loans.name: Born

texts.en:
Born T., age 36, is married to Saran, age 36. They have three children, all of whom are attending school. 

To earn a living, Born T. grows rice crops on his farmland. On average, he makes a profit of about $1.40 per day. His wife also works in the farming business. 

With this loan, Born T. will purchase a plot of farmland from a villager in order to grow more and various kinds of crops. This will enable the family to accrue an extra profit to meet their daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 42 años, es una mujer muy jovial. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Julio, de 42 años y sus 3 hijos aún menores y están en etapa escolar. Nancy se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida rápida (pollo y papas fritas) en su Stand móvil ubicado a 4 cuadras de su casa, precisamente en la puerta de la casa  de su madre, En este lugar lleva más de 4 años y le va muy bien, por ser un lugar muy concurrido, por la gente que acude al gimnasio, que esta en el segundo piso. En estos años,  este negocio le ha resultado ser muy rentable, por lo que ayuda a su esposo  cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos, y de ese modo su esposo esta pagando las letras de su futura casa. Su negocio lo realiza con mucha satisfacción, por ello todas  las mañanas, se provee de pollo y las sazona con paciencia, siendo así la preferencia de sus clientes. Más adelante desea ampliar su negocio con la preparación de jugos, pero lo que si le urge comprarse es una parrilla para freír pollos y de ese modo ir ampliando su negocio. Es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere defraudar a sus dos compañeras de su banco comunal  con quienes trabaja, en todo este tiempo y se siente contenta de pertenecer a este grupo. De obtener el crédito que solita, comprará su parrilla, para atender con mayor eficacia a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nancy is 42 years old and very good-humored.  She lives in her own home with her husband Julio, 42, and their three minor, school-aged children.  Nancy makes and sells fast food (chicken and french fries) out of her mobile stand located four blocks away from her house and just outside her mother's house. She's been in this location for over four years and business is going well because it's in a busy place where people go to a nearby gym.

She has made considerable earnings over this period of time and is able to help her husband cover the children's school expenses, so her husband can cover the monthly payment they are making for their future home.  

She enjoys her work and, every morning, patiently prepares the chicken she'll be selling since it is what most customers prefer.  In the future she hopes to expand business to include juices, but what she needs urgently is a grill to cook the chicken.  This is her ninth loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time.  She is very happy to be a part of the group.  She plans to use the loan to buy a grill so she can provide better customer service.

loans.use: To buy a grill

loans.name: Letty Nancy

texts.es: Letty tiene 34 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa con sus padres en el distrito de Jose Leonardo Ortiz cerca del Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Su comunidad es pequeña, urbana, joven e humilde. Cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, y muestra señales de más crecimiento. Letty se dedica a la docencia en una escuela primaria en el distrito de Chiclayo. Actualmente, desea hacer unos arreglos a su casa y comprar muebles. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Edpyme le ofrece su crédito a una tasa de interés más baja que otras entidades bancarias y otros prestamistas informales. Eso le permitirá a Letty trabajar tranquilo sin perjudicar su liquidez diario. Con los cambios a su casa, podrá brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres ancianos.
texts.en: Letty is 34 years old, is single, and has no children.  She lives in her parents’ house in the Jose Leonardo Ortiz district, near Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region in northern Peru.  Her community is small, rural, young, and humble.  It has running water and electricity and shows signs of additional growth.  Letty teaches at an elementary school in the Chiclayo district.  She wants to make some improvements to her home and buy some furniture, so she has seen fit to request a loan of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.  Edpyme provides loans at a much lower interest rate than other financial institutions or informal lenders.  This allows Letty to work calmly without damaging her liquidity.
