By making these home improvements, she will be able to provide a better quality of life for her aging parents.

loans.use: to make improvements to her parents' home.

loans.name: Peang

texts.en:
Mrs. Peang, born in 1955, is a widow. She sells Chinese noodle soup and pork rice to earn a small income in order to support her family. Additional income comes from one child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. 

In order to increase her income to improve the family’s living conditions, Mrs. Peang would like to ask for a loan to buy more Chinese noodles and supplies for the preparation of Chinese noodle soup and pork rice.

loans.use: to buy more Chinese noodles and supplies for the preparation of Chinese noodle soup and pork rice

loans.name: Mina's Group

texts.en:
Mina K. is the treasurer of this group. She is 52 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband she has raised two daughters and a son. The daughters study at university. The son got married a year ago. He lives and works in Russia. Two years ago, Mina got a loan in the amount of 10 000 soms, purchased three sheep and started breeding livestock animals. She resold that livestock at good price and repaid that loan successfully. Since that time, Mina has been breeding livestock. She hopes to obtain the new loan in order to purchase more livestock for breeding. Each month Mina saves some money, so in the near future she plans to purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Ma. Mabel

texts.en:
Maria Mabel, age 31, earns a living by running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells such items as canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in the local community. She also sells electronic loads from several networks like GLOBE and SMART. Maria Mabel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have a one-year-old child and live in the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental.

In 2009, Maria Mabel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Maria Mabel has successfully repaid her mst recent previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and was employed as working capital. Maria Mabel is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional snack foods, beverages, and electonic loads. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Maria Mabel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 
 
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional snack foods, beverages, and electonic loads to offer for sale

loans.name: Munkhbold

texts.en: Mr. Munkhbold is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son attends a secondary school and his daughter goes to kindergarten. Munkhbold’s wife works as a chef at Trauma Center Hospital. Munkhbold has been running a taxi business since 2009, using his family car. A few years ago he bought a plot of land with a old, small house on it. Munkhbold is planning to restore the house and to fix the fences around it. The loan Munkhbold is taking will be used to buy wood planks for fences, roof tiles and to pay for labor costs.

loans.use: To buy wood planks to fix his fences and new tiles to replace his roof tiles and to pay for labor cost

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ligia es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo e hijos , los planes hacia un futuro es poder brindarle una mejor condición de vida , apoyando en sus estudios para que logren ser profesionales , doña Ligia sus créditos anteriores los invertía en su negocio de ropo ahora quiere mejor la vivienda , realizando una división y el repellado de la misma; agradece Afodenic  atrávez de  fondo Kiva , la confianza que le brinda para que puede cumplir sus sueños ya que es de escasos recursos y no puede comprar de una solo vez todos los materiales de construcción .
texts.en:
Ligia lives in the Ticuantepe municipality with her husband and children.  Her future plans are to be able to provide them with better living conditions, and to support their education so that they can become professionals.

Ligia used her previous loans to invest in her clothing business.  Now, she wants to improve her home.  She will build a partition and plaster it.

She is grateful to Afodenic and the Kiva funds.  She is grateful for the trust shown in her so that she will be able to make her dreams come true.  She has scarce resources, and she is not able to buy all of the construction materials at once.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Paula Telvia

texts.es: Paula Telvia is 63 years and has 3 grown children.  For the last eight years, she has worked as a seamstress from her home producing shirts, skirts, pants, and linens. Paula Telvia intends to use the proceeds of the loan to purchase materials to create more productst scissors, threads, fabrics,  that she can sell.  She is very appreciative of the loans she has received, as it has helped her better her standard of living.
texts.en: Paula Telvia is 63 years and has 3 grown children.  For the last eight years, she has worked as a seamstress from her home producing shirts, skirts, pants, and linens. Paula Telvia intends to use the proceeds of the loan to purchase materials to create more productst scissors, threads, fabrics,  that she can sell.  She is very appreciative of the loans she has received, as it has helped her better her standard of living.

loans.use: scissors, threads, fabrics

loans.name: Paulina Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina; la socia tiene 42 años; la socia es soltera;  La socia trabaja en el hospital del seguro social, ella es enfermera de profesión y alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista la socia trae casacas de la ciudad de Lima y los vende aquí a sus diferentes amigas y allegados, la socia cada 6 meses realiza los viajes a la ciudad de Lima; la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito en la compra de ropa de la ciudad de Lima para venderla aquí ahora que se viene el cambio de estación. La saica solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compras de ropa.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "CHOQUEQUIRAO” communal bank, in the Huanchac district in the Province and Department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Paulina; she is 42 years old and is single. The member works in the public hospital; she is a professional nurse. She also has a small business, bringing coats back from the city of Lima to sell to her friends and acquaintances here. The member makes the journey to Lima every 6 months; on this occasion she would like to invest the loan in the purchase of clothing in Lima to sell here, now that the seasons are changing.

The member states that she is very satisfied with and grateful for the support offered, and promises to comply with the repayment of her loan in the place agreed.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Erinestine

texts.en:
Ernestine is a 35-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with four children between the ages of two and eleven. Her husband works as a driver.
For the past 15 years, Ernestine has been running a business selling vegetables. The success of this business has enabled her to pay her children’s medical insurance. She is requesting this loan to purchase three baskets of tomatoes, 100kg of peanuts, and 20 liters of cooking oil that she can sell at a profit. With her future profits, she plans to pay her children's school fees, feed her family, and make savings.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a mother, and being a parent, it is her responsibility to send her children to school and prepare for their future. For almost nine years, Tessie has operated a sari-sari store, earning a net income of 6,000 PHP a month.

Due to financial difficulties, Tessie is aiming to improve her sari-sari store so as to increase her earnings to meet her family’s daily needs and to support the education of her daughter. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy beverages, candy, bread, soap, soft drinks and canned goods to sell in the village.

With her dedication to her work, Tessie believes that someday she can achieve her goals and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell in the village.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester, 60 years old, manages a "sari-sari" store, a privately owned shop operated inside the shopkeeper's house. A small window is present where the customer's requested commodity is given. Ester sells candies, canned goods and noodles in the store. She wishes to add to her goods through asking  for the loan amount of P5,000 from ASKI (Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc.) to buy soft drinks, bread and butter for sale in the store.

Ester is blessed with nine children; among them, five are out of school. She can’t afford to send them all to school because of scarcity of money. She is earning only P6,000 every month and it‘s not enough to cover all their everyday needs since she has a big family. 

Ester, almost crying, stated that, “We once experienced eating rice alone just to fill our empty stomachs.” Obviously, she pitied her children and she was hurt. Despite these obstacles, Ester is full of hope. She is working hard and strives for the best. She knows that God is always there to guide her in achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bread and butter for sale in the store.

loans.name: Jane Glaiza

texts.en:
Jane Glaiza is 20 years old and married and lives in Poblacion, Salug, Zamboanga del Norte.

Jane Glaiza sells longaniza and hotdogs to earn a living and has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase meat to make her longaniza and hotdogs.

Jane Glaiza became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat to make her longaniza and hotdogs.

loans.name: Samol

texts.en: Samol, 31, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Samol and her husband are employed at a garment factory, earning an income of USD 3 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 70 on food and USD 40 on the other necessary expenses. Samol is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase a fishing boat for her husband to go fishing during the fishing season. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat for her husband to go fishing

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye est âgé de 35 ans. Il vit au Sénégal. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants âgés  entre 3 et 9 ans. Il évolue aussi bien dans le secteur de la couture que du commerce. Il gère un atelier et a une expérience de 11 ans dans ses activités. C’est lui-même qui a porté son choix sur l’activité de tailleur. Ce qui lui  a beaucoup plu c’est l’avancement et l’amélioration de ses connaissances en broderie qu’il a acquis, ce qui lui a permis de mieux rentabiliser son activité et de gagner beaucoup plus d’argent.  Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  et sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’une machine de broderie gros fil.  Ce financement pourra l’aider a élargir  son activité de couture,  a augmenter sa capacité financière, a  développer une activité de vente d’habits prêt a porter. Par conséquent ce sera  l’occasion pour lui  d’augmenter le nombre  de ses  apprentis.
NB.Sur la photo figure Abdoulaye  et 3 de ses apprentis qui apprennent le métier  en même temps qu'ils l'aident dans le travail.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is 35 years old and lives in Senegal. He is married and father to four children aged between three and nine years old. He is progressing in both the tailoring and trading fields. He manages a workshop and has eleven years' experience in his businesses. He himself chose his tailoring activity, and what has pleased him immensely is the progress and improvement he has achieved in his knowledge of embroidery; this has allowed him to make his business more profitable and to make a lot more money. 

He is a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions) and is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for the purchase of a large thread embroidery machine. This loan will help him to expand his tailoring business, increase his financial capacity and develop a business selling ready-to-we clothing. As a consequence this will give him the opportunity to increase the number of his apprentices. N.B. On the photo you can see Abdoulaye and three of his apprentices, who are learning the trade while at the same time helping him with his work.

loans.use: to buy a large thread embroidery machine

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
La señora Silveria cuenta con la edad de 72 años, es viuda desde hacen 10 años, tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales ya todos están casados, se dedica a la venta de refrescos, desde hace 3 años.
Ella dice que empezó con esta actividad, por que quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una buena solvencia económica, también para empezar a ahorrar y asegurar su futuro, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de refrescos, jugos y aguas, para tener un poco mas surtido su negocio. 
Una de las metas que tiene doña Silveria, es la de hacer crecer muchísimo su negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local, para poner un deposito de refrescos, y así mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos.
Esta muy agradecida con FRAC y los donadores de kiva, por este gran apoyo que les están ofreciendo, ya que gracias a esta ayuda su negocio y vida de su familia han cambiado bastante.
texts.en:
Sra. Silveria is 72 years old and has been a widow for 10 years. She has six children who are all married. Silveria has been selling soft drinks for three years.

She says that she started this business because she wanted to improve her quality of life and have good financial solvency. Silveria also wanted to start saving and securing her future. The loan she will receive will be invested in soft drinks, juices, and water so that her business will have a little more inventory.

One of Doña Silveria’s goals is to grow her business even more. She wants to build a shop where she can set up a soft drink repository and increase her earnings. Silveria is very grateful to FRAC and the Kiva lenders because of the overwhelming support they have offered. Thanks to the help she has received for her business, the life of her family has changed considerably.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices, and water.

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en: Khachik is a police officer. To sustain his family properly, Khachik is also engaged in agriculture. He keeps livestock and beehives. To increase his business income, Khachik plans to purchase more livestock and beehives. This will allow Khachik to develop farming and ensure a sustainable future for his family. Khachik lives with his wife, pensioner mother and two children.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and beehives.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y venta de semilla de marañón, vive con sus padres y una hija, es madre soltera y su hija es dependiente, Blanca aprendió su oficio al lado de sus padres, la granja de cerdos la tiene en su vivienda y hasta el momento no han tenido dificultades.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, esta compra le ayudara para aumentar la granja y poder generar a futuro más ingresos provenientes de las ventas.
La aspiración de Blanca es tener un negocio amplio, con más capacidad para atender la demanda y proveer para su hija todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Blanca raises pigs and sells cashew nuts.  She lives with her parents and her daughter.  She’s a single mother and her daughter is dependent on her.  Blanca learned her occupation alongside her parents.  Her pig farm is home-based and to date she’s faced no difficulties.

She’s asking for a loan to buy pigs.  This purchase will help her increase her farm to generate more income in the future from the sales.  Blanca’s goal is to have an ample business with more capacity to meet demand and provide her daughter with everything necessary.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Algin

texts.en:
Algin is a 27-year-old married woman with two young children. Her husband is a fisherman. For the past four years, Algin has run a sari-sari (retail) store where she sells items like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, and soap to people in her community. She earns 15,000 PHP per month with her business. Algin also supports her husband by selling his catch at the market.

Algin is requesting a loan to buy both fishing nets and more items to sell such as canned goods and rice. She hopes to achieve her future goals of sending her children to college and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and items to sell at her store

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр трудолюбивый и добросовестный семьянин. Более 7 лет он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном Бахтиёр выращивает лук и морковку. Он тщательно ухаживает на землю и всегда получает хороший урожай. Бахтиёр хочет перерабатывать свою землю предстоящего посева. Бахтиёр запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов. А часть займа хочет использовать на оплаты труда работников.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor is a hardworking and conscientious family man. He has been engaged in cultivation of agricultural crops for more than seven years. Mainly Bakhtiyor grows onions and carrots. He carefully takes care of the earth and always gets a good crop. Bakhtiyor wishes to convert the land for the upcoming crop. He requests a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. He wants to use a portion of the loan to pay the workers.

loans.use: to purchase of fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay for hired labor.

loans.name: Yeanoh

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Yenoh. She is married and has four children aged 21, 18, 15 and 11 years old. She has three additional dependents, who live with her because they are her relatives. 
In 2008, Yenoh established her cookery business. She began her business because her husband’s income was not enough to support their family. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about Le 1,100,000 every month from this business. 
She would like a loan of Le 4,500,000. Yenoh requires a loan in order to purchase more food stocks for her business. In the future, Yenoh plans to acquire land and also educate her children to university level. 
She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, palm oil, vegetable oil, stock and salt

loans.name: Seoung

texts.en: Seoung, 31, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Seoung sells souvenirs to tourists, while her husband is a farmer. Seoung is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more souvenirs to resell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to expand her business. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more souvenirs to resell

loans.name: Cyprian Kinyua

texts.en: Cyprian is married and has a one year old daughter. He describes himself as an ambitious man. He has been running a retail store for the last three years. He sells items such as flour, sugar, rice, stationery, and paper. His business challenge is affording the high cost of goods sold. He will be using the loan (Kes20,000) to buy more stationery, sugar and rice. Cyprian hopes to diversify his business within the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of stationery, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Jipar

texts.ru:
Жыпар  40 лет, замужем, воспитывает троих детей . Основным источником дохода для Жыпар является животноводство, начатое ею 15 лет назад.  Стартовав свой бизнес с суммы в 25,000 сом (KGS), Жыпар смогла развить свое хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в 6,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день, в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 13 коз, 7 овец, заготовлено 5 телег сена, и 600 кг ячменя.    
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпар обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов овец. Доходы Жыпар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Jipar is 40 years old, married and is raising three children.  Animal husbandry, which she started 15 years ago, is Jipar's primary source of income.  Having started this business with a sum of 25,000 som (KGS), she was able to grow her business to have a monthly profit of 6,000 som (KGS).  Today, her business has 13 goats and 7 sheep, a stock of 5 carts of hay and 600 kilograms of barley.  In order to further develop her business, Jipar requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of sheep.  She plans to invest the profits into increasing livestock headcount further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story:

My name is Irma, and I am 43 years old.  I have lived with my partner for 18 years and we have 5 sons, although only 3 are still dependent on us.  I have been working selling shoes for the last 10 years.  I started this to help support my husband and fortunately I have been doing well.  With the money that I make, I am able to cover my personal expenses and also support my husband.  I will use this loan to buy more shoes and sell them.  Usually my clients buy the products in installments and they usually don't pay me in advance, so I have to pay for the shoes and then I recover my investment.  My main goal is to make my business grow.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Djekadi B Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe DJEKADI B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kapala, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le pois sucré avec Madame ASSETOU debout au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et de semences agricoles

loans.name: Vololoniaina Yvonne

texts.fr:
Vololoniaina est une femme dynamique et débrouillarde de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. Son ainé est déjà marié, et les restes suivent encore leurs études dans des écoles privées. Le mari travaille, et il est chauffeur.
Elle exerce une activité source de revenu de vente des ustensiles de cuisine et ce depuis 1993. Elle en possède donc tant d'années d'expérience dans ce domaine. Elle maîtrise bien le métier. Elle voudrait devenir un jour grossiste, elle est en cours de négociation avec des grands fournisseurs.
Sa priorité actuelle est les études de ses enfants, qu'elle puisse continuer à les financer et à cela s'ajoute le rêve de pouvoir construire sa propre maison car la famille habite encore dans une maison d'héritage.

loans.use: acheter des ustensiles de cuisines:robot, rice cooker, hot pot, cocotte minutte, faitout en série

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha is married and has three children; they are studying and also help her with the business. Bertha’s business is buying and selling sunglasses and fashion glasses, which she sells in a little store in a popular market. She is 33 years old and started her business in 2001 because she had to support her family; her business was successful and she was able to open another one in another popular market. Bertha wants to grow and create a better quality of life for her and her family. For this reason she works very hard to achieve her dream, and is now requesting a loan of US $ 1,200. With this loan she could purchase more merchandise in a greater quantity and obtain better and lower prices by buying the merchandise prior to the season, and in this way she could increase her income. She offers to re-pay this loan in 6 months at least.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Bertha esta casada y tiene tres hijos que están aún estudiando y también ellos la ayudan en el negocio. El negocio al que se dedica es venta de lentes para sol y casuales, los vende en un puesto que tiene ubicado en un tianguis o mercado popular. Bertha tiene 33 años de edad y empezó su negocio en al año 2001 por que tenía que mantener a su familia y como le fue bien con su negocio tuvo la oportunidad de abrir otro en otro mercado popular. Bertha tiene deseos de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia por ello trabaja mucho para lograrlo y esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 1,200 que le servirán para poder comprar más mercancía nueva en grandes lotes a menor precio comprando ahora antes de que empiece la temporada y así poder tener un mayor margen de utilidad. Ella espera pagar el préstamo en 6 meses y espera le brinden ese apoyo económico.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Madam Charity sells textiles of various kinds. She buys direct from textile factories and retails to her customers. A lot of people patronize her shop due to the moderate price of her goods, but of late she is loosing her customers to other retailers because her customers cannot get the kind of clothes they want from her shop. She stopped buying from the company because she has no money. She is seeking a loan of $1100 from Kiva to enable her buy direct from the company to supply her customers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: "I started this business years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safeguard my capital to ensure continuity in business." These are the words of Mrs. Dorcas O., married with four (4) children. She is requesting $250 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Lucina

texts.es:
I would like nothing more than to see my house finished, but I have not been able to do it. I'm lacking bars for the windows and doors. I'm requesting a loan of $1,000 to finish the doors and windows before the cold and rainy season comes, since I have three children and I don't want them to get sick.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Me gustaria mucho ver termi nada ya mi casa pero no he podido, me falta los rejas en las ventans y puestas. Estoy solicitando un prestamo de $ 1,000.00 Dlls para la terminacion de ventanas y puertas antes de que se venga el frio y las lluvias ya que tengo 3 hijos y no quiero que se me enfermen.

loans.use: Put bars on my doors and windows.

loans.name: Phath

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Phath got married in 1969 and has 7 children: 3 sons and 4 daughters. She learned to weave silk from her parents and started her silk production business in 1963. Her eldest son also weaves silk at home. 2 of her daughters are working at the garment factory in Phnom Penh and her husband is a rice farmer.

To date, Mrs N. has taken out 5 loans from MAXIMA. She is now requesting a loan of $250. She will use this loan to purchase silk material and sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and embroidering on her loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and embroidering.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a 42-year-old mother of 4 and a resident of the Tandiika area in Dar Es Salaam city. She has been doing business for the past seven years. She runs a restaurant in the area and keeps poultry and plans to open a kiosk. She is in need of $225 to help her boost her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Aisyah

texts.en: Aisyah is a 60 year old woman and she lives with her grandchild, aged 22. She sells some household goods and usually earns $20 per day. Her grandchild, Roby, helps her to run her business every day. She is requesting a $50 loan to buy more goods and make the business more sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
For the last seven years, Jose Alfredo Hernandez commonly known as chepito sells basic grains in the city of Chinandega. His story is powerful in that several years ago he lost his wife. On becoming a widower he looked for ways to handle his situation since she was the one that attended to him with his meals and care and was his very capable helper.

Currently Mr. Jose Hernandez (chepito) has been able to move forward thanks to the loans that he received from Ceprodel ( 5 loans). These have helped him cover some expenses and also increase his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

José Alfredo H. conocido comúnmente como chepito se dedica a la venta de granos básicos en la Ciudad de Chinandega desde hace siete años. Su historia es muy impactante ya que hace unos años perdió a su esposa y al quedar viudo buscó la manera de jugársela solo por lo que la esposa era la que le atendía con sus alimentos y atención por ser su ayuda idónea.

Hoy en día el señor José H. (chepito) ha podido salir adelante gracias a créditos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel (5 créditos) los cuales le han beneficiado para suplir algunos gastos y además aumentar sus utilidades.

loans.use: Investment in the business

loans.name: Martha De Jesús

texts.es:
The sale of bread is a very competitive business in the Santa Ana market in Chinandega due to the fact that there are many businesses that sell bread in the market. Martha D. understands this situation as she has sold bread for 15 years in this market with the sole intention of supporting her daughter, who is a widowed mother and who fills the role of mother and father at the same time.

Her greatest need is the purchase of bread urgently to continue her business. It's for this reason that she looks to the aid of Ceprodel who, as of today, has provided her with a total of 18 loans, exclusively for the purchase of bread which she later sells to her faithful customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de pan es un negocio muy competitivo en el mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega debido a que existe mucha competencia por la venta de este producto. Martha D. consiente de esta situación ha comercializado la venta de pan desde hace 15 años en este mercado con el único propósito de mantener a su pequeña hija ya que es madre viuda y hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez.

Su mayor necesidad es la compra del pan con urgencia para seguir con el negocio, es por este motivo que acude a CEPRODEL quien actualmente le ha brindado un total de 18 créditos utilizados exclusivamente para la compra de pan para luego venderlo a sus fieles clientes.

loans.use: Purchase bread

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Mrs. Pon S. Ol is 23 years old and is a mother of school-age children. She stays at home to look after the house and to cook food for her family. Meanwhile, her husband supports the family by collecting various items in his community that can be recycled and he re-sells these items to the plant to earn, on average, approximately $3.50 of profit per day. In order to more easily transport the recycled products to the plant, the couple is requesting a $300 loan from Kiva to purchase a motor bike.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike to transfer recycled products to the plant for re-sale.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en: Lusia T. has joined a community of twelve ladies in the village of Letogo. The common business in their community is growing vegetable gardens. She says that there is always a high demand for vegetables everyday and especially during weekends. Having the same business as the other ladies is not a problem for them, because they each have their own customers (the supermarket and hotel owners). Lusia earns about $40 a day and double that on weekends if she sells to general public. When she supplies her regular customers, she will double her earning in one week. Her business is very much improving, and she want to increase her output because of high competition with the other ladies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and more vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Chuon Ur Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuon U. is the group leader of a foU. member group in Kralanh village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 56 years old and is the mother of one child, who is a construction worker. She sells baskets for a living and her husband, Mr. Pov CH., helps her.

The family income is very little and they cannot pay for all of their expenses. Therefore, Mrs. Chuon U. wants to cultivate rice to supplement their income. Unfortunately, the family does not have cultivatable land. Mrs. Chuon U. is requesting a loan to buy a field for this purpose. (The man in the picture is the husband of Mrs. Nai H..)

loans.use: to buy land to cultivate

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia M. is a 39-year-old woman who is divorced and has two daughters.

Lidia is a door-to-door salesperson who offers clothes and shoes. She is a lovely person and is well-known in her town. That is her biggest advantage: since she is very nice and famous, the number of clients is very large. In addition, she offers different type of payments to her clients.

The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of merchandise such as sport shoes and clothes. In the future, she plans to buy a car in order to transport her merchandise. An automobile will make her work a lot easier.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes: t-shirts, pants, and sport shoes.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos Cercado A. belongs to the "Las Violetas" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín region and Rioja Province of Nueva Cajamarca. She sells typical Peruvian cookies and desserts (roscas, kekes, suspiros, biscochos) which she sells on one corner of the market on a heavily-traveled street.

She decided to start up her business after her husband left her and she became both father and mother to 6 young children. Her business is going well and now she has also started selling soft drinks.

With a loan of 1,200 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy Peruvian cookies and desserts (kekes, tortas, roscas, piononos, alfajores, suspiros) on a daily basis as well as other types of sweets, and will also buy soft drinks in different flavors, sizes and brands, so that she can meet customer demand.

Santos Cercado A. is 40 years old and has 6 children, the youngest 2 live with her. She considers herself a fighter, persistent and feels she is a great example for her children.

Her goal is to have a store where she sells clothing and to be able to give work to other persons. She believes that with this type of job, she will be able to rest somewhat.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Santos Cercado A. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Violetas”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Rioja en Nueva Cajamarca, se dedica a la venta de dulces como: Roscas dulces, kekes, suspiros, biscochos desarrolla su negocio en la esquina del mercado ya que es una avenida muy concurrida .

Decidió iniciar su negocio después de que su esposo abandonara el hogar, ella se convirtió en padre y madre para sus 6 menores hijos, le va muy bien que ahora esta surtiendo con bebidas gasificadas.

Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1,200.00 que será pagado en 6 meses comprará diariamente dulces como, kekes, tortas, roscas, piononos, alfajores, suspiros, y demás tipos de dulces, también bebidas como gaseosas de distintos sabores, tamaños y marcas y así satisfacer la gran demanda de sus clientes.

La señora Santos Cercado A. tiene 40 años y 6 hijos, ahora vive con sus 2 últimos hijos. Se considera luchadora, perseverante y siente que es un gran ejemplo para sus hijos.

Su meta es llegar a tener tienda donde vender ropa, y poder dar trabajo a mas personas, cree que con el este tipo de actividad descansará un poco.

loans.use: Buy a variety of cookies, desserts, candies and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sweet's Hosana Group

texts.en:
Sweet is 24-years-old, married with three children between the ages of two and five. She began selling clothing in 2007. She works from 8AM to 6PM and earns a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Sweet now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and shoes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with salon ownership and carpets sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for a clothing shop.

loans.name: Sabine

texts.fr: Sabine D. est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle souhaite renforcer son commerce de divers condiments alimentaires locaux au marché puisqu’elle y a déjà un étal. Elle mène cette activité dans le but de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de ses enfants et leur assurer une bonne scolarité. <b>Elle remboursera ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois <b/>.
texts.en:
Sabine D. is married and the mother of 5 children. She wishes to strengthen her business by selling various local seasonings given she already has a stall at the market. She has been practicing this activity in order to contribute to the improvement of her children ' s quality of life and to insure their proper schooling. She will reimburse this loan in one single repayment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various seasonings at the market.

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Codou S., 47 ans, mariée avec 07 enfants et 02 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Bayouf Pout à Thiès depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce de fruits locaux (mangues et pastèques). Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Codou S., age 47 and married with seven children and two other people to take care of, has been a member of the Bayouf Pout village bank in Thiès for two and a half years. She wants to expand her business of selling local fruit (mangoes and watermelon). Her income enables her to improve the living conditions of her family. She is requesting a loan which will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of local fruit

loans.name: Sonia Marina

texts.es:
La señora Sonia Marina R. Rodríguez tiene 37 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Mañana y vive en la calle Manuel Gonzales Prada s/n en el distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió primaria completa, pero ya no tuvo apoyo de sus padres y no pudo seguir estudiando.
Se casó a los 24 años con el señor Hugo Cerna y tiene 2 hijos que aún son estudiantes.
Empezó haciendo negocio de carne, pero probó comprando y vendiendo madera y como le rindió mayores ganancias se quedó con ese negocio. Ahora compra madera en los bosques y luego realizan la tala, las ramas de los árboles las pelan y las usan como leña y el palo grueso lo alistan para madera.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, recuerda que compró dos cerdos que los vendió en carne porque en ese tiempo se dedicaba a ese negocio.
Con este crédito de 1,000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa invertir en madera sin preparar, eso quiere decir que lo comprará en planta, entonces aprovecha también la leña.
Sonia sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales y viajar con ellos a conocer otros países.
texts.en:
Sonia Marina R. Rodríguez is 37 years old, is a member of the Mujeres del Mañana (Women of Tommorow) community bank, and lives on Manuel Gonzales Prada street, Agallpampa district, Otuzco province, La Libertad province in Peru. She finished primary school but didn't have the support of her parents and couldn't continue studying. She got married at the age of 24 to Hugo Cerna and have two school aged children. She started in the meat selling business, but also tried her hand at buying and selling wood, which turned to be more profitable so she ended up with this business. Currently, she buys trees in the forest and later fells them. She peels the branches which are then used for firewood and uses the trunks as general wood. With her first loan of 300 Soles, which was repaid in 4 months, she purchased two pigs that she sold as meat, since that was her business at the time. With this loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she plans to invest in purchasing unprepared wood, in other words still in the ground, to be used for firewood. Sonia dreams of seeing her children becoming professionals and traveling with them to visit other countries.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence M. is a member of the Twisakirala group in Jinja.  She is a very hard working lady who has managed to run her retail shop for three years.  She has seen her shop grow, a thing that seemed impossible at the start, with the help of loans.  She has been able to improve the quality and quantity of what she sells from her shop, and as a result, her children go to one of the good schools in her locality with a large percentage of fees paid.  Florence needs a loan to help with buying more products for her shop to make more profits.

loans.use: To stock her retail shop.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.en: Yovany E. is the representative of the group "Mujeres Trabajadoras 1". This group is receiving its second loan cycle, and hoping to increase the business they started with its first loan. Yovany took her first loan and started a small business selling used clothing in her area. She experienced some success and was able to make all her loan payments while also saving some. She said she was very excited and happy about running her own business. It is the first time in her life that she has something of her own and something that wakes her up in the morning. She is the mother of three children and finally feels like she can provide for them. After the success of her first loan she is already dreaming of owning her own clothing boutique and earning plenty of money to send her children to college and provide them a good lives. She also wants to have her own house someday! She feels like she can do this and thinks this next loan will help her increase in size. She is very grateful for the opportunity and ready for the next step!

loans.use: To purchase clothing for business.

loans.name: Isabel Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Isabel del Pilar vive en la ciudad de León donde se desempeña en su negocio de venta de frutas como lo son las manzanas y también verduras ubicada en el mercado la estación donde día a día comercializa estos perecederos con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación compuesta por sus hijos.

El motivo por el cual la señora Isabel ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para dar lugar a la compra de los perecederos como lo son las frutas y verduras. Es por esto que espera que su crédito sea otorgado con rapidez para dar lugar a dicha compra.
texts.en:
Señora Isabel del Pilar lives in the city of León where she operates her business selling fruits such as apples and also vegetables located in the station market, where day by day she markets these perishables for the purpose of earning a living for her household of composed of her children. The reason that señora Isabel has sought the support of Ceprodel is to request a loan to purchase perishables such as fruits and vegetables. It is for this that she hopes that her loan will be authorized quickly to make possible said purchase.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Lucrecia Clementina

texts.es:
Lucrecia Clementina Q. tiene la edad de 48 años, su estado civil es soltera, el estado civil de Doña Lucrecia es soltera, Doña Lucrecia tiene 2 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 18 años cursa el 1 año de su carrera y su hijo menor de 15 años cursa el 4 año de secundaria, sus propósitos son de seguir manteniendo la fuente de trabajo y así seguir la educación necesaria a sus hijos, sus deseos son de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que sus hijos puedan disfrutar de las condiciones necesarias además el día de mañana podrán vivir con sus familias futuras y así puedan conservar su casa para las generaciones futuras, sus sueños son que sus hijos puedan finalizar sus estudios para que sean unos profesionales y aprovechen la oportunidad de estudiar ya que no todos los jóvenes pueden hacerlo por que sus padres no poseen el dinero suficiente.

La actividad económica a la que Doña Lucrecia se dedica es la venta de refrescos naturales, chancho con yuca, artículos desechables y bolsas plásticas, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 10 años, Doña Lucrecia dio inicio a su negocio por su necesidad ya que no contaba con un trabajo y su compañero de vida había dejado de trabajar y no tenían ningún ingreso para la familia, además sus niños estaban pequeños y ella no permitiría que ellos sufrieran hambre por no tener el pan de cada día, por lo tanto Doña Lucrecia se lleno de valor y decidió emprender este negocio en el que hasta hoy le ha ido bien, aun sin la ayuda de su esposo, Doña Lucrecia se siente una persona independiente y capaz de mantener su hogar, la utilización que le dará Doña Lucrecia al financiamiento, es para capital de trabajo y de esta manera invertir en el negocio comprando mas mercadería que sus clientes le están solicitando como: vasos, cucharas, platos , bolsas, entre otro tipo de inventario.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Clementina Q. is 48 years old, and her marital status is single. Doña Lucrecia has 2 sons; her eldest son is 18 and is in his first year of college and her youngest son is 15 and in the 4th year of secondary school. Her goal is to maintain her source of income so that her sons may continue their studies. Her wish is to make improvements to her home so they can enjoy proper living conditions, as well as live there with their own families so the house can be handed down to future generations. Her dream is that her sons complete their education so they can become professionals and take advantage of the opportunity they have to study, something not all young people are able to do so, since their parents don’t have enough money. Doña Lucrecia’s business is selling natural sodas, chancho (pork) with yucca, disposable items & plastic bags. The business is mobile, and she’s had it for 10 years. Doña Lucrecia began her business out of need, since she did not have a job, her domestic partner had stopped working, and they did not have any income. Her children were young and she would not allow them to go hungry for lack of daily bread, so Doña Lucrecia filled with courage and decided to start this business that, to this day, has done so well. Despite having no help from her husband, Doña Lucrecia feels herself to be an independent person, capable of maintaining her home. Doña Lucrecia will use this loan as working capital, investing in her business by purchasing merchandise her customers have been requesting, such as cups, spoons, plates, bags, and other types of inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Namatovu Ruth Group

texts.en:
Namatovu is 36 years of age and married with four children aged between 14 and 20 years. She sells ripe bananas to earn a living for her self, she is renting a two roomed house and she has access to electricity and piped water. She does care for additional family members. and they have three meals a day. Her greatest expense at the end of the month is paying tuition for her children.

R. sells her bananas in the market and she works 7 days a week. She pays market dues for the place in which she sells her ripe bananas. She normally receives about 5 customers a day and they are both men and women. She does her business on a retail basis. She has done this business for over 5 years now. The main challenge she faces in this business is that it is seasonal.

R. has been with MCDT for over 5 years now and she has so far received 10 loans. The reason why she joined MCDT is because it is easy to and it was also near the place she does her business. She has worked with her group for 2 years now and she wants to use the loan she is to receive to increase on her stock.

loans.use: To increase her stock of bananas.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor es socio del Bancomunal El sembrador.
Víctor es conviviente tiene 46 años, cuatro hijos de los cuales el  menor tiene 12 años y esta en la escuela estatal. 
Víctor vende hace catorce años helados en carretilla, no conseguía trabajo, entonces  sus amigos le animaron a que entre en la venta de helados y así empezó, ahora distribuye helados en las tiendas. 
Desde que esta en Finca tiene mas facilidad para poder invertir, los prestamos le han ayudado mucho, aprendido administra su dinero, hacer puntual, cuando el no puede ir a las reuniones del Bancomunal su esposo lo remplaza.
Víctor necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para compra de helados de crema.
El sueño de víctor es tener una tienda mini-marqué.
texts.en:
Victor is a partner of Bancomunal El sembrador. Victor is 46 years old, with four children of whom the youngest child is 12 years old and is in state school. For fourteen years, Victor has sold ice cream in a truck. When he could not find work, his friends encouraged him to sell ice cream and this is how he started distributing ice cream in stores. Since he has been with Finca, he has found it easier to invest. The loans have helped him greatly, and he has learned how to manage his money and make timely payments. When he cannot attend Bancomunal meetings, he wife attends in his place. Victor needs a loan of $275 USD to buy ice cream. Victor's dream is to have a mini-mart.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of ice cream

loans.name: Paulo

texts.es: Paulo es un joven de 22 años muy alegre y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes quiere dar una vida digan y tranquila. Desde que tenia 16 años ha trabajado en el negocio familiar, junto a sus padres realizaba el acopia de fibra de ovino. Actualmente, continúa con esta actividad, pero ahora lo hace de manera individual, ayudando así con los gastos familiares. Paulo compra a los ganaderos la fibra de sus ovinos, para luego llevarla a vender a otras ciudades, como Cuzco, Tacna, etc. Lleva 2 años realizando este negocio y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede continuar con la tradición familiar, además espera que en el futuro su negocio crezca y pueda recolectar mucha más fibra, para vender en más lugares. Para Paulo lo difícil de su trabajo es recolectar la fibra, puesto que tiene que ir a lugares muy lejanos, aun así esta dispuesto a poner todo de su parte para alcanzar sus metas. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, en su primer crédito fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy querido, ya que siempre es respetuoso con el resto de las socias. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita incrementará su capital de trabajo, así podrá comprar más fibra de ovino y vender a más clientes.
texts.en:
Paulo is a hard-working and cheerful young man, 22 years old, and lives with his parents, to whom he would like to provide a decent and tranquil life. He has worked in the family business alongside his parents since he was 16 years old, buying up raw wool fleece. He is currently still doing this, but now does it on his own, thereby helping out with the family expenses. Paulo buys raw wool from local sheep farmers and later takes it to other cities such as Cuzco and Tacna to be sold. He has been in business for 2 years and what he likes most about it is that he can continue the family tradition. He hopes that in the future his business grows and he can collect even more wool fleece to sell in other places. For Paulo, the most difficult part of his job is collecting the fleece because he has to travel to many faraway places, but even so, he is willing to put all his effort into reaching his goals. This is his second loan with MFP. With his first loan he was very punctual with repayments and expects to do the same now as well. He is well-liked in his communal bank because he is always very respectful to the other members. With the 1,500 soles he requests he will increase his working capital so he can buy more raw wool fleece and sell to more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Their education is the most important inheritance Mavluda and her husband can give to their four dear children. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances.

This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband and children (one of whom is pictured), she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenditures, and would like a loan in order to increase their capital by increasing their production. Mavluda and her family are waiting for your quick response.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. HERMEREGILDA, ella es vecina del barrio tradicional de zaguan del cielo, situada en el mismo corazón de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es casada, y tiene 37 años de edad, ella tiene 3 hijos de (18, 15, 13) años,  ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración de su propia tienda abarrotes que esta ubicada en su misma casa, por estar bien ubicada, ella solicita el préstamo para poder implementar de mercadería su negocio de tienda abarrotes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y al apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
This client is Hermeregilda. She lives in the traditional neighborhood of Zaguan del cielo, situated in the heart of Cusco.

Hermeregilda is married and 37 years old. She has 3 children who are 18, 15 and 13 years old. She alternates her activities at home with the administration of her own grocery store that is located in the her own house. Since the store is in a good location, she is asking for the loan in order to buy merchandise for her business.

Heremerigilda appreciates and appreciates the loan that has been granted to her and the support that she has gotten through it and is committed to complying with the full payment of her debt within the scheduled time-frame.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife. Ahmad has been selling and repairing furniture for four years. Ahmad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a saw and some old furniture. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.
Ahmad is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash to purchase sophisticated tools. Ahmad decided on doing this business because of the experience he had learning it when he was at school. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a saw and some old furniture.

loans.name: Jose Abel

texts.es: José Abel vive en la colonia La fonseca a 25 KM de la colonia Yolaina, tiene 1 hijo de 8 años de edad que estudia su 2do grado de Educación primaria, su esposa se encarga del cuido del niño y de los quehaceres del hogar, Jose Abel trabaja como docente del INATEC desde hace 8 años, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en la construcción de una habitacion y asi contar con mejores comodidades; se caracteriza por ser un profesional con mucha experiencia en docencia, el imparte sus clases con mucho amor,  es un hombre humilde, responsable con muchos deseos de seguir estudiando. El se siente agradecido con AFODENIC pues con los créditos anteriores ha mejorado su vivienda  y ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida, su sueño es tener una vivienda bonita y trabajo para así sacar a su hijo adelante y asi que no le falten nada en sul hogar.
texts.en:
José Abel lives in the La Fonseca area, 25 km from Yolaina. He has an 8-year old son who is in grade 2. His wife takes care of their child and does the household chores. José Abel has been working as a teacher at INATEC for eight years. He is now asking for a seventh loan so that he can add on another room and have more comfortable living conditions. José is considered to be a professional with much teaching experience who does his work in the classroom with much love. He is a modest and responsible man with a strong wish to continue his education. He is grateful to Kiva partner AFODENIC because with his previous loans he improved his house and his living conditions. His dream is to have a nice home with all the conveniences, as well as steady work so that he can help his son do well.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to add a room to his house

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun T., 42, is married and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her six children. Her husband moved to work in Phnom Penh City as a construction worker with an income of US$8 per day. She has made up her mind that she wants to take a loan of US$700 to create a business of selling groceries at her house with the assistance of her children. If she succeeds in her business plan, she will find a job suitable for her husband to work back in his hometown.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her new grocery store

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda D. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received no formal education. Hilda sells provisions and mineral water at Amissano in Elmina, which she has done since 2003. Her husband is a cleaner. Hilda uses her income to pay bills. Hilda will use the loan to purchase more provisions for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hilda plans to reinvest.

loans.use: Hilda will use the loan to purchase more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Fatima del Rosario R. labora en su propia pulpería ubicada en el departamento de Chinandega donde ofrece todo tipo de productos los cuales son comercializados en su sector.

Hoy en día, la señora Fátima atraviesa una necesidad y es la de invertir a lo inmediato en su negocio y es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para solicitar dicho crédito y de esta manera mejorar su condición del negocio y lograr la satisfacción de todos y cada uno de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fatima de Rosario R. works in her own mini market, which is located in the Chinandega department. She offers all types of products that are sold in her area. Fatima now needs a loan to invest immediately in her business. That is why she has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan. This way she will improve the condition of her business and be able to satisfy each one and all of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Loicith

texts.es:
La señora Loicith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 33 años, y madre de una hija, que aun dependen de ella.

Loicith, es una mujer luchadora que se dedica al servicio de Internet y a la venta de abarrotes, nos cuenta que se siente muy bien con lo que hace.

En la actualidad ya es conocida por sus clientes, que a diario acude a su Internet, cuenta con maquinas modernas, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará cables de red, para implementar mejor su cableado y con parte del dinero también invertirá en la compra de abarrotes. 

Loicith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante hasta donde Dios le de las fuerzas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.

loans.use: Comprará cables de red, para mejorar su cableado.

loans.name: Raikul's Group

texts.en: The heroine of this story is a great example of having firm goals and steadfastness to achieve them, neglecting all the ups and downs on the way. The leader of the group, Raikul is forty six years old. An unsuccessful marriage and subsequent divorce did not shake her belief in life and happiness. She has raised her children on her own and her two sons have grown up and become mature. They received all her love and have absorbed all her efforts to inspire in them family values. Now the eldest son always helps his mother. He works in a brick factory. The little son, 18, has gone to serve in the army. As to Raikul, she is engaged in animal husbandry and cattle breeding. Some years ago she bought a calf from her sister and that is how she got involved in this business. She quickly grasped the aspects of this occupation and her earnings have allowed her to pay for her eye treatment and buy better food for home. She has lots of plans about making repairs to her house and building a convenient shed, but before that, she wants to get a loan to buy a milk cow. Selling milk would bring in more money for the family budget. Raikul has three partners: Kyialbek, Nurgulya and Jumakan: Kyialbek, 33, raises livestock. Kolkhoz gave him a cow instead of a salary and Kyialbek managed to increase the total population and improve his living standards. He hopes to obtain a loan to buy a calf. Nurgulya, 24, is a housewife with two children. Besides that, she keeps some cattle and sells milk. The earnings from what she does have tremendously helped her husband buy a house. Nurgulya feels inspired to buy one more cow to increase her income. However, she needs a loan to do that. Jumakan, 49, is the mother of four children. Together with her husband they raise cattle and thus provide for themselves, as their children are grown-ups and live separately. Jumakan wants to buy a cow. This loan would enable her to make this purchase. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora MARTHA YOLANDA D. I. tiene 65 años de edad, vive en el distrito de MACHE , provincia de OTUZCO, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.  Es madre soltera  tiene un hijo de 21 años a quien lo apoya económicamente porque se encuentra estudiando en una Universidad de Trujillo.
Presenta estudios hasta 6to de Primaria porque desde pequeña se dedicó junto con sus hermanos y padres al campo, luego al quedar embarazada a los 18 años de edad y al no contar con el apoyo del padre de su hijo se dedicó a trabajar en casa, luego empezó a  criar cuyes y vender hasta poco a poco, y con gran esfuerzo, logró tener su tienda de abarrotes y útiles de escritorio.
MARTHA   se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios y útiles de escritorio en la tienda que  tiene en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles empezó a comprar sus primeros útiles de escritorio: cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices, borradores, goma , colores, etc
Con el crédito de 1,000 lo invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios al mayor como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergente, jabón, gaseosa, etc para abastecer su tienda.
MARTHA sueña con abastecer su tienda y tener todo lo que sus clientes le solicitan para poder vender mas y obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: compra de productos alimenticios : arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergente, jabón, gaseosa, etc

loans.name: Vianney

texts.es:
La señora Vianney es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón Pampuyo” ubicado en el centro poblado de Corazón Pampuyo del distrito Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno; tiene 32 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos, vive en el Barrio Santa Rosa, ella estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde, la señora también se dedica a la cría de ganado mayor.

Su mayor deseo es hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar su capital.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones, los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Ms. Vianney is a member of the Community Bank “Corazón Pampuyo” located in the population center of Corazón Pampuyo in the district of Pomata, Province of Chucuito and department of Puno. She is 32 years old. She is in a civil marriage and has three children. She lives in Ticaraya. She didn’t have the opportunity to follow her studies. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years. She began her loan with the amount of $100 (300 PEN), which allowed her to increase her capital for her business of buying and selling sheep. Now, she requires a new loan of $375 (1000 PEN), which will allow her to buy sheep to fatten. She also raises large livestock. Her biggest desire is to grow her business and increase her capital. She likes meetings, savings, and lectures.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Maura

texts.en: Maura I. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 51 years old, is married, and has three adult-aged children. Maura owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Maura joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Maura is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 21st from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeurn P. is single and lives in Kandal Leu village in Kandal province. She is a grocer. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy grocery goods to sell to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to sell to earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional supplies of ingredients in bulk for her café.

loans.name: Yahira Yaneth

texts.es:
La señora Yahira S. es una persona muy trabajadora y se ha destacado por vender ambulantemente ropa y cosméticos movilizándose en diferentes lugares con el fin de obtener los ingresos para abastecer las necesidades de su  hogar.

La dificultad que hoy en día ella atraviesa es que no tiene la ropa ni los cosméticos para comercializarlos y por eso es que espera muy confiadamente en que la institución le brindará el crédito porque ella sabe que una vez que los tenga en su mano procederá a hacer uso de su potencial creativo con el que logrará vender toda la mercadería y generar los ingresos para su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
Yahira S. is very hardworking and works as a street vendor selling clothes and cosmetics in different locations for the purpose of earning income to provide for household needs. The difficulty she is going through at present is that she does not have any clothes or cosmetics to market and therefore she really hopes that the organization will offer her the loan because she knows that once she has them in her hands she will make use of her creative potential and will manage to sell all the merchandise and generate income for her economic development.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and clothes for resale

loans.name: Dolgorjav

texts.en:
Dolgorjav is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  His oldest son attends the local secondary school while the youngest has not reached school age. 

Dolgorjav operates a raw material trading business in his local market. He began the business in 2000 and continues to trade raw materials such as sheep and goat skins to local retailers. At first his working capital was 500,000 tugrugs (~350 USD). This business is the only source of income for Dolgorjav’s family and he is determined to expand his customer base and product offerings in order for his family to become financially secure. Now his working capital exceeds 3,000,000 tugrugs (~2100 US). He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase more sheep and goat skins for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep and goat skins

loans.name: Robai

texts.en:
Robai K. S. is forty years old, a widowed lady with five children aged between twenty-five and ten years. Her business is located at Serem in Kakamega and is situated in a busy market. For the last nine years she has been engaged in selling tomatoes, 'sukumawiki' (a popular green vegetable), onions and cabbages.

She also sells charcoal and firewood. She is using her loan to buy maize, beans, and charcoal to expand her business.

She sells her products to the local people and the major challenge she has is so many people engaging in the same kind of business as hers, thus customers have too many merchants to choose from. There are also debtors who have problems paying for the goods gotten on credit from her. However, she works very hard to make ends meet and she hopes to be supplying wholesale. She dreams of educating her children and building a nice residential house.

loans.use: Maize, beans, and charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mirwais

texts.en: Mirwais M. D., a resident of Kabul, Afghanistan, lives in a house requiring extensive repairs. Married with six children, he lacks sufficient personal funds to effect the repairs, and is therefore requesting a loan of 50000 Afghani for this purpose.  The repairs will allow him to live comfortably with his family members.  Mirwais is glad that this kind of effective process exists in Afghanistan to help support people.

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.es:
La señora Sofía es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito y provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudio hasta sexto de primaria, se dedica a la venta de artesanías.

Sofía nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar lana, bayeta, hilos, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es incrementar sus ventas y capacitarse mejor.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias y las capacitaciones que imparte la promotora.
texts.en:
Sofía has been a partner for three years in the “San Juan de Dios” Community Bank. She lives in the district and province of Lampa, department of Puno. She is 53 years old, married and has 3 children. She studied until 6th grade and sells crafts. Sofía tells us that her first loan come from “Movimiento Manuala Ramos,” which was S/. 300.00 and increased her capital. She will request a loan of S/. 500.00 which will enable her to buy wool, flannel, thread, etc. Her future dream is to increase her sales and be better trained. What she likes most about her community bank are the meetings with the members and the training courses offered by the promoter.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool, flannel, thread, etc.

loans.name: Jose Lupario

texts.es:
el señor Santos Lupario F. vive en el barrio Nueva Esperanza de la ciudad de nacaome, tiene 25 años y es padre de una niñita de un año.
junto a su esposa atiende una pulperia de su propiedad.
a partir de las 4 de la mañana sale junto a su esposa a vender baleadas, café, osmil y otros alimentos para desayunar, el resto del dia atiende a sus clientes en su pulperia.
Santos esta solicitando el credito para surtir mas su pulperia, dice sentirse contento ya que esta viendo que su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco. 
 
Santos Lupario goza de buena reputacion tanto en su familia como en su comunidad y su sueño es convertir su pulperia en un mercadito.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Lupario F. lives in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood of the city of Nacaome. He is 25 years of age and has a one-year-old daughter.

He and his wife run their own general store. Starting from 4am, they go out to sell baleadas (wheat flour tortillas filled with beans and other ingredients), coffee, oatmeal, and other breakfast foods. The rest of the day, he attends to his customers at the general store.

Santos is requesting a loan so that he can stock up his general store. He states that he is happy because he can see that his business is growing little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
