loans.use: Purchase rice, lard, cooking oil, beans, bread, cookies, pastries, eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of millet

loans.name: Bopha's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Bopha M. is a 29 year old, married woman. She is a village bank president who was selected by 11-members, located in Toul Krosang village in Kandal province. The members will use the loan for several different purposes. Mrs. Bopha M. is a shell seller who can earn a small income to support her family living. Her husband, Mr. Veasna Sovann, is a motorcycL. taxi driver. Mrs. Bopha M. is requesting for a loan to add her saving to purchase a new motorbike for supporting her husband business. Mrs. Bopha M. is a mother of three children; two are students in the local school whiL. the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To add her saving to purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Simon Simanko

texts.en:
Simon Simanko N. is a 24-year-old gentleman who is married to Kisalu N.. Simon, who also is called 'Sammy', has been in the cash crop farming business for the last five years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET from a friend in his locality who was already a KADET-registered client. This will be his second loan with which he is planning to plant more wheat as it normally does well in this area due to good climactic conditions. He also plans to buy some livestock. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming.

He has dreams of becoming a large-scale farmer in his area.

loans.use: Plant more wheat and buy livestock

loans.name: Munhtuya

texts.en:
Munhtuya S., 40, lives with her husband and their 20-year-old son in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She runs a grocery store and movie rental service. She has been operating her store since 2003, when Munhtuya and her family built the store on their plot of land. Over the past seven years, she has successfully expanded her original grocery business, while also starting a movie rental service for extra income. Between 1996 and 2003, Munhtuya operated a vegetable trading business at the Huchir Shonhor market.
Munhtuya is a very hardworking person who has a great business mind. She has gained significant experience in her years as a trader. Munhtuya is focused on the future and says, “My goal is to expand my grocery store into a general store. In addition, I have been planning to build a workplace near the grocery store to rent out to other businesses.” She is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to expand her grocery store and purchase inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita V. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Lolita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a business selling peanuts in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw peanuts & working capital. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Mai N. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is Able. She is 47 years old, single and she has four children who range from 18 to 29 years old. She was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to lack of financial support.

For 11 years Mai has been selling building materials such as zinc, shovels, nails, paint, brushes, steel rods, and so on, at Redlight Market in Paynesville on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 12,000 LRD portion of this 52,000 LRD group loan to buy more building materials.

Her plan is to expand her business, travel abroad, and extend her business contacts and continue to support her family so that they can have a better future.

In the photo Mai is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more building materials such as zinc, shovels, nails, paint, brushes, steel rods.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo es un emprendedor hombre de 23 años, comparte su vida con su esposa Mireya de 24 años. Ambos viven juntos en casa de sus suegros. Hace mas de 5 años, se dedica en la fabricación de puertas, ventanas, entre otros objetos de metal, en el taller que le pertenece a su suegra. Cuando se unió con su esposa, ambos decidieron trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante el negocio familiar. Wilfredo al ver a  su suegro todas las ganas y el empeño que le pone a su trabajo, él también desea trabajar con ese mismo empuje, siendo el único fin, de mejorar este taller de fabricación. Por otro lado su suegra se encarga de la administración, es así que Wilfredo y su familia distribuyen el trabajo. En un futuro, desea instalar su propio negocio, solo espera que el taller de su suegro este bien constituido y no necesiten de su ayuda. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y siempre se caracterizó por ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará materiales para completar el trabajo de fabricación de puertas.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a 23 year old, enterprising man. He shares his life with his 24 year old wife, Mireya. They live together in his in-laws’ house. He has been making doors, windows, and other objects from metal for over five years. He does this in the workshop that belongs to his mother-in-law. When he got together with his wife they both decided to work very hard to get the family business ahead. Upon seeing how his father-in-law worked with so much desire and effort, Wilfredo also wants to work with this same drive. His sole purpose is to improve this manufacturing shop. On the other hand, his mother-in-law is in charge of the administration of the business. That is how Wilfredo and his family divide the work. In the future he wishes to set up his own business. He only hopes that his father-in-law’s shop is well established, and that they do not need his help. This is his second loan with MFP. He has always been characterized as being very responsible with his payments. He will use the requested loan to buy materials to complete his work of making doors.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to finish making things from metal

loans.name: Anala Luisa

texts.es: Ana Luisa tiene 37 años, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos a su cargo. Ambos están estudiando en secundaria. La señora se dedica al negocio de elaboración de tortillas, las cuales comercializa de forma ambulante, pese a que también las personas que ya la conocen llegan a su casa a comprar sus productos, Ella además de esto vende ropa usada, esto los distribuye de manera ambulante, sus inicios se dan hace 10 años, esto fue producto de la falta de trabajo y necesitaba una fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener. Este crédito será para la compra de  compra de maíz  pues es importante para la elaboración de tortillas. Su sueño siempre ha sido, que con las utilidades obtenidas del negocio pueda construir su casa, ya que actualmente vive en casa de su mama.
texts.en:
Alma Luisa, age 37, is a single mother with two children under her care. Both of the children are in high school. Alma makes tortillas and sells them in an itinerant manner. The people who already know her come to her house to buy her products. She also sells used clothes, which she distributes in an itinerant manner. She started ten years ago because she did not have work, and she needed a source of income to support her children. With much effort she has been able to support them. She will use this loan to buy corn, which is very important in order to make tortillas. Her dream has always been to be able to build a house with the profits from her business. She currently lives in her mother’s house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla Patricia tiene 41 años, ella tiene 2 hijos que están bajo su cuidado. Ella se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de venta de recarga y frijoles. Por lo que tiene más de 5 años, ya que anteriormente había realizado un financiamiento porque le permitió tener un capital de trabajo adicional, con lo que compró de contado de esta manera sus ganancias aumentaron y logró beneficiar más a su hogar.es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de recarga y frijoles que es lo que más solicitan sus clientes. Siempre está pensando en obtener otro medio de ingreso como es una pulpería.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia is 41 years old, and she has two children under her care. She sells phone card recharging services and beans. She has been in this line of work for five years. She had a previous loan, which allowed her to have additional working capital. She used it to buy for cash. That way her earnings increased and helped her household more. She is requesting a loan to buy phone card recharges and beans. Her customers request these items the most. She is always thinking of another way to get income like a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa B. is from the village of Bayabo East. She is 31 years old. Marissa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marissa owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables in the local community. Marissa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marissa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marissa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Laurentina Naife

texts.pt:
Laurentina Naife Nhachegul nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane, Sul de Moçambique casada e mãe de um filho que esta a estudar na Universidade pedagógica. Fez a 7ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições. Vive na casa própria e não responsabiliza se por ninguém. 

Saiu da cidade natal para Namaacha quando seu pai foi alocado para trabalhar naquele distrito. Tem um negocio próprio de venda de refeições na fronteira da Suazilândia, conta com ajuda de 2 empregadas que ajudam no estabelecimento e em casa. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt a 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 8.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrigerantes e cervejas) para acompanhar as refeições dos seus clientes. Os 2 anteriores empréstimos foram de (6.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt) foram também para a mesma actividade.

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo estipulado e pedir um novo empréstimo para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Laurentina Naife was born in the Inhambane Province, South of Mozambique. She is married and the mother of one son who goes to college (education). She finished 7th grade but didn't finish school due to the lack of conditions. She lives in her own house and doesn't support anyone. She left her hometown to go to Namaacha when her father was transferred there for work. She has her own business selling meals at the border with Swaziland. She has two employees who help her in her business and at home. She has an income of between 6,000 and 8,000 per month, which does towards household expenses. She manages to save some money in her savings account. She has never had loans with other banks. This is her third loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva in the amount of 8,500. She intends to buy products (sodas and beer) to accompany her customers' meals. The two previous ones were for 6,000 and 10,000 meticais were used for the same activity. She is confident that she will pay the loan back ahead of time and request a new loan to furnish her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (sodas and beer)

loans.name: God

texts.en:
God A. has multiple businesses. He has a bar, is involved in brewing, the distillation of gin, the buying and selling of produce, and the production and selling of bricks. He employs his two nephews, and most of his customers are area residents.

To start his businesses, God first sold some of his cattle and produce from his farm; then two years ago he went into the brick-laying business in his home area of Ikoba-Myeri, Kyenjojo. Due to the popularity of bricks as building materials, there has been a consistently high demand for his stock.

From all his businesses, this married father of two children earns 450,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis. With this loan, he will be able to purchase more crates of sodas and beer to meet customer demand, which will improve his sales and help him to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and sodas for business expansion.

loans.name: Danilo Santiago

texts.es: El señor Danilo Santiago tiene 35 años, es casado y tiene tres hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El señor se dedica a brindar los servicios de sastrería, cabe señalar el viaja a Managua a comprar la tela y otros productos necesarios. El señor ya tiene 5 años de tener este negocio, lo inicio cuando no encontraba trabajo y necesitaba ofrecerle a su familia lo necesario. Esta solicitando este préstamo con el objetivo de comprar tela, tijera, alfileres entre otras cosas.  El sueño es tener un taller más grande y empezar a realizar mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en: Danilo Santiago is 35 years old, married, and has three minor children under his care.  He works as a tailor, traveling to Managua to purchase fabric and other necessary items.  He has had this business for over five years and started it when he wasn't able to find work but needed to support his family.  He is seeking a loan in order to purchase fabric, scissors, and pins, among other things.  His dream is to have a bigger workshop and to begin to make improvements on his home.

loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella J. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. She is 55 years old. Estrella is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Estrella owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Estrella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Estrella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
Mayra de 27 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes),  vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Hace tres años comenzó a vender productos Yambal para poder ayudar con los gastos a su esposo ya que tiene dos hijos de 3 y 1 años. Ella hace los pedidos de productos cada 15 días y comienza a promocionarlos con una revista. Vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, maquillaje etc. Trabaja recorriendo las calles de Paraíso y vendiendo los productos a sus conocidos y amigas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas, maquillaje para tener mas variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere tener un local para vender los productos y comenzar a construir su casa de cemento ya que ahora es de caña.
texts.en:
Mayra is 27 years old and sells Yambal products.  Yambal is a company which provides female entrepreneurs with the opportunity to make their own independent sales.  She lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a peri-urban area with dirt roads, whose houses are located in the mountains).

Three years ago she started selling Yambal products in order to help her husband with household expenses since they have two children – a 3 year old and a 1 year old.  She makes her product orders every two weeks and begins to market them with a catalog.  She sells perfume, creams, deodorants, make up etc.  She goes door to door in the streets of Paraíso, selling her products to acquaintances and friends.

With her loan she would like to buy perfume, creams and make up in order to have more variety in her products.  In the future she would like to have a store where she can sell her products and start to build a cement house as her house is currently made from cane.

loans.use: Perfume, creams, make up

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa A. is from the village of Bangkal, Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Adelfa owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Adelfa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In July 2009, Adelfa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Adelfa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Adelfa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith R. is from the village of Barangay 17, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Judith is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling green bananas in the local community. She also makes and sells sausage or longganisa. Judith has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Judith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase ingredients. Judith is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Judith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. is a married lady. Her husband is a contractor and they have three children between the ages of fifteen and four, for whom they hope to provide quality education to the university level. 

Esther's business is located in a market known as Kongowea-karama in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the white beaches of the Indian Ocean. She has been selling electrical goods for the last ten years, including sockets, phone cases, batteries, air conditioners and others, to the local people and to other retailers. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 80,000 KES to buy more stocks of electrical goods to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. She describes herself as honest, open minded and focused.

loans.use: To buy more sockets, phone cases, etc. to sell

loans.name: Manos Telarañas Group

texts.es: Mariana Muñoz tiene 47 años y tiene 3 hijos,  dos D. ellos son mayores D. edad y solo uno  es menor D. edad y esta a su cargo. Vive en la zona D. Enace y pertenece al grupo “MANOS TELARAÑAS”. Este grupo es parte D. una organización D. tejedoras que se dedican a la enseñanza D. tejido, donD. Mariana también forma parte, por ello su negocio principal es el tejido al cual se dedica casi 3 años. Ella se inicio por iniciativa propia al tener su último hijo y querer hacerle sus propios ajuares. Visitó un lugar donD. le enseñaron y luego con unas amigas fueron practicando y especializándose en los acabados formando su organización y empezaron con las ventas a sus conocidos y familiares resultando algo rentable para su economía, ya que con ello apoyaba al esposo  a cubrir los gastos principales del hogar e incluso frente a los problemas económicos que el esposo atravesó por un momento pudo suplantar todos los gastos familiares. Su gran meta es poder exportar sus productos para lo cual invertirá el dinero solicitado.
texts.en: Mariana Muñoz is 47 years old and has 3 children, two of them are grownup and only one is underage and under her care. She lives in the Enace area and belongs to the “Manos Telarañas” (“Spider web Hands”). This group is part of an organization of weavers who teach weaving of which Mariana is also a part of which is why her main business to weave which she has been doing for almost 3 years. She began the business by her own initiative when she had her last son and wanted to make his baby clothes. She visited a place where they taught her and later with some of her friends they practiced and specialized in making them especially in their finishing touches. They later formed and organized and began to sell their items to people they knew and family and realized that it was profitable since with it Mariana was able to help her husband meet the household expenses when her husband went through some financial problems. Mariana’s goal is to be able to export her products to which she will use the money loaned.

loans.use: To buy merchandize to export.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma T. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 43 years old. Alma is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Alma has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Alma is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Alma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo L. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 49 years old. Romeo is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Romeo owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Romeo has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Romeo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Romeo is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Romeo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Margaret Njoki

texts.en:
Margaret has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 15 years. She is 42 years old and married to Simon W.. They have five children.

Margaret was introduced to KADET LTD by one of their field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She repaid all her previous loans in full and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer, seedlings and to pay for labour.

In the future Margaret hopes to buy more land and to practise large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seedlings and pay for labour

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: Doña Lucrecia E. P., tiene 27 años D. edad, cursos el sexto año del nivel primario, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica atender una tienda D. consumo diario, lleva 12 años D. experiencia con este negocio, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que se dedica a servicios D. transporte. DeciD. organizar un grupo para solicitar un prestamos que servira para ampliar su capital D. trabajo, cada uno D. los integrantes D. este grupo se dedica al comercio, servicio D. tienda en general y servicio D. transporte. Doña lucrecia quiere tener un negocio surtido.
texts.en:
Lucrecia E. P., 27 years old, in her sixth year of school, has two children. She runs a general store. She has 12 years of experience in this business and relies on the support of her husband, who works in public transport. She decided to organize a group to apply for loans that would help to increase working capital. Each of the members of this group is in sales, running a store, or doing public transport. Lucrecia wants to stock her business.

**Translator's note: The group's name is "Las Azucenas," which means "The White Lilies."

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lelengi

texts.en:
Lelengi, 35 years old and married with five children, owns a small business selling various styles of clothes and shoes in her living place. In operation for one year, her enterprise employs three persons from her community as helpers, and her hours of operation are 6 am until 8 pm daily.

Lelengi has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing bales of clothes and shoes. The loan will allow her to attract more customers and thus earn more profits which will enable her to renovate her house and save money for the future.

loans.use: to increase her business.

loans.name: Maria Nohemy

texts.es:
La señora Maria Nohemy B. tiene 49 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella.
Su esposo se dedica a la fabricacion de balcones, juntos trabajan duro para salir adelante con sus hijos.

La señora Maria Nohemy B. tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion en la colonia San Francisco de la  ciudad de San Lorenzo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria ya que desea surtir su negocio para la epoca de semana santa.
 
Maria es una mujer de buenos principios, seria y responsable.
texts.en:
Maria Nohemy B. is 49 years old, married, and has two children who depend on her.  Her husband makes balconies.  The couple work hard to get their children and themselves ahead in life.

Maria Nohemy B. has a grocery store in her home which is located in San Francisco neighborhood, in the city of San Lorenzo.  She will use this loan to buy groceries since she would like to stock her business for Holy Week.

Maria is a woman with good principles.  She is serious and responsible.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, butter, vegetables, oil, corn flour, wheat flour, toilet paper, coffee and bread

loans.name: Celia Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Celia es socia del banco comunal Jesús De Nazaret de Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 23 años de edad y tiene un hijo menor de edad.
Hace 2 años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de  Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, esto lo hace en sus ratos libres para poder generarse algunos ingresos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,250.00 nuevos soles comprará:  1 esmalte para uñas, 1 base de maquillaje, 1 rubor, 1 sombras, 2 perfumes, 1 colonia,1 talco para pieza, 1 champú, 3 talcos para bebes, 2 jabón liquido.
La venta de los productos cosméticos no generan muchas guanacias pero se puede tener algún ingreso para el hogar y con eso puede ayudar a su pareja.  Está muy agradecida por los préstamos recibidos y las
recomendaciones que da la promotora en cada desembolso.
texts.en:
Celia, 23, is a member of the “Jesús de Nazaret” communal bank in Yarinacocha District, Ucayali Department; she has a minor son.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for two years.  She sells cosmetics in her free time to generate income.

She will use her new, 1250 new sol, loan to buy the following:  1 nail polish, 1 foundation makeup, one blush, 1 eye shadow, 2 perfumes, 1 cologne, 1 talc, 1 shampoo, 3 baby talc and 2 liquid soaps.  

Cosmetic sales don’t generate high profits but they do generate some income for the home that she can use to help her spouse.  She is very grateful for the loans received and for the recommendations her advisor gives her regarding budgeting.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Gunchin-Ish

texts.en:
Gunchin-Ish is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters, aged 21 and 24, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house, in the outer ger (traditional Mongolian felt tent) districts. She sells her handmade hats at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. Gunchin-Ish sews her products with help of her daughters and she sells her handmade hats with help of her husband. 

When they first began their business in 1997, the family made handmade hats at home and sold them at another person’s stall. Now they have about 3,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital at their stall. Gunchin-Ish said “We usually try to make modern hats for our consumers.” 

In order to increase their variety of handmade hats, Gunchin-Ish is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT. In the future, she wants to expand her business with this loan and to be able to build their own hat factory.

loans.use: To purchse more material of handmade hats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy all the appliances he needs at his home.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children, 2 of whom go to school.  Mary sells beans and rice to earn income.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more beans and rice to sell.  She hopes to buy animals in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a business where she sells fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by selling various items at a general store. Delia is seeking to borrow 10,000 PHP ($250) through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables for re-sale purposes.

Delia has been fortunate enough to finance her business activities as of late through a prior loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Miguel De Los Santos

texts.es: El señor Miguel es un pequeños agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe,  junto a su esposa e hijos , los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Miguel desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña la mayor  afectación es no poder contar con el capital suficiente para la inversión de fertilizantes e insumos y darle un buen mantenimiento agrícola  a su cultivo . Agrace Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva la confianza que le brinda para poder salir hacia adelante y algún día poder llegar a ser un gran agricultor.
texts.en: Señor Miguel is a small farmer.  He lives with his wife and children in the Ticuantepe area.  His plans for the future are to be able to improve his living conditions.  Don Miguel has been growing pineapples for several years.  The biggest challenge he faces is not having enough capital to invest in fertilizers and supplies to maintain his crops properly.  He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for the confidence they place in him so that he can get ahead and some day become a large scale farmer.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: G.s. Estrella Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria de los Ángeles es casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como chofer en los buses que viajan a Managua. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a esta actividad que en principio dio inicio por su mama, la cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Ella solicita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de lápiz labial, sombras, brillos, cremas y tratamientos trabaja principalmente por encargos y actualmente posee bastantes encargos. 
El señor Marvin se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, este negocio lo tiene localizado en el mercado aunque en su casa maneja un inventario que proviene de unas cosechas que compra y luego las saca al mercado después de haberlas tenido en su casa. El negocio dio inicio en principio con la experiencia brindada por su mama quien tenía más de 25 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. El solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de una pequeña cosecha de aguacates. Su sueño es instalar un nuevo negocio en su casa para que su esposa también le ayude y no tenga que trabajar en otro lado.
texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles is married and has a four year-old son.  Her husband works as a driver on the buses that travel to Managua.  Her business is selling cosmetics as an itinerant vendor.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  She started out through her mom who sells fruit and vegetables.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying lipsticks, eye shadows, lip gloss, creams and treatments.  She mainly works to order and currently has a number of orders.

Marvin sells fruit and vegetables.  His business is located in the market although he keeps stock in his home which comes from harvests that he buys.  He then takes them to the market to sell.  He started his business with experience provided by his mom who had been working in this business for more than 25 years.  Marvin is requesting a loan to invest in buying a small harvest of avocados.  His dream is to set up a new business in his home so that his wife can also help him and not have to work elsewhere.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, eye shadows, lip gloss, creams and treatments

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where she raises and sells pigs for a living. In addition to raising pigs, Luisa also mills corn to make extra income. She gets up at 5 each morning to open the mill and attend to her pigs. Luisa is requesting a loan of 10,000 lempiras to purchase pigs as well as parts for her corn mill.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and parts for her corn mill.

loans.name: Thercianne

texts.en:
Thercianne is a 49-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur, married with no children.  Her husband sells charcoal and she sells eggs on the wholesale market. 

She has run this business for the past five years, and the profits she has earned have enabled her to provide for her extended family.

She requires this loan to purchase more eggs so that she can continue to earn a profit and renovate her house and put aside savings.

loans.use: to buy eggs for sale.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is 45 years married to Jane. He has been selling second-hand shoes for the last twelve years, making a monthly profit of KES.12,600. He has been loaned KES.10,000 with which he plans to buy ladies and men shoes to sell. With the anticipated profit, he plans to add more stock, and expand his business. In the near future he hopes to open a shoe shop.

loans.use: to  buy ladies and men shoes for sale

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items to sell to customers.  Analyn has been in this business for 3 years. Analyn earns more income from vegetable vending.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Soksan

texts.en:
Soksan is a weaver. She has a supplemental pig farming business. Her husband, Chheang is a construction worker. They have three young children - two sons and one daughter. The family is living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Soksan hopes to expand her pig farming business by buying additional piglets and pig feed.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise and pig feed.

loans.name: Kimweyi Joint Group

texts.en:
Albert is the facilitator of the Kimweyi Joint group. Albert and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Albert and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Albert takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for his family and to have additional maize profits to send his children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Albert had a very good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Albert was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 4 acres of land.

With income from maize sales, Albert will educate his children and invest in a livestock raising business as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Kimweyi Joint group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 4 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sochida

texts.ru: Сочида проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 40 лет. Она разведена. Сочида уже три года как занимается торговлей детской одежды. Кроме того она имеет высшее образование. По профессии она педагог. В этой области работает 19 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара. Она хочет закупить теплые детские брюки и спортивки вместе с бриджами.
texts.en: Sochida lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 40 years old and divorced.  Sochida has been involved in sales of children's clothing for three years.  Besides this, she has a higher education and is a teacher.  She has been working in this field for 19 years.  Sochida is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise.  She wants to buy warm children's trousers and athletic suits with breeches.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяне решила воспользоваться кредитом, так как ей срочно понадобились дополнительные оборотные средства. Татьяна купила место и ей срочно нужен дополнительный товар. Она планирует закупить детские куртки, комбинезоны, теплые костюмчики и платья.
Предыдущий кредит Татьяна погасила досрочно, выплатив на 2,000 грн больше, чем было запланировано. 
С прибыли, полученной за счет предыдущего кредита, Татьяна приобрела новый телевизор. Также она оплачивает преподаателя, который готовит ее дочь к поступлению в колледж.
texts.en: Tatyana decided to request a loan because she urgently needed additional revolving capital.  Tatyana bought a retail outlet and urgently needs additional merchandise.  She plans to buy children's jackets, jumpsuits, warm suits and dresses.  Tatyana repaid her previous loan early, paying off 2000 hryvnia more than she planned.  Using the profit from the previous loan, Tatyana bought a new television set.  She is also paying for the teacher, who prepared her daughter for college entrance exams.

loans.use: to buy children's jackets, jumpsuits, warm suits and dresses

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a resident and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. She is 57 and married with seven children, all adults save for the last born who is still in school. She carries out her farming in her home area of Nkubu in Central Kenya, producing and selling beans, tobacco, maize, and coffee to the local market.

Josphine has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase dairy goats. She says the milk produced will be consumed by the family as well as sold to provide the school fees for the last born child.

She adds that Juhudi Kilimo has been of great support to farmers, but points at poor markets and animal diseases as the major challenges.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
Sonia, vive con su familia, administra una carniceria, este negocio nacio por iniciativa propia, con la ayuda de su familia a sabido salir adelante, hoy en dia cuenta con muchos clientes.
Sonia, necesita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio de venta de carne, por el momento el préstamo será utilizado en la reparación del vehículo en el cual transporta la carne para comercializarla, y si queda saldo comprara una baquilla; espera salir bien con este préstamo, cancelar oportunamente para tener las puertas abiertas y seguir contando con este servicio.
texts.en:
Sonia lives with her family and runs a butcher shop.  This business arose from her own initiative; with help from her family she’s managed to get ahead and today has many customers.

Sonia needs the loan to invest in her butcher shop.  At the moment, the loan will be used to repair the vehicle she uses to transport the meat for sale and if any money is left over she’ll buy a young heifer.  She hopes to have good results with this loan, to repay it on time and have the door open to be able to continue to count on having this service.

loans.use: to repair her meat transportation vehicle.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a married lady with two children ages 9 and 14.  She runs a grocery to earn a living.  She has been in the business for three years.  Her husband also supports her in the business with financing.  Faulu Kenya has been a blessing to her business because she has learned how to save money and access business loans easily.
Doreen has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to extend her business premise and sell cooked food.

loans.use: To extend her business premise and sell cooked food.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is a 28-year-old single man, working in the selling and manufacturing charcoA. since 2000.

Malek's business is highly requested in the region not only because of the expected winter season, so that people use it to stay warm, but also for the big request by Hookah lovers, who are increasing in a very fast way these days.

Malek is requesting a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua, in order to increase his charcoA. capitA. through buying extra wood and to prepare it for the expected winter season. 

Malek is a hard working man. He also works in planting and harvesting speciA. Hookah tobacco, which most of his customers think it is the best tobacco they ever tasted.

Malek hopes to increase his business  more and more in the future, through opening a wholesale store, capable of storing a huge amount of charcoA. in the future.

loans.use: to increase his charcoal capital through buying extra wood and preparing it for the expected winter season.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 44-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has five children ages 20, 18, 15, 9, and 5. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because he is a relative of her husband. In 2006, Kadiatu established her local foodstuff business. She began her business because she wants to assist her husband in providing support to the family. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,600,000 leones (SLL) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 leones. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid her first loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy garri, bulgar, beans, and groundnuts for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 350,000 leones. In the future, Kadiatu plans to rent a big store, build a house, and give her children a quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy garri, bulgar, beans, and groundnuts for her business

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is 26 years old with 2 children who are at school age.  She is managing a business that focuses on collecting scrap products and selling for some  private workshop. This activity has run for 10 years.  Joining our credit program in 2007, she has used loans effectively in expanding her business.  Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnamese dong to buy more scrap products. Profit from her business was used to buy more house devices.

loans.use: to buy more scrap products for selling.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Angela; ella tiene 42 años de edad y La socia es natural de Acomayo, Ella es casada y tiene 1 hijo,la socia ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de mates,la socia vende mates en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche,aceite y galletas,por medio de estos epqueños negcoios la socia saca adelante a su hijo,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los mates . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para que haga los mates como manzanilla,cebada y azucar al por mayor y tambien para comprar arroz,aceite,galletas y leche.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This is Angela. She is 42, married with one child, and from Acomayo. Her business is selling mate [a traditional infused drink]. She sells mate on the street from 8:00 am to 3:00 pm. She also has a grocery store where she sells basic staples such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, and cookies. Thanks to these small businesses, she is able to get her child ahead. Her dream is to have a storefront to sell mate. She is requesting this loan for the wholesale purchase of ingredients for making mate, such as camomile, barley and sugar, and also for the purchase of rice, oil, cookies and milk.
She is very grateful for this loan and deeply appreciates it. It will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to repay her quotas as established.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making mate wholesale, such as camomile, barley and sugar, and also for the purchase of rice, oil, cookies and milk.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 34 years old, married to Samuel, and they have been blessed with three children. She has been rearing pigs and selling maize for the last five years, earning a monthly income of Kes 10,000.

She is borrowing her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 30,000, which she intends to use to purchase pig feed and maize stocks.

Her dream is to educate her kids.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and maize stocks for her business.

loans.name: Argentina

texts.en:
My name is Argentina B.. I sell new clothing for women and babies. I have had my business for three years. I have a good customer base already. I sell my clothes in different offices. My business generates enough to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory to have a greater variety of products. I hope to use the profit to remodel my house and pay for my son\'s education.

Loan Use: Purchase baby clothes, brasiers, blouses, trousers, socks

Mi nombre es Argentina B. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva para damas y bebes, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mi clientela es muy buena ya que mi producto lo vendo en diferentes oficinas de trabajo, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mas variedad de productos y asi poder tener mayores ventas y con la ganancia que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion, el sustento de mi familia y el estudio de mi hijo.

loans.use: compra de ropa para bebes, brasiers, blusas, pantalones, calcetines, buzos, calzones

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is 52 years old and a mother of 6 children. She is a single parent and caters for the family needs as well as their schooling. To be able to do this, she sells flour and other pastry ingredients at the Central Business District in Takoradi. She has done this business to get her first son through first grade technical school. She took part in the TEACH sessions of Kraban Support Foundation in October, 2006. She wants Kiva to assist her with the loan to increase her capital base.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Mrs. Itohan O. is 42 years old and married with four (4) children. She sells fresh fruit to her community. She wishes to borrow $400 to buy more stock.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fruit for sales
